story:
Time management and support are the only obstacles I have at the moment, Ive tried to get help with coloring my illustrations before considering doing all the work myself. My main issue is not having fast computer equipment and updated software to give the book the look and feel of a standard children's books that are out today. I know I will do more than an exceptional job as I have done for companies as a in house contract designer. I will treat this project no different than projects I work on for other companies. I have a deadline set and will reach my goals.

Driving book sales may be an issue seeing as how digital download is very popular but getting the book into the hands of children who like interactive books is the ultimate goal. 

I'm having so much fun with implementing elements to the book that I know the targeted age group will enjoy. All I can do is remain positive that with the work Ive already done that people will have confidence that I will produce a good quality product. 

The book will not focus on one gender or race. I have thought about it and I want the book to be general to all children.

Thank you for your time.

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Anna and my classmates and I have an event we are hosting called Lights, Camera, Comics: Superhero Improv. We have been given the opportunity to host this event at ACME Comics in Longwood, Florida on June 7th, but in order to make it happen, we need to raise money for costumes. 

This event is very important to us and the cast involved. Not only is it a wonderful learning experience, but we hope the improvisation show will bring laughter and fun to people of all ages through superheroes, live music, dancers, and (fingers crossed) costumes. 

This is where we need your help.

We have a cast of 12. While some of our cast members have costumes, a majority do not. Sure, anyone can pretend with pots as helmets and robes as capes, but we want our show to be as authentic as possible. As a team, we have worked on this project for months and it is now time to execute it. 

After pricing different costumes, we are in need of $1,500 to make sure all of our actors not only have sufficient costumes but props as well. With every donation (regardless of size) you will be a superhero to us!

We understand not everyone can monetarly give, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please spread the word about Lights, Camera, Comics and hopefully, we will see you on June 7th, 2014 at ACME Comics.  

Thank you!


The cast having fun after a rehearsal session.

CREATOR: Adam Post is a creator of comic book properties including: CHROMIUM MAN, VAMPIRE GIRLS, and COLLEGE OF THE DEAD

WRITER: Stefan Petrucha is a writer of comics and novels including: X-FILES,  DEADPOOL: PAWS, SPIDER-MAN: FOREVER YOUNG and CAPTAIN AMERICA: DARK DESIGNS

ARTIST: Javier Sanchez Aranda is a comic book artist for STAR TREK, LEGO STAR WARS and DUNGEONS & DRAGONS

 

NEW Exclusive ! COVER for COLLEGE OF THE DEAD BOOK TWO !

 

INTERIORS FOR COLLEGE OF THE DEAD  !

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

COMIC BOOK

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD 140 page, perfect bound comic book printed in glorious black and white with color covers.  

 

ASHCAN

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD ASHCAN with 100 new pages of full script presented alongside the resulting pencil layouts.

 

ART BOOK

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD ART BOOK — the original 252 art panels from the comic book presented in a pristine, dynamic format with NO LETTERING, ART ONLY. The ART BOOK is printed one panel per page in a high quality 260 page, 8½  inches by 8½ inches in a square Art book.

story:
Short Summary

As we stated earlier we want to not only publish our own titles but give creators the means to get their work published and give them a chance they might not otherwise have ever gotten.

Our names are Winston Jordan and Michael Armstrong. We both reside in Memphis, TN.

We are both creative minds who have worked on the comic entitled Dragon Trio for months. 

When our relationship with our previous publisher ended we decided to start Inkpot Comix. So many creators are in a similar boat and under the first of a publisher as far as creative control, release schedules and even rightfully due royalties! We want to be the company that changes this injustice!

  We plan on not only publishing our own titles, but giving so much hidden talent the ability to do the same, always retaining complete creative control and reaping 70% of their profit. A much more lucrative deal than the scraps most other companies leave creators for their hard work. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need an excess of at least 500.00 to get things really going. We do not intend for crowdfunding to support our entire venture just enough to really get it moving. Printing costs, website construction and maintenance, things of that nature. If you want to pledge more..then thank you! We appreciate it!

 

Those who pledge will be entitled to a number of perks. 

If you yourself own a business or offer a service, you can earn a permanent ad (designed by Winston Jordan)for said business or service in one of, two of or even all of our titles depending on the amount of your pledge. Even for smaller pledges we plan to offer copies of our titles autographed by Winston Jordan and Michael Armstrong personally made out to the contributor expressing heartfelt thanks, even mentions of appreciation in the indicia of our comics.

The Impact

Your contribution will help Inkpot thrive and help a creator who has become discouraged and feel their work will never see the light of publication

  • While we will have obvious quality guidelines with the submissions we accept we plan to be understanding in knowing this is many creators first shots at this.
  • Michael and I produced the successful Dragon Trio series for months under another publisher.
  • We vow your money will be well spent in reaching this goal of getting this undiscovered talent published!.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • As with any business venture there are always hurdles.
  • We plan on implementing numerous strategies to help deal with the hurdles of a new publishing business...such as limited print runs until a book proves it is worthy of larger ones, etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Even if you cannot contribute, a share is just as helpful! Tell your friends!

story:
Short Summary

The Beat Up Your Dad Comedy Tour consists of five stand-up comedians--Connor King, Stephanie Grammar, France Armstrong, William Montgomery, and Lila Bear--who have made a splash in the emerging Memphis, Tennessee and Oxford, Mississippi comedy scenes. After working together in open mics and other shows, we have decided put our skills and chemistry to the test in the form of a state-wide tour of MS with a few stops in Tennessee (Memphis), Alabama (Mobile), and Louisiana (New Orleans). The tour will last about 10 days, starting in Oxford at Proud Larry’s and ending in Oxford at the Beat Up Your Dad Comedy Cookout—an outdoor party featuring region-wide comics and local bands. Mississippi is starting to develop a taste for the entertainment industry, with more and more films being shot in the state. We feel that with this tour, Mississippi will have an opportunity to see the how well comedy plays into the exciting opportunities for entertainment in the state. We all have a passion to work in the field of comedy, and we think that this tour will help get the South’s name on the map in a way that could not be done without it.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to afford food, lodging, travel, merchandise, and the cookout for the tour, we will need $3050. $600 of the funds will be used as (6) $100 food per diems for each person going on the tour (five comedians and one documentarian, Christina Huff). $550 of the funds will go to cheap lodging each night of the tour ($55 for each ten nights). $750 of the funds will cover travel. $700 will cover paying for all merchandise: t-shirts, koozies, buttons, and posters.The remaining $450 will go to funding the cookout. An exhaustive budget for the tour can be found on the attached spreadsheet. Perks for donating include the aforementioned merchandise.

story:
Ward Dizzley's True Life Action Adventure Comics Digest is HERE, folks!

That's right. The wait is OVER. Finally the further adventures of Hoot and Chief, the now legendary men who brought you Mesa Verde Times and other Mouse House tomfoolery, come to you in comic book form! Every adventure 100% TRUE. In fact, so true you'll get sick to your stomach when you learn of the crazy shit that forged these two young men into the mid-life super heroes! 

Here's the Score.

 Issue number one is completely finished. Drawn, colored, ready for print! This isn't as much a fundraiser as it is a way to pre-order the hard copy version of this lovely comic.  If you contribute ($25 or more. See "perks") YOU WILL receive a signed first run copy of Issue Number One! When we hit our goal we can have a batch printed. 

Folks, you won't find true stories like these anywhere else and issue #1 is going to be limited to 500 copies. Don't miss out! You'll hate yourself if you miss this.

story:
Hello, My name is...

Hi, I'm Sandy. I write and draw books that provide inspiration and encouragement and teach people how to be creatively confident. 

I have been an illustrator my entire life. I drew on walls as a kid, did cartoons for a local newspaper as a teen, and started sending out my children's book manuscripts when I was 15. 

I also wanted to be an Egyptologist (like Indiana Jones). I went to Brown University for the archaeology, then transferred to the School of Visual Arts in NYC, then back to Providence for Rhode Island School of Design, where I got my BFA in Illustration, in 1992. Next stop (25 years later!) is the Center for Cartoon Studies for my Masters.

The other half of the "team" is - Lilah Amaret - my 9 year old daughter, art director, collaborator and character designer. She is the creator of the world famous "Lilah Beans"- our lovable, but sneaky minions who find their way into everything, especially artwork, and the cookie jar.

What was I thinking!?

It's NOT a mid-life crisis... maybe more of a teenage rebellion (30 years late)... but I am going back to school to get my Masters in Applied Cartooning. This is a very tough program and I am both terrified and out-of-my-mind excited! I've survived the First Year, also known as "Boot Camp" and I am about to embark on my Senior Year... "Year Two".

So what's my project?

A blog-documentary-zine-class-comic-adventure...thing... 

Blogumentary? Comicventure?

Why do this?

• I love writing and illustrating! Especially childrens' books, creativity books and drawing books. I've written and illustrated eight books so far and been a part of many others.

• I've been blogging since 2008. Some of my other blogs are: Beez In The Belfry, and Zentangle for Kidz!

• Crossing boundaries between art forms - i.e.: graphic design and Zentangle and illustration and comic books - gets me SO excited. And I'm constantly looking for new things to learn. And then mash-up.

• I'd like to create more books and self-publish them. The first step is to learn the skills that I feel I am missing - to learn the things I don't know that I don't know! Back to school!

• The First Year was really tough - a "boot camp." But I survived. I learned drawing and writing techniques, computer, production, and marketing skills - and I shared them all with my Kickstarter supporters! Year Two will be a new challenge - with Professional Practices and planning out my Thesis Project.

• I need the accountability of you, my blog readers, to get out of bed in the morning and go to class. Seriously - knowing I can share all this amazing knowledge with you all at the end of the day IS my reason for doing what I do.

What I Need & What You Get

Me: "I need money! Moola. Cash!"

Oh? You already figured that out? Well, I need money for tuition, but I also need money for printing comics and other books I am self-publishing. And I need to upgrade my technology to design and print those comics. The more money I can raise, the more books I can create.

You: "What's in it for me?"

You get the experience of going to Cartoon School without the stress, sleepless nights, spilled ink, and lack of talent!

You: "Cool. But what do I GET?"

$25 - FRIENDS! Everyone at this level and higher will get the "Glyphs and Glitches" blog sent directly to their email inbox.

$35 - COMIC FRIENDS! Everyone at this level and higher will get the Comic Edition of the blog sent to your email.

$50 - DIGITAL FRIENDS Everyone at this level and higher will get all three of my Inspiration Sketchbook pdfs to download. The three ebooks are "The Tangles of Kells," "The Tangles of Santa Fe," and "The Bauble Tree."

$125 - FRIENDS with STUFF will get a package of my books! Including: signed copies of "The Tangles of Kells" and "The Tangles of Santa Fe" books, Zentangle for Kidz!, Tangled Fashionista, the BRAND NEW The Fright Before Christmas comic book and We Will Never Leave You comic/coloring book. I'll also include a pack of Tangle cards, tattoos, stickers, pins... and anything else that might fit.

 $200 - INSPIRED FRIENDS You get all that other stuff as well as the "Inspiration Sketchbook - Comic Bootcamp" as soon as it is completed. It will have sketches, comics, and illustrated notes from the First Year at Cartoon School. 

$500 - DEVOTED GROUPIES You get all that other stuff as well as PRINT copies of any comics I do during Year Two - and that includes my Thesis project at the end of the year! 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk to completing my project (other than an early demise) is dropping out of school. However, if that did happen - I would continue to blog about it - and I imagine the reasons for leaving school would also make for some very juicy blog posts!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? I get it. 

But that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help me get the word out - post my campaign to your social media sites.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And thanks!!

story:
THE COVER

 

 

THE STORY

 

Self-serving detective Chris Club is hired by psychopathic archvillain Erika Fostra to uncover the secret identity of Blue, the world’s first and only superhero. 

Blue can fly, is invulnerable, and has a decapitating uppercut. He has no reflection, only comes out at night, and never leaves the Centro city limits.

With the help of a cocky comic store clerk named Adam and a teenaged amnesiac named Annie, Club unravels the bizarre truth about who—and what—Blue is.

That truth challenges everything Club believes—and puts a lot of innocent people in harm’s way.

The solution to the mystery is only the beginning of the adventure.


THE FORMAT

 

I love graphic novels, but I've always wanted more text, and didn't want that text covering up the beautiful artwork. 

In the format I developed, the top half of each page is text in two columns. The bottom half is made up of comic book panels with no speech bubbles.

The text focuses on the detective’s journey. The images build the world and give you the clues to the mystery.

The text is in strict first-person point of view; you read only what Chris Club knows, thinks, and learns. The images are in omniscient point of view; you see things Club may or may not ever know.

Whenever I read a graphic novel, I find myself speeding through the speech bubbles and barely paying attention to the artwork. I just wanna know what happens next and I miss visual details.

The point of this format is to slow the reader down. This isn't meant to be rushed through and tossed aside. It's a fascinating universe that you can immerse yourself in. The longer you stay, the more fun you'll have.

When you're done reading the text on a page, you're meant to stop and closely examine each image.

In the third image of the first page I showed you above, the one with Blue's green boots dominating the frame, you can see an onlooker giving Blue the finger. It's a tiny detail that shows you that not everyone thinks Blue is good.

(The middle finger was the illustrator's idea. I just told him that some people in the crowd are cheering and others are sneering. When I saw how he depicted that, I cracked up.)

That's not a huge detail, but if you don't pay close attention to the images, you'll miss important plot points, particularly in the second novel, where the images mostly follow the antagonist while the text focuses on Club.

When you're finished reading Issue 1, go back and read it again and you'll see things you missed the first time. And when you're done reading the whole series, go back and read it all again and you'll find some clue hidden on nearly every page.  I designed it to reward multiple readings.

You can read the first two chapters for FREE here.

 

THE MYSTERIES

 

This is a twisty-turny story that keeps you guessing. There isn't just one mystery here, there are a series of related mysteries that slowly unfold over time. Every time you think you have it all figured out, a new development will pull the rug out from under you.

If you love shows like Black Mirror, The Twilight Zone, Sherlock, Doctor Who, Rick and Morty, LOST, and True Detective, this series will make you very happy. The puzzles in this story lend themselves to pleasurable obsession. 

 

THE TEAM

 

DAVE TERRUSO

WRITER

This is me. I'm a novelist and stand-up comic based in Philadelphia. My first novel Cube Sleuth is available on Amazon.

As a stand-up, I've opened for acts including Gilbert Gottfried, Richard Lewis, Maria Bamford, and Colin Quinn. I was featured on the RISK! podcast episode 350 Out of Bounds. I co-founded Philly Sketchfest, an international sketch comedy festival now in its 11th year.

 

NICK DESTEFANO

ILLUSTRATOR

Nick DeStefano is an illustrator and storyboard artist currently based in Los Angeles.  With nearly a decade of experience in the entertainment industry, his work ranges from comics to music videos to TV & film. 

Nick’s client list includes Disney, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, NBCUniversal, Snap Inc., and others.

 

ERIC BATTLE

COVER ARTIST

Eric Battle’s client list includes Legendary Motion Pictures & Comic Books, Marvel Comics, DC Entertainment, Dynamite Entertainment, Valiant Entertainment, and Dark Horse.

Eric has illustrated many stories of popular icons, from Spider-Man, The X-Men, to Young Justice, the teen superhero group from the Cartoon Network animated series.

His project with George R.R. Martin, Wild Cards, is being developed as a feature film by Universal/SyFy Films.

 

THE BUDGET

 

It cost me roughly $19,000 to produce the first issue of this series:

75 pages of illustrations = $13,500

Cover art drawn, colored, and designed = $800

ISBNs for the series: $575

Printing 1,000 copies = $4,000

And that is with my illustrator and cover artist taking pay cuts because they know I’m not able to afford the full price of their inspired creations. They are amazing partners in this.

I took a loan against my 401k and used my tax return and all the money I made as a stand up comic and freelance proofreader to finance Issue 1. The point of this campaign is to help finance Issue 2 without me ending up in debtor’s prison.

Is debtor’s prison still a thing?

How about indentured servitude?

I don’t want to do either.

 

THE PERKS

 

My perks are based on what I would want as a reader: a look behind the curtain.

The E-book version of Issue 1 includes 16 extra pages of notes and early drafts, the evolution of Blue's suit, and the evolution of the cover art from my terrible sketch to the masterpiece it became. Issue 2 will have a similar amount of extras.

I recorded an audiobook too. In the audiobook, I read the panel descriptions that I wrote for Nick to draw (minus anything spoiler-y). So listening to the audiobook makes clear some things about the images that aren’t spelled out explicitly in the text. You listen to the descriptions and go, “Oh, okay, that WAS Club as a baby. I thought so.”

I'm also offering a 15-minute spoiler-free AMA (Ask Me Anything...about the book) and a document called 16 Secrets from the Alter Ego Universe. 

 

SHIPPING

 

This campaign will ship to the US, Canada, and the UK only.

For the $8, $12, and $20 tiers, there's no shipping required, it's all digital. So that's the way to go if you're outside the US/Canada/UK. You'll get a DropBox link to download your files.

For the $25 and $40 tiers, SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR THE UNITED STATES ONLY. Sorry, Canadian and UKian friends, I love you dearly, but if I included shipping I'd end up losing money on the transaction. 

For the $60 and $150 tiers, SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR THE US, CANADA, AND THE UK.

 

THE DELIVERY TIMELINE

 

Issue 1 is complete. I sent it to the printer on September 12. The paperbacks will arrive on Friday, September 26th, a couple weeks before the campaign ends. I'll upload visual proof as soon as I have it.

Physical copies, E-books, and audiobooks for Issue 1 only will ship within 30 days of the completion of this campaign. I'm shipping Media Mail, which can take up to 9 days to get to you.

Issue 2 will take about 9 months to illustrate and a month to print. I intend to ship Issue 2 in August of 2020.

 


Okay, that's everything.

Wow, I can't believe you read all this. I figured you'd just watch the 2-and-a-half-minute campaign video and have made your decision by the end of it. You're so thorough. You're just the kind of person I want reading my series.

You might even figure out the solution to the mystery of Issue 1 before you get to the end, which would make you pretty cool.

Thank you so much for your time.

Welp, bye for now,

Dave
story_txt:
THE COVER  THE STORY Self-serving detective Chris Club is hired by psychopathic archvillain Erika Fostra to uncover the secret identity of Blue, the world’s first and only superhero. Blue can fly, is invulnerable, and has a decapitating uppercut. He has no reflection, only comes out at night, and never leaves the Centro city limits.With the help of a cocky comic store clerk named Adam and a teenaged amnesiac named Annie, Club unravels the bizarre truth about who—and what—Blue is.That truth challenges everything Club believes—and puts a lot of innocent people in harm’s way.The solution to the mystery is only the beginning of the adventure.
THE FORMAT
 I love graphic novels, but I've always wanted more text, and didn't want that text covering up the beautiful artwork. In the format I developed, the top half of each page is text in two columns. The bottom half is made up of comic book panels with no speech bubbles.The text focuses on the detective’s journey. The images build the world and give you the clues to the mystery.The text is in strict first-person point of view; you read only what Chris Club knows, thinks, and learns. The images are in omniscient point of view; you see things Club may or may not ever know.Whenever I read a graphic novel, I find myself speeding through the speech bubbles and barely paying attention to the artwork. I just wanna know what happens next and I miss visual details.The point of this format is to slow the reader down. This isn't meant to be rushed through and tossed aside. It's a fascinating universe that you can immerse yourself in. The longer you stay, the more fun you'll have.When you're done reading the text on a page, you're meant to stop and closely examine each image.In the third image of the first page I showed you above, the one with Blue's green boots dominating the frame, you can see an onlooker giving Blue the finger. It's a tiny detail that shows you that not everyone thinks Blue is good.(The middle finger was the illustrator's idea. I just told him that some people in the crowd are cheering and others are sneering. When I saw how he depicted that, I cracked up.)That's not a huge detail, but if you don't pay close attention to the images, you'll miss important plot points, particularly in the second novel, where the images mostly follow the antagonist while the text focuses on Club.When you're finished reading Issue 1, go back and read it again and you'll see things you missed the first time. And when you're done reading the whole series, go back and read it all again and you'll find some clue hidden on nearly every page.  I designed it to reward multiple readings.You can read the first two chapters for FREE here. THE MYSTERIES This is a twisty-turny story that keeps you guessing. There isn't just one mystery here, there are a series of related mysteries that slowly unfold over time. Every time you think you have it all figured out, a new development will pull the rug out from under you.If you love shows like Black Mirror, The Twilight Zone, Sherlock, Doctor Who, Rick and Morty, LOST, and True Detective, this series will make you very happy. The puzzles in this story lend themselves to pleasurable obsession.  THE TEAM DAVE TERRUSOWRITERThis is me. I'm a novelist and stand-up comic based in Philadelphia. My first novel Cube Sleuth is available on Amazon.As a stand-up, I've opened for acts including Gilbert Gottfried, Richard Lewis, Maria Bamford, and Colin Quinn. I was featured on the RISK! podcast episode 350 Out of Bounds. I co-founded Philly Sketchfest, an international sketch comedy festival now in its 11th year. NICK DESTEFANOILLUSTRATORNick DeStefano is an illustrator and storyboard artist currently based in Los Angeles.  With nearly a decade of experience in the entertainment industry, his work ranges from comics to music videos to TV & film. Nick’s client list includes Disney, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, NBCUniversal, Snap Inc., and others. ERIC BATTLECOVER ARTISTEric Battle’s client list includes Legendary Motion Pictures & Comic Books, Marvel Comics, DC Entertainment, Dynamite Entertainment, Valiant Entertainment, and Dark Horse.Eric has illustrated many stories of popular icons, from Spider-Man, The X-Men, to Young Justice, the teen superhero group from the Cartoon Network animated series.His project with George R.R. Martin, Wild Cards, is being developed as a feature film by Universal/SyFy Films. THE BUDGET It cost me roughly $19,000 to produce the first issue of this series:75 pages of illustrations = $13,500Cover art drawn, colored, and designed = $800ISBNs for the series: $575Printing 1,000 copies = $4,000And that is with my illustrator and cover artist taking pay cuts because they know I’m not able to afford the full price of their inspired creations. They are amazing partners in this.I took a loan against my 401k and used my tax return and all the money I made as a stand up comic and freelance proofreader to finance Issue 1. The point of this campaign is to help finance Issue 2 without me ending up in debtor’s prison.Is debtor’s prison still a thing?How about indentured servitude?I don’t want to do either. THE PERKS My perks are based on what I would want as a reader: a look behind the curtain.The E-book version of Issue 1 includes 16 extra pages of notes and early drafts, the evolution of Blue's suit, and the evolution of the cover art from my terrible sketch to the masterpiece it became. Issue 2 will have a similar amount of extras.I recorded an audiobook too. In the audiobook, I read the panel descriptions that I wrote for Nick to draw (minus anything spoiler-y). So listening to the audiobook makes clear some things about the images that aren’t spelled out explicitly in the text. You listen to the descriptions and go, “Oh, okay, that WAS Club as a baby. I thought so.”I'm also offering a 15-minute spoiler-free AMA (Ask Me Anything...about the book) and a document called 16 Secrets from the Alter Ego Universe.  SHIPPING This campaign will ship to the US, Canada, and the UK only.For the $8, $12, and $20 tiers, there's no shipping required, it's all digital. So that's the way to go if you're outside the US/Canada/UK. You'll get a DropBox link to download your files.For the $25 and $40 tiers, SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR THE UNITED STATES ONLY. Sorry, Canadian and UKian friends, I love you dearly, but if I included shipping I'd end up losing money on the transaction. For the $60 and $150 tiers, SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR THE US, CANADA, AND THE UK. THE DELIVERY TIMELINE  Issue 1 is complete. story:
We are Cannon Canvas Comics, a small indie comic company that is just starting to get off the ground. We currently consist of co-founders Kevin McVicker and Jon Riggins who are also the creative team on this title and one other comic currently in the works. We also recently were joined by David Fincannon who is a creator and artist on a seperate series, Nobody Else Will. Lucas Bernning also helps as an editor, creative sounding board, and hypeman.
Both of us are life long comic fans and we have a passion for creating comics, yet our funds are meager as we attempt to get our dreams off the ground.
 
With your support we will be able to make print copies of this book, plus create banners, posters, t-shirts, flyers, and stickers (maybe buttons) to take with us to at least one local Convention this summer. We are hoping to get about 100 issues printed as a first run. This will help cover any rewarded here, and the rest will be sold at MonsterCon and any other Cons we are able to attend.
 
Like we said before, we are trying to get our ideas off the ground and create a place for us to pursue our dreams. Your support helps us do this.

If you are unable to finacial support us, please follow us:

facebook.com/ubermenschen2012

facebook.com/cannoncanvascomics

Spread the word and help us build our fanbase.

We thank you for your support.

story:
What is DUZIDA?

For a generation brought up on imported Japanese live action superhero tv shows there's a surprisingly large void that's left to be filled with comics inspired by such things. DUZIDA fills some of that void.

Set in a world where aliens have been living among humans quietly, disguising themselves for billions of years until now. Slowly the Metazurian race are revealing themselves.. and they're not being too pleasant about it. 


Growing to giant size and battling among the skyscrapers in Earth's cities, Guy along with his Metazurian partner Duz team up to become the alien busting hero DUZIDA!!

What's the deal?

As it stands DUZIDA is a webcomic. It's had also had a short run as single issue comic of 20 pages. But now I'm making fast progress on following issues, too fast in fact for the printing of several issues to make sense (even if only on a storage level)

So it's time to take it up a notch. Part way through the second chapter Duzida EXPLODES in to full colour. With your help through this campaign I want to bring the first arc of DUZIDA together as an awesome graphic novel. Not only including the comic itself but also packed to the brim with extra tid-bits like the history and timeline of the DUZIDA world, character designs, sketches, illustrations, break down on the Metazurian race and their origins. 


What does the goal cover?

The total of £850 includes the fund to pay for an initial print run of 100 book, the printing of t-shirts, badges and stickers. And some incredibly awesome DUZIDA belt buckles. So you too can transform and fight off any giant monster threats that may be lurking around the corner.
And of course, the more people who pledge, the bigger the print run can be!

If I happen to reach my goal then I'll add an extra pledge for a FULL SIZE, WEARABLE DUZIDA HELMET.



How else can you help?

Spread the word! Tweet, tumbl, 

Not sure what you'd be buying in to? 
Well the comic is free to read online as a webcomic and will stay that way too. Updates for the webcomic may slow down but it'll still be there for you to check out!

story:
THROUGH THE DUST OF THE EMPYREAN

By Massimo Rosi and Stefano Cardoselli

There is a Kingdom beyond space and time, it's called the Empyrean.

The Empyrean is a Kingdom where only some have the right to enter after death, where all those people who were too eccentric in life or had something more than the others are sent. The Empyrean is also a place where Gods and faiths are created by the Hyperuranian's council, the elder philosophers' conscience that rules the balance of this dimension.

The rulers of this dimension are many and, like in their past lives, they have been conquering and reigning in the Empyrean, creating their Kingdoms, constantly in conflict with each other.

Those Kingdoms are:

  • The Americas, where dead cowboys and the Maya are constantly in conflict

  • The Russian Kingdom, ruled by Ivan the Terrible

  • The Asians are ruled by the last Chinese Emperor who's been driven mad by his past sins.

  • The Greeks protect the passage through the Empyrean and the Hyperuranian. King Leonidas and his army guard it well

  • The Europeans are ruled by a crazy Caesar, of course.

Through the Dust of the Empyrean starts when the Christian God dies. The philosophers send Don Quixote to gather all the Empyrean's rulers, as only they can define a new God or religion.

By rule of the Empyrean, the dead Christian God and his followers are exiled to a sort of Limbo. But not all his followers submit to this rule: people such as Torquemada, Joan of Arc, and others decide to rebel against the Empyrean and the philosophers in a quest to see their dead God on his throne again.

This mad move forces the Empyrean's rulers, constantly at war with each other, to work together to quash this open rebellion; and Don Quixote finds himself involved in a war with the hope of finding a new God for his people.



THROUGH THE DUST OF EMPYREAN will be about A4 size, 18,3X28,1cm, with 120 pages. The book will be available in English, Italian and French!




WHY HELP US?

In order to shareour dark and complex comic book with you, we're looking for your help to import and distribute this Book in United States, Canada, England, Ireland, and Australia.!


WHO WE ARE?

THE ARTIST

Stefano Cardoselli is a Tuscan born artist who has been creating comics since 2000. He's a frequent contributor to Heavy Metal Magazine. Of him, HM Editor in Chief Kevin Eastman has said:

“Stefano Cardoselli — I HATE this guy! I’ve only published everything he’s sent me! I think he can draw his ass off, and look forward to his next contribution.”

Stefano has also worked with 2000AD, Antarctic Press, Blue Water Comics, Dark Slinger Comics and others just to name a few.

THE WRITER

Massimo Rosi is, like Stefano, a Tuscan. He's a young writer and also the CEO of BookMaker Comics. He has written and created many comic books in Italy such as:

Skinwalker, Land of the Brave, Midnight Eyes Ave. and The Fucking Frogman.

He has worked with Stefano before on Necromantical for Ardden Entertainment, and on other projects for international brands. Massimo is also the writer of Death Raye for Titanium Comics.

THE COLORIST

Jimmy Kerast




BOOKMAKER COMICS

BookMaker Comics came about almost by chance in the Spring of 2009, when a group of former students at Scuola Internazionale di Comics decided to gather together in order to give birth to an independent, original, new comics reality. Pushed by the desire to make and publish amazing work, the group soon expanded to involve other young talent who immediately gained success. This allowed BookMaker Comics to expand its editorial plan by producing three different typologies: series, pockets, and anthologies.

Among their important editorial achievements, the original series SKINWALKER was candidate for one of the three best independent series of the year 2012. Trusting its creative, young, and independent spirit, BookMaker Comics became an SAGL company based in Switzerland. The mission of this new entity is to create and promote innovative, energetic comics, as well as expand into other forms of entertainment. Their first foray was a relaunch of a “made in Italy” series, conceived in an American way.

The goal of BookMaker Comics is to create a new kind of comics, enjoyable on a universal level. We are proud of our team which currently consists of around thirty creators (scriptwriters, artists, colorists, letterers, translators and editors), who are all actively involved in numerous projects which will soon see light. BookMaker Comics also had two victories at Full Comics and Games in Milan with LAND OF THE BRAVE (best series) and NERD BASH (best comics for the young audience), while getting two nominations with SKINWALKER (best digital comics) and THE FUCKING FROGMAN (best humorous comics); moreover, our comics have been accepted on the worldwide digital platform Comixology.

We are proud to partner with the likes of Stefano Cardoselli (Heavy Metal, 2000AD) and Alessandro Vitti (Red Lanterns – DC Comics, Secret Warrior – Marvel, and more...).

All this highlights the fact that the independent Italian comics reality is more lively and active than ever.

story:
Hello!

We are three comic creators, Anette, Elise and Diana, and we are the editors of the Freya & Frey anthologies!

Last year we held a very successful crowdfunding for our first anthology called Freya – Sequential Love Stories, which had the theme of female love stories.

Now we are back to follow up last year’s success with the first volume of Frey- A Romantic Comic Collection, an anthology about men’s love stories.


(Cover illustration for the book made by the editors Diana, Anette and Elise)

This is a speedpaint video of when Elise Rosberg colored the cover for the anthology. Enjoy!


What is Frey - A Romantic Comic Collection?

Frey is an indie comic book project. It is an anthology that includes stories made by nine talented Scandinavian comic artists/writers with focus on men's love stories. That means that all of the main characters in Frey define themselves as men and every story is written from men’s point of view with the theme of love between men.

While all of the stories focus on love and romance, some of the artists chose to go even further, depicting the erotic nature of loving relationships.

Unlike Freya – Sequential Love Stories, whose participants were exclusively people identifying within the female spectrum; the participants in Frey – A Romantic Comic Collection are not exclusively men. We, the editors, are sort of female and therefore feel that for us to make an anthology completely from a man’s point of view would not be possible or feel right for us to do. We would be extremely excited and glad if someone somewhere started an anthology (or several) completely made by men from men’s point of view. Sadly, that cannot be us. However, all of the comics in this anthology are either; drawn and written by, written by or has received feedback on its content by someone who identifies within the male spectrum.

So, what is this exciting campaign about?

This is what we need your help with.

  • We are hoping to raise 1500€ to help us pay some of the printing costs of the book, (this will also cover the shipping costs for the gifts we would like to send you as a thank you for your donations).

  • Since this is an indie project, that means that we have no outside funding to print these books, other than the gathered help of the participating artists.

  • If you choose to donate, for example, 15€ (about 16$) we will give you a physical copy of the book and a bookmark as a thank you.
  • Shipping: NOTE that 5€ will be added to your donation for worldwide shipping. For delivery within Sweden, shipping is included in the donation for your chosen perk!
  • Every little bit helps, even if you’re only able to donate 1€, we will be really grateful for your support. We also have other perks and gifts for you who choose to donate a bit more, be sure to check them out.

  • Remember, if you live outside of Sweden, this might be your only chance to get a hold of this gorgeous anthology! We only plan to print a few hundred of them (with no reprints) so if you want it, now is your chance!
    We want to reach as many people around the world as we possibly can with our comics. This campaign is a big part in reaching this goal.

Don’t forget to check in from time to time to see our updates!

Perks!

We would like to thank our donators by giving you gifts!

Here are some of the perk-levels that we are offering, check out the full list to the right on this page (and be sure to CHOOSE THE CORRECT PERK when you donate, so that you receive the perk you desire).




ORIGINAL A5 black and white DRAWINGS (45€ perk level):

ORIGINAL A5 colored DRAWINGS (85€ perk level):


COMMISSION ARTISTS AND DETAILS:

If you are not familliar with commissions, they are when the artist that you commission draws something that you have chosen. It could be a portrait, a picture of your OC or anything you like. Just be sure to read what each artist is willing to draw and take that into consideration before you chose the artist you wish to recieve a commission from. Each artist have a set number of commissions that they will make and each of them have their own perk at the 50€ level. So be sure to pick the right perk with the right artist for you!


ANETTE BENGTSSON
Commission can be: Lineart, grayscale or simple colors.
Size of illustration: Halfbody or fullbody.
Backgrounds: Simple or no backgrounds.
Number of characters per commission: One or two.
Do you draw NSFW stuff?: No, but kisses and such are fine.
Prefers to draw: Romantic, cute and fun things. I also like to draw semi-realistic portraits, gemsonas and such.
Digital high-resolution copy will be sent to you via e-mail.
Total commissions available: 2

Link where you can find more from this artist:
Portfolio

COMMISSION EXAMPLES BY ANETTE:

EMANU
Commission can be: Lineart/black and white.
Backgrounds: No.
Digital high-resolution copy will be sent to you via e-mail.
Total commissions available: 2

COMMISSION EXAMPLES BY EMANU:

VIKTOR ENGHOLM
Commission can be: Grayscale or color.
Size of illustration: Half or fullbody.
Backgrounds: Simple backgrounds only.
Number of characters per commission: One.
Do you draw NSFW stuff?: Naked is fine, but no sex.
Prefers to draw: Humanoid creatures, no furries (nothing against them, just simply not that good at drawing that type of character)
Digital high-resolution copy will be sent to you via e-mail.
Total commissions available: 4

Links where you can find more from this artist:
Viktormon.deviantart.com

COMMISSION EXAMPLES BY VIKTOR:

NATHALIE NILSSON
Commission can be: Color.
Size of illustration: Headshot or halfbody.
Backgrounds: No.
Number of characters per commission: One character for a halfbody size or two characters for a headshot size.
Do you draw NSFW stuff?: No.
Digital high-resolution copy will be sent to you via e-mail.
Total commissions available: 2

Links where you can find more from this artist:
Zenatness.tumblr.com

COMMISSION EXAMPLES BY NATHALIE:

DIANA DAVIDSSON

Commission can be: Lineart.
Size of illustration: Fullbody.
Backgrounds: No.
Number of characters per commission: One.
Do you draw NSFW stuff?: No.
Prefers NOT to draw: Anything pornographic or lots of details.
Will only make changes to the drawing ONCE during sketching. No changes will be made after the illustration has been inked.
Digital high-resolution copy will be sent to you via e-mail.
Total commissions available: 2

Links where you can find more from this artist:
Omegaarts.tumblr.com
Omegasama.deviantart.com

COMMISSION EXAMPLES BY DIANA:


The finished book!

The book consists of:

  • 145 comic pages
  • 8 comics made by 9 of Scandinavias most talented comic artists/writers
  • All text is completely in English
  • Contains genres like slice-of-life, superheroes and fantasy! All of which are love stories between men!
  • Full color cover and black/white/gray interior pages
  • Dimensions of the book is 165 x 235 mm
  • A perfect-bound softcover volume, meaning that the final volume will have a smooth spine to which the interior pages are glued

The comics of Frey – Romantic Comic Collection

Diana Davidsson & Johan Gustafsson, Firestones.
In a distant past, a young king attempts to gain the friendship of a defeated foe, the shaman of an island rich with amber. But will his royal duties thwart his efforts?


Emanu, Oh Danny Boy.

A short comic inspired by the song with the same name. A beautiful depiction of a tragic love story.


Luddvig Melin, Subscribed to You.
Meeting your favorite YouTuber is one thing.
Meeting your favorite YouTuber that you also happen to have a seriously huge crush on is quite another! However, first meetings don't always go as well as you'd wish, especially not when nerves and worries get in your way.

BBMN, Kings of Paver’s Street.

Mobsters, maids and conspiracies!
Lorem, the young leader of the maffia, has to fight off a rebellion together with his very special maid, Vertige.


Nathalie Nilsson, Pearls.
Necessity has forced a tactical marriage to take place. The groom, however, has no interest at all in his far too young bride and instead choses to spend the wedding night with his trusty bodyguard, Fyren.


Viktor Engholm, Magik & Rockwall.

A superhero love story. Losing the one you love is painful. Having them come back from the dead can really play tricks on your mind. How will Rockwall react when his love, Magik, returns from the dead?


Anette Bengtsson, Down to Zero.
Mikael contemplates why finding the love of his life, Hannes, doesn't count as being successful in life. Why is it worth more, in society's eyes, to have a fancy job than to have found someone to share your life with?
A slice-of-live about doubting your own power to achieve happiness in life.


Elise Rosberg, C33.
In the late 1800's, two poets were in love. In these unforgiving times, they became accused of sodomy, and letting such an accusation go unadressed would be the same as saying that it's true. Will this end well?


Can we do this? Yes, we can!

Last year we successfully produced, crowdfunded and printed the anthology Freya – Sequential Love Stories. For the anthology this crowdfunding is for, Frey – A Romantic Comic Collection, we will be going about things the same way.

All of us editors have either participated in or been editors for anthologies like this before and have produced many marvelous and appreciated self-published comic books and anthologies.

We know how to deal with printers, creators and how to make this project a reality.

Trust us, we’ve got this ;)


What happens if we don’t reach our goal?

Don’t worry. If we don’t reach our campaign goal we will still print the books and everyone who donated will still receive their books and perks!

All of the donations that we receive from this campaign will go to the printing of the books, and the rest will come from our own, the artists, pockets.


Why is this anthology important?

We started this project because we want to contribute to the positive depiction of love stories between men within the male spectrum.


Where does the name Frey come from?

The name is tied to our origin, the Nordic countries. In Nordic mythology Frey is the Norse god of fertility and the brother of Freya, who is also a goddess of fertility and love. We chose to name this book Frey because he and Freya are siblings, much like these anthologies we have created. With the Frey anthology having stories of men’s love stories and the Freya anthology (published 2015) having stories of women’s love stories. We feel that these are the perfect names for these two anthology series.

Timeline

The comics are just about finished. After we have received all of them from the artists, all that is left is the proofreading and getting the book ready to be sent to the printers.

All of us, editors and comic artists, have been working together since October 2015 by reading each other’s layout sketches and giving each other feedback to ensure some really interesting and varied comics for you to read.

The book will be officially released at Stockholms International Comicsfestival in May 2016.

We expect to be able to start shipping out your books and perks in April-May! Yay!


Gallery

Please check out our gallery (the tab at the top of the page) to see some of the sketches, behind-the-scenes material and sneak peeks of the comics that will be in the anthology.

Please, go have a look! Also, keep an eye out for updates and new art added throughout this campaign.


Who are we, the editors of the Frey anthology?

Anette Bengtsson, creator of the webcomic Cover (tapastic.com/series/cover-up).

Elise Rosberg, founder of Wasabi Press, comic creator and teacher of comics.

Diana Davidsson, member of the studio Think Ink and creator of the webcomic The Protector (protectorcomic.smackjeeves.com).


Help support us!

If you don’t have the funds to donate, there are other ways that you can help us. By sharing this campaign, invite your friends, talk about it and spreading the word you are helping us a lot!


Want to know more about us?

Visit, share and like us at:
Facebook.com/freyaandfrey
Twitter.com/freya_and_frey

Thank you!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project! We hope that you like what you see and that you’ll support us by sharing this campaign and by helping us raise the funds to print these awesome comics!

Hello!


We are three
comic creators, Anette, Elise and Diana, and we are the editors of the Freya & Frey anthologies!
Last year
we held a very successful crowdfunding for our first anthology called Freya – Sequential Love Stories, which had the theme of female love stories.
Now we are back to follow up last year’s
success with the first volume of Frey-
A Romantic Comic Collection, an anthology about men’s love stories.



(Cover illustration for the book made by the editors Diana, Anette and Elise)
This is a speedpaint video of when Elise Rosberg colored the cover for the anthology. Enjoy!




What is Frey - A
Romantic Comic Collection?
Frey is an
indie comic book project. It is an anthology that includes stories made by nine
talented Scandinavian comic artists/writers with focus on men's love stories.
That means that all of the main characters in Frey define themselves as men and
every story is written from men’s point of view with the theme of love between men.
While all of
the stories focus on love and romance, some of the artists chose to go even
further, depicting the erotic nature of loving relationships.
Unlike Freya – Sequential Love Stories, whose
participants were exclusively people identifying within the female spectrum;
the participants in Frey – A Romantic Comic
Collection are not exclusively men. We, the editors, are sort of female and
therefore feel that for us to make an anthology completely from a man’s point
of view would not be possible or feel right for us to do. We would be extremely
excited and glad if someone somewhere started an anthology (or several)
completely made by men from men’s point of view. Sadly, that cannot be us.
However, all of the comics in this anthology are either; drawn and written by,
written by or has received feedback on its content by someone who identifies
within the male spectrum. 


So, what is this exciting campaign about?
This is
what we need your help with.


We
are hoping to raise 1500€ to help us pay some of the printing costs of the book,
(this will also cover the shipping costs for the gifts we would like to send
you as a thank you for your donations).


Since
this is an indie project, that means that we have no outside funding to print
these books, other than the gathered help of the participating artists.


If
you choose to donate, for example, 15€ (about 16$) we will give you a physical copy of the book and a bookmark as a
thank you.


Shipping: NOTE that 5€ will be added to your donation for worldwide shipping. For delivery within Sweden, shipping is included in the donation for your chosen perk!


Every
little bit helps, even if you’re only able to donate 1€, we will be really
grateful for your support. We also have other perks and gifts for you who
choose to donate a bit more, be sure to check them out.


Remember, if you live outside of Sweden, this might be your only chance to get a hold of this gorgeous anthology! We only plan to print a few hundred of them (with no reprints) so if you want it, now is your chance!We want to reach as many people around the world as we possibly can with our comics. This campaign is a big part in reaching this goal.


Don’t
forget to check in from time to time to see our updates!

story:
Iris is a comic book set in a Middle Eastern inspired science fiction world. It follows the story of a young woman who is assaulted, murders her assaulter, and joins a group of revolutionary women who protect others from a corrupt government.

These women were inspired by the Gulabi gang, a group of women in India that protect other women from rapists and other abusers.

I’m a writer on a budget. I’m paying for the first four pages only and then booting up this Kickstarter in hopes of raising enough money to hire an artist to illustrate the first issue, which would be about 22 pages long. 

Art by Rolands Kanins and cover art by Danica Wells

Risks and challenges

A challenge I might face after this project is successful is successfully funding the next issues. Though funding this project would be a dream, I would need to do another Kickstarter to ensure that the second issue could be created. That would only be possible if people were interested enough in the first volume, of course!

A challenge I worry about is not raising enough funds to produce a quality comic book. I chose the flexible funding option, but if I don't reach my goal, it will take me much longer to produce the first volume. No matter what, though, the donations will be used to produce the first volume, even if I don't reach my goal. I will keep every backer updated to the status of the comic book, should this happen.

story:
This is a story about Super Heroes trying to saving the world from the Super Villains' evil plans. You are going to find action, fight and a little bit of drama.


If you are a comic book lover, you can also join us to receive the final pdf version after participate in the script with just $ 10.  Yes, this is a collaborative history.

You can also be a part of the comic book being a character, a hero or a villain and help us to write the story. Yes, you can:
  • Choose your powers
  • Chose your name and outfit
  • Participate in the script creation

The title will be chosen through a survey on the Facebook group. All supporters can vote.


The process to become a Hero:

Art Preview:

If you have a brand or a business and want to be a part of this project, we also have a special reward for that.
That's gonna be a awesome comic book. 
Our deadline to finish the Script (with your ideas too) and the characters design is DEC/2016. 
After reaching the goal, we can try to reach the sub-goal of $ 5,900 to have a printed Comic Book.


Please, share this project!!


If you wanna know our job and last projects: www.gabrielrs.com.br.

story:
About Me...

After serving in the Navy for 6 years, it was time to move on to the next stage of my life. Taking a little time to draw everyday on an aircraft carrier at sea, I managed to improve rapidly and went on to study comics and illustration at The Kubert School of Cartooning. My training so far has allowed me to achieve a level of quality in my artwork which is self-explanatory in the images to follow.  In addition to my training, I was Editor-in-Chief of the 22nd Annual West Wind Review Literary Journal at Southern Oregon University, which required me to bring a book from concept to printed product in a short amount of time,  I also worked as a contract software support Tech for Adobe Systems from 2007-2009, specializing in Adobe Photoshop, After Effects and Premiere Pro.  

What I need to deliver this book to you...

My unorthodox job experience has given me the perfect combination of both technical and artistic skill-sets that allow me to bring Beatdown Girl from conception to completion. This book is a labor of love, which is why the goal for this campaign is relatively modest.  

The Impact of your donation...

The impact of your donation on me will be a wonderful experience because you will become my customer and I will work tirelessly to satisfy your needs in regards to producing this Graphic Novel. The best feeling any true craftsman can have is devotion to serve their customers. I hope that you are one of them. Additionally, once we hit our funding goal, we will announce stretch goals that will allow me to bring in outside help to add additional value to the book such as Variant Cover Artists and Colorists for the publication. 

The impact for you is you get to enjoy a story crafted to explore the morality of the world around us as we human beings become more integrated with our technology.

Potential Risks...

The only risks I see in this project not coming to fruition is if I had fallen ill, or became injured in a way that I would I not be able to draw and finish the graphic design; so I will promise to take good care of myself!

However, the risks for me are much greater. Since my goal is to give you the best 32-page Graphic Novel I could muster, if I fail in this task I would lose your trust as a comics book creator and would have a difficult time getting you to back any future endeavors. If we reach our funding goal... my promise to you is I will mitigate the risk and do everything in my power to have this book in your hands before Christmas and at the best possible quality,

 

Other Ways You Can Help    

 

 

If you can't afford to help. I would ask you to please share this campaign with your friends and family on social media or via text message. Any visibility you can give us increases our chances for success.  

I thank you for any support you can muster.

Additionally, once we hit our funding goal, we will announce stretch goals that will allow me to bring in outside help to add additional value to the book such as Variant Cover Artists and Colorists for the publication. 
The impact for you is you get to enjoy a story crafted to explore the morality of the world around us as we human beings become more integrated with our technology.
Potential Risks...

The only risks I see in this project not coming to fruition is if I had fallen ill, or became injured in a way that I would I not be able to draw and finish the graphic design; so I will promise to take good care of myself!
However, the risks for me are much greater. Since my goal is to give you the best 32-page Graphic Novel I could muster, if I fail in this task I would lose your trust as a comics book creator and would have a difficult time getting you to back any future endeavors. If we reach our funding goal... my promise to you is I will mitigate the risk and do everything in my power to have this book in your hands before Christmas and at the best possible quality,
 
Other Ways You Can Help    
 
 

If you can't afford to help. I would ask you to please share this campaign with your friends and family on social media or via text message. Any visibility you can give us increases our chances for success.  
I thank you for any support you can muster.

story:
The Offer

Send in the Clowns features cartoons from Wings Over Scotland (mostly), Bella Caledonia and elsewhere – a personal selection designed to amuse and inform in equal measure. It takes us from the election of Jeremy Corbyn as Labour leader to just days before Kezia Dugdale resigned as leader of Labour Party in Scotland. One of those events might be connected to the other in some way, one might speculate, but, of course, neither comes close to being the most significant development in the last two years.

Over 176 pages of cartoons and mordant musings, the book looks from behind the sofa and through its fingers at the Brexit vote, Donald Trump, and members of the Tory Party in Scotland. It wonders in awe at the wisdom and professional elan of our ruling classes, warms to the generous humanity of Nigel Farage and pities the hapless Europeans soon to be skewered by David Davis's fearsome negotiating skills.

Naturally, however, the focus has been on Scotland and, for his devoted fans, I can confirm Hamish makes many appearances, his insouciance and confidence in the path to independence undiminished.

Printed in full colour throughout on matt coated art paper with a gloss laminated cover, Send in the Clowns is 24cm x 24cm (9.5" x 9.5") and comes in soft and hard back versions. It has a foreword by Wee Ginger Dug (aka Paul Kavanagh), one of Scotland's finest columnists.

I'm offering four levels of perks for contributors eager to get their hands on a signed and numbered first edition copy in either hard or soft cover. There are enamel lapel badges and … (drum roll) … your chance to own your own cuddly Hamish – now available as an exclusive, limited edition soft toy!

What is Needed

The book – soft and hard cover – is being published by Greg Moodie and will be printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd. We are looking for £8000 to cover the cost of this and the additional perks, plus postage and packaging.

Expect the Unexpected

If everything had gone to the unionist plan, the last couple of years would have been recorded in Scottish history as the Great Anti-climax. A painful, yet necessary coming to terms again with our substandard and subordinate role in the UK after getting that silly independence nonsense out of our system. But it didn't quite pan out that way.

At times, the road to self-determination has seemed longer than we'd hoped, some times shorter – we've certainly had to negotiate a few twists and turns we hadn't seen coming. But a road there most certainly still is. I and my fellow travellers (some of them equally armed with pencils and paints) hope you will stay with us on the journey. Your support for this book, our blogs, columns and cartoons sustains us on the way. Many thanks.

story:
Galaxafreaks will eat your brain!

Then chew it up and spit it out in a reconstructed mind-freak! Trust me, you'll feel better for it!

Welcome back space-siblings! Hot on the heels of the stellar success of Galaxafreaks Issue No: 1 comes the pre-order freakout for No: 2 ! More freaky art, pyschedelic nonsense and quantum story fun!

My name is Andrew Pawley, I'm a pencil squeezer based on the South Coast of England. I draw freaky comics and illustrations.  You might know me from my first edition of Galaxafreaks.

I've been working on a comic book called Galaxafreaks about galaxy sized weirdoes getting up to all sorts of shenanigans! I work using digital media and have been publishing web-comics for a while now. I love the ol'interweb but would also love to spread my cosmic funk-juice through the medium of printed 'zines. Last November I successfully funded Issue No: 1 of Galaxafreaks, I'd love to do the same again. Hopefully, with your support I can!

No support is too little or too much!

There are a full range of perks to suit all types of pockets including;

  • A copy of the final printed comic
  • Original artwork
  • Limited edition screen-prints and posters
  • Appearing as a Galaxafreak!! (cosmic!!)

I really hope you can help out and get freaky with these dudes!

Who are the Galaxafreaks?

Where to start? Basically the Galaxafreaks are a bunch of friends who happen to be the size of whole galaxies. However, the whole story takes place inside the brain of a cosmic universal baby who lives inside a Higgs Boson particle. Obviously!

The next issue sees the Galaxafreaks get serious and combat the tyrannical ' King Freak'. Here's a glimpse of the action!



Galaxafreaks will be exclusively available in print as a 32 page, full colour comic book. None of the content will appear online (apart from the teaser story above). I was amazed at the print quality of Issue No:1, high quality gloss in full glorious freak-out colour. It really is an awesome item! If you could help make this a reality (what is reality anyway?) then I'd be able to continue freaking people's mind for just that little bit longer!


You never know, if it's successful I might be able to make it a series and stop washing dishes!

I've finished over half the comic already and will be posting glimpses and exclusive updates here as the project progresses.

However, to get this freak-show on the road I need to raise funds to pay for the printing & distribution of the old beast. 


How else can you help out?

If you're strapped for cash, don't worry none, you can still lend a hand:

  • Make as much noise as possible on social media

@drewdrewcito

 http://www.facebook.com/andrewpawleyillustration

  • Give those Indiegogo share tools a good ol'clicking!!



BIG SHOUT OUT !!! Goes to @angelfoodmusic for the awesome sound track to my video!

story:
After a 30 year hiatus, Chuck Dixon returns to write new issues of AIRBOY, joined by rising stars Brent McKee (pencils and inks) and Jok (colors and letters)! The action on the first page of AIRBOY #51 picks right up where AIRBOY #50 left off three decades ago! AIRBOY #51 will be out in less than a month, followed very quickly by AIRBOY #52.  To celebrate these two new issues of AIRBOY, we have commissioned variant covers by Bret Blevins, Dalibor Talajic, Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Graham Nolan, Jim Steranko, Matt Kindt, Paul Gulacy, Sam Kieth, and Stipe Kalajžić! Your support will help make this new AIRBOY comic book series a reality! Thank you!

AIRBOY #51

 

AIRBOY #52

 

We recently ran a successful campaign for AIRBOY #51, but if you missed out on that campaign, you can pick up both AIRBOY #51 and AIRBOY #52 from this campaign.  You can also pick up a BRAND NEW variant cover from Bret Blevins!  Not to mention signed variant covers, which were not available from the first campaign, from incredible artists such as Graham Nolan, Emma Kubert, Bret Blevins, and Don Perlin!  You will also find some original AIRBOY sketches available from a handful of talented artists. 

As for this new series itself, these new issues of AIRBOY, running a four issue story entitled "Generations", will introduce David Nelson IV, grandson of the original Golden Age AIRBOY, and son of the more recent 1980's incarnation of AIRBOY created by Chuck Dixon.  Dixon has returned to this world and these characters with one hell of a story that is sure to blow your mind!

Dixon's new AIRBOY series will be brought to life visually by rising stars Brent McKee and Jok.  McKee will be handling the pencils and inks, with Jok adding the colors and letters.  Once you see a preview of the final product below, we think you will agree that these three creators make an incredible team!  Enjoy!

 

VARIANTS

AIRBOY #51 & #52 both have six variants.  And each issue has one variant cover that you can ONLY purchase from this campaign!  AIRBOY #51 has Bret Blevins, Dalibor Talajic, Matt Kindt, Jim Steranko, Paul Gulacy, Sam Kieth.  AIRBOY #52 has Don Perlin, Emma Kubert, Graham Nolan, Jok, Russell Mark Olson and Stipe Kalajzic.  And here they all are. . .

AIRBOY #51 INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE VARIANT by BRET BLEVINS

(ONLY AVAILABLE FROM THIS CAMPAIGN!)

(25 SIGNED COPIES AVAILABLE!)

 

AIRBOY #52 INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE VARIANT by RUSSELL MARK OLSON

(ONLY AVAILABLE FROM THIS CAMPAIGN!)

 

AIRBOY #51 VARIANT by JIM STERANKO

 

AIRBOY #51 VARIANT by SAM KIETH

(ONLY 3 SIGNED COPIES LEFT FROM LAST CAMPAIGN!)

 

AIRBOY #51 VARIANT by MATT KINDT

(25 SIGNED COPIES AVAILABLE!)

 

AIRBOY #51 VARIANT by PAUL GULACY

 

AIRBOY #51 VARIANT by DALIBOR TALAJIC

 

AIRBOY #52 VARIANT by GRAHAM NOLAN

(25 SIGNED COPIES AVAILABLE!)

 

AIRBOY #52 VARIANT by DON PERLIN

(25 SIGNED COPIES AVAILABLE!)

 

AIRBOY #52 VARIANT by EMMA KUBERT

(25 SIGNED COPIES AVAILABLE!)

 

AIRBOY #52 VARIANT by JOK

 

AIRBOY #52 VARIANT by STIPE KALAJZIC

 

 

AIRBOY ART FOR SALE!

 

AIRBOY by Nir Levie

 

AIRBOY & VALKYRIE by Nick Cagnetti

 

AIRBOY by Dave Dye

 

AIRBOY & VALKYRIE by Danos Philopoulos

 

AIRBOY by Gerry Kissell

 

AIRBOY original cover art by Russell Mark Olson

story:
The Ignis Quadrant - Novus Landing - Chapter #2 continues the shenanigans of Montana Bones, a rough-n-tumble space cowboy, and his wacky group of companions. They've got a few drinks in their bellies, the local garrison and a gang of criminals at their backs, and not much of a plan in front of 'em.

This is the second crowdfunding campaign for this serial story, and introduces the third chapter. The book is completely finished and ready to print,  and folks who have read it have had great things to say. We're thrilled and excited to continue to bring this story to life with your help and support!

 

 

Some folks would describe this story as that of a man afraid to let go of the past as he deals with shame and regret, while unknowingly searching for a purpose. Others (including me) would just describe it as a not-so-serious jaunt around a familiar yet unique space setting, cut with halfway-decent humor and a big splash of action and adventure.

The Ignis Quadrant world and characters draw from a plethora of influencing sources - from science fiction classics like Star Wars® and Firefly, to spaghetti westerns of yesteryear, and even pulp staples like Back to the Future and Indiana Jones. You'll feel right at home in the Ignis Quadrant - comfortable and familiar - while also finding yourself exploring something entirely new and exciting!

Chapter #0 is a free prequel issue that you can read digitally RIGHT NOW if you wanna get a bit 'o the origin story, see more of the artwork, and see the writing style. Check it out and choose for yourself if you wanna read on! You can also learn a bit more in the original Chapter #0/#1 crowdfunding campaign page.

 

 

Chapter #2 is 24 full-color pages, 19 of which include the sequential story, plus two special chapter intro and outro splash pages. The art style features clean, heavy lines with vivid bold contrasting colors and an attention to detail.

sources: superseriouscomics review , scifi comic nexus review

 

[PLEDGE OPTIONS AND ADD-ONS]

You can choose from various pledge options including a digital version, standard cover, and Kickstarter-limited wraparound cover. In addition to each pledge option, there are add-ons for back issues of chapter #0 & #1, and additional copies of chapter #2 can also be added to your pledge.

[THE PHYSICAL BOOKS]

The physical book is printed on super-high quality 80# C-2-S Gloss paper (thicker and higher quality than standard comic "floppies"). The standard cover is printed on 80# gloss as well, and the limited Kickstarter-exclusive cover will be printed on 80# gloss foil paper. The limited cover is an amazing wraparound, super-detailed design from Italian illustrator Mirko Di Noya. The limited edition print copy will also be signed by the author (Evan Carothers) and shipped in a sealed plastic sleeve.

Every physical package will also include a custom sticker of Monty's custom RY-13 Rev Laser schematic, and hopefully more swag from stretch goals! We even have a custom stamp of the Rev Laser schematic for the shipping envelopes for that custom touch.

[DISCLAIMER] 

This comic contains action-filled violence, foul language, adult themes, alcohol consumption, and some racy language at times. We slapped an 'M' for mature on the cover on purpose. If you're a young kid who stoled your parents credit card and are looking for comics on Kickstarter, don't buy this one (unless you're 100% sure you aren't gonna get caught)

[DELIVERY TIMELINE]

Chapter #2 is 100% complete and queued up at our printer. Printing will begin as soon as the KS ends (when we know exact numbers to order), with plans to have copies ready in < 1 month from the end date of the KS. Digital copies will get distributed to you right after the funding period as well. Obviously, it's a pandemic right now and there's wildcards, but that's our (optimistic!) timeline.

[SHIPPING]

Domestic shipping & handling is $3 per issue (which covers shipping, handling, and packaging). This cost will not change even as physical stretch goals are added to the project, as all items will be small enough to add in the mailer envelope with the book. For non USA locations, shipping is a standard $11. Unfortunately that is the cheapest shipping I can find, even with merchant discount USPS international rates, so for international backers digital pledges might be a better option. International backers will also be responsible for any duties/customs your country imposes - the customs form will declare the comic with a $3 USD value.

[FUNDING GOALS AND COSTS]

Most people don't know how much it really costs to produce a comic, and I wanted to be very transparent about the process, so you know how we priced our rewards and why we set the funding goals we did. In the case of The Ignis Quadrant, it costs $150/pg for the sequential art (which covers paying the artists for pencils, inks, colors,  then lettering). Then you add in more expensive pages (like covers, supplemental art pages, intro pages, etc) and the cost of editing. Chapter #2 cost us around $3700 total to produce.. THEN you have to factor in printing costs (~$2.50/piece), shipping ($2.80/piece domestic via media mail + packaging & handling), marketing/advertising, taxes and Kickstarter fees.  Any in our case, we offer the prequel issue for free, which we aren't even including in these calculations. 

Any comic creator will tell you that you don't get into comics to make money, but rather for love of creating and seeing your stories come to life.  It was very important to me to pay the artists up front for their amazing work, and take any risk for the project success onto myself. Our funding goal is barely a break-even point for the production and distribution costs of the comic, however I wanted to keep it affordable for backers, and am confident that you will enjoy our story and want to follow along for further issues as the story arc continues!

 

 

[EVAN CAROTHERS] - Writer, designer, and owner of EC3D Designs

I live in St Paul, MN and have been working in the gaming and world-building industry for many years, successfully creating and Kickstarting digital designs for characters, scenery and more to use in conjunction with your imagination (and 3D printers).  I have been developing the world of the Ignis Quadrant through multiple kickstarters and am excited to be working with such a talented team of artists and creatives to bring these projects to life! I am a black belt in Brazillian Jiu Jitsu as well, and plan to draw upon my martial arts experience to make some awesome hand to hand fight sequences in the comic.

[JEZREEL ROJALES] - Artist

Jez lives with his wife and children in the Philippines, where he works his magic to bring stories to life in beautiful imagery. Jez previously worked on Liberty:Deception, a sci fi dystopian comic. He also works as a storyboard artist for TV and commercials, as well as traditional water colors and Indie animation films.

[MARIAM YASSER] - Colorist

Mariam is a skilled colorist residing in Cairo, Egypt. I met her on the awesome reddit community /r/ComicBookCollabs and was captivated by her bold,  bright design aesthetics and attention to detail. Her stylistic coloring brings the world of the Ignis Quadrant to life and makes it feel fun and exciting while simultaneously dark and dangerous.

[JUSTIN "LETTERSQUIDS"] - Letters

Justin has been lettering comics and doing logo/graphic design for many years with an impressively long portfolio. He's another awesome creator I met via Reddit. I was drawn to the sharpness of clarity in his work, and the unique way he blends multiple styles together so seamlessly. His work in our book is outstanding, and makes for one hell of a smooth reading experience

[BOB SALLEY] - Editor

Bob has often been referred to as the hardest working guy in indie comics.  Bob has written and created so many comics that you could spend a few months reading only his awesome work and never get sick of it (Broken Gargoyles, Salvagers, Shelter Division, Ogre & Ogres w/Source Point Press). He helped me turn The Ignis Quadrant from an "ok" project into something I am crazy proud of.

[OTHER AWESOME COLLABORATORS]

Kurt Michael Russel (standard cover colors),  Mirko Di Noya (limited cover art),  Claudia Cangini (chapter intro pages), Joshua Black (character design), and  Jean Roux (supplemental art) 

 

Full Page Examples

Check out some complete pages from Chapter #2, plus a few select pages from #0 & #1. And of course, you can see all the completed pages from the free prequel HERE. You can click any of the images to see them in high res!

[CHAPTER #2, PG 9]

[CHAPTER #2, PG 1]

[CHAPTER #1, PG 12]

[CHAPTER #0, PG 15]
