story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Pastor Dave Mason. I've been pastor of First Baptist Church in Bel Air, MD for the last 10 years. Before that I was a Deputy Sheriff, Radio News Director and DJ, I wrote for the Associated Press, and I produced local Television Programs!

But through it all I have been an avid Comic Book fan and Artist. My dream of working for DC or Marvel never came to pass when I was a young man, life got in the way! But in the last five years the passion to draw comics and fine art has revived in my heart. I have been drawing a comic book for the last few years, and last Fall published a small run of an "Ashcan Edition" previewing the first twelve pages of "Profit and Loss." I have been working on it for my friend Rick Via, and Evangelist who will use it in his ministry.

As you can see, it's a Gospel-centered comic, what else would a Pastor do?
"Profit and Loss" is the story of Ethan, a young attorney who seemingly has everything life could offer. Money, cars, women, freedom. But his life changes after a car crash that kills everyone involved except Ethan. His search for meaning and fulfillment lead him to realize that his Eternal Destiny in Jesus Christ is far more important than anything he could gain on earth.

Recently I did an event at a minor league Baseball team's "Star Wars Night", sketching and selling original art. Many people asked me if I would be at the Baltimore Comic-Con, sure I could sell my art and promote my fledgling Comic Book Studio REDEEMED COMICS.

This convinced me to try. Problem is, it costs a bit to set up a table, and to provide the materials needed for a successful weekend!

Quick Background:

My church has recently felt the effects of the economy and can no longer support me at a full time level. I have lost 75% of my income since April. But God is Good! My family has not failed to pay a single bill, we are not starving, and blessings come from the strangest places!

But my ability to put out the monies for a project like this is nil.

To be able to go to Baltimore Comic Con and promote REDEEMED COMICS, sell original art to support my family, and launch into a professional era with my art would be amazing, and would signal the start of a new chapter in my family's life.

I want REDEEMED COMICS to be a place where wholesome entertainment, Biblical teaching, and fantastic art meet!

If you love Comics and The Gospel of Jesus Christ, I'd like to have your help to launch this enterprise.

"Profit and Loss" is on schedule to be completed this Fall- 36 pages in black and white with full color covers.

My next project is to create 22-page full color comic books teaching the basic Doctrines (Truths) of Scripture in a non-fiction setting, (sort of like Scott McCloud's "Understanding Comics")


What I Need & What You Get

To rent a table at the Baltimore Comic Con here is what I need:

  • $250 to rent the table
  • $90 for parking all three days
  • $200 for banners to draw people over to my table
  • $100 for Peg board and 2x3 lumber to construct a display board
  • $160 for Picture Frames
  • (I would love to have several hundred copies of the Ashcan Edition printed also, two hundred copies would run me about $2 each. If I go above my goal I will use the extra money to have the comics printed. I'll take them to comic Con and sell them for $2 each, just to get the word out!)
WHAT YOU GET:
  • COMICS! All contributors, if they wish, will receive a digital copy of "Profit and Loss" when it is published.
  • MORE COMICS! Any contribution over $10 will receive a signed copy of the full "Profit and Loss" comic when it is published.
  • ART! Any contribution above$25 will receive an original 5x7 pencil sketch of your favorite comic book, sci-fi or fantasy character, (Please note I do NOT sketch scantily clad women or gross blood and gore!)
  • MORE ART! Any contribution over $100 will receive an original, full color 8x10 sketch rendered in chalk pastels, again of your favorite character.
WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL;
  • If I don't reach my goal and cannot go to the Baltimore Comic-Con, all funds will go towards publishing additional copies of the "Profit and Loss" Ashcan to continue promoting it.

The Impact

My dream is to establish a comic book studio that glorifies God and teaches the Gospel to the lost, and Biblical Doctrine to the saints.

  • The comic book industry is swelling with books that promote gross violence, promiscuity, and the concept that the ends justify any means.
  • REDEEMED Comics is a dream to re-introduce wholesome, family friendly stories that challenge minds, engage hearts, and change lives!

$160 for Picture Frames

(I would love to have several hundred copies of the Ashcan Edition printed also, two hundred copies would run me about $2 each. If I go above my goal I will use the extra money to have the comics printed. I'll take them to comic Con and sell them for $2 each, just to get the word out!)


WHAT YOU GET:

COMICS! All contributors, if they wish, will receive a digital copy of "Profit and Loss" when it is published.
MORE COMICS! Any contribution over $10 will receive a signed copy of the full "Profit and Loss" comic when it is published.
ART! Any contribution above$25 will receive an original 5x7 pencil sketch of your favorite comic book, sci-fi or fantasy character, (Please note I do NOT sketch scantily clad women or gross blood and gore!)
MORE ART! Any contribution over $100 will receive an original, full color 8x10 sketch rendered in chalk pastels, again of your favorite character.

WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL;

If I don't reach my goal and cannot go to the Baltimore Comic-Con, all funds will go towards publishing additional copies of the "Profit and Loss" Ashcan to continue promoting it. 
  The Impact My dream is to establish a comic book studio that glorifies God and teaches the Gospel to the lost, and Biblical Doctrine to the saints. 
The comic book industry is swelling with books that promote gross violence, promiscuity, and the concept that the ends justify any means.
REDEEMED Comics is a dream to re-introduce wholesome, family friendly stories that challenge minds, engage hearts, and change lives!

story:
DA NANDO. 

Trama: Nando è il titolare di un'osteria in pieno centro storico, crocevia di persone e personaggi, tormentoni e disavventure varie. In ogni episodio si respira la goliardia tipica toscana ed ogni avvenimento viene affrontato con l'ironia amara e sarcastica caratteristica di questa regione.

Attorno al “pianeta” osteria gravitano una serie di personaggi che fanno di questo luogo un vero e proprio punto di incontro per un gruppo di amici, che non mancano mai occasione di creare grattacapi al povero Nando, preso sempre di mira per beffe e prese in giro.

I personaggi principali oltre allo stesso Nando sono: Marina la figlia dell'oste, i due camerieri Mario e Saverio, il cuoco e i tre clienti abituali dell'osteria, il Vignozzi, il Bugiani e il Ricotti, i quali tormentano Nando con le loro iniziative e scherzi a limite della decenza. 

Target: Essendo uno sketch-show, la sit-com è adatta a tutti, la presenza di protagonisti di diverse fasce di età è stata appositamente scelta per poter appassionare un pubblico più vasto. Inoltre il formato è adatto anche per essere pubblicato sul web.

Una SIT-COM in puro stile toscano, che vuole riportare la goliardia tipica delle osterie di provincia. 

Se riusciamo a raggiungere l'obiettivo per produrre due puntate (oltre le due puntate zero già realizzate,ma non ancora pubblicate) saranno trasmesse  sul canale televisivo toscano "TVL" Ch11 .

Come autori ringrazieremo pubblicamente tutti coloro che hanno contribuito e lo faremo in diretta TV , vestiti da SUPEREROI .

Personaggi e Interpreti :

NANDO : Sergio Forconi

CECCO: Ivan Periccioli

MARINA: Irene Casartelli

MARIO: Daniele Angeli

SAVERIO: Ciccio Toccafondi

BUGIANI: Checco Bugiani

VIGNOZZI: Simone Gai

RICOTTI: Giacomo Bottari

STROZZINO: Antonio Landi

story:
I know an Edinburgh show is, for some people, not something you should fret over doing and I know that it wont make me famous or rich but for a sick person laid in bed day after day, something to dream about is what spurs you on and now I am so close to making that dream come true I just cannot walk away without a fight.

I had it all in January, I was part of a duo who had been promised I didn't have to worry about a thing, it was all taken care of. But that came at a price. In the end it was too high and I found myself solo again but this time without a sponsor.

Life in a recession is hard but anyone who has faced sickness knows that extra stress can almost break you. As we lost our home last year I made a mental promise to myself that when my body gave me enough energy to do anything I would do something big and make sure my children were never losing their home again. I have never been so committed to anything but that promise in my life. Then along came this project! I know it will do good things. The Right To Die will always be controversial but instead of being argued by politician's and doctors who each have their own agenda, in Sick Girl you will hear why its so important to discuss this issue from a patient. Comedy and tragedy go hand in hand and I know this will make it more palatable for people listening, Right now there are many people contemplating this ALONE and if hearing my story gives one person the courage to speak up it will be worth all the stress it caused to pay for it!

I feel like since getting sick I've done nothing but ask for help but I promise that as soon as I turn things around, and I will spend my days paying forward all the kindness people showed me! Anyway, here's the blurb......

Sick Girl is a true story. My story. I had a baby in 2010, nothing unusual there but it left me with an incurable disease that could kill me; any minute, any where, any day! (Let's hope we get to the end of the show first though eh?) I don't know why it happened to me but I do know that at one point the suffering my family and I felt was considered by me to be too great and so I contacted a leading Euthanasia organisation to help me die. At 35 with two small children I was deemed selfish, irresponsible and weak and maybe I was all three but in this show I'll be as honest as I can be in explaining what a person like me must have faced to want to check out early. Thankfully though, I didn't die! (Unless I did in which case the afterlife is a bit of a let down!) I was offered a lifetime and I took it! And I still wake each day so grateful i was and did and very rarely think about how long I have because that question can never be answered can it? But the one question that can be is; if it got too bad, if you couldn't stand it anymore, would you opt out or wait until nature takes its course? Maybe this show will see you question that answer, maybe it won't! But it will make you laugh. Why? Because comedy and tragedy are the best of friends - oh and I'm a comedian, so that helps! Anyway, come see me! Mel ko but I promise If I get a break and turn things around I will spend my life paying forward what kindness people showed me! Anyway, here's the blurb......

Sick Girl is a true story. My story. I had a baby in 2010, nothing unusual there but it left me with an incurable disease that could kill me; any minute, any where, any day! (Let's hope we get to the end of the show first though eh?) I don't know why it happened to me but I do know that at one point the suffering my family and I felt was considered by me to be too great and so I contacted a leading Euthanasia organisation to help me die. At 35 with two small children I was deemed selfish, irresponsible and weak and maybe I was all three but in this show I'll be as honest as I can be in explaining what a person like me must have faced to want to check out early. Thankfully though, I didn't die! (Unless I did in which case the afterlife is a bit of a let down!) I was offered a lifetime and I took it! And I still wake each day so grateful i was and did and very rarely think about how long I have because that question can never be answered can it? But the one question that can be is; if it got too bad, if you couldn't stand it anymore, would you opt out or wait until nature takes its course? Maybe this show will see you question that answer, maybe it won't! But it will make you laugh. Why? Because comedy and tragedy are the best of friends - oh and I'm a comedian, so that helps! Anyway, come see me! Mel

story:
The latest title from Kinetic Press, Ayn Rand's: Anthem is a new graphic novel adaptation of the classic novel by Ayn Rand, and illustrated by Ken Krekeler, author of Dry Spell and Westward. The story is told over the course of 7 issues, played against a post-apocalyptic background of a society where independent thought and invention have been outlawed, now viewed as crimes against humanity. 

Anthem #1 will be a full-color, 24 page comic, available in May of 2016. The goal of this campaign is to secure funds for printing, shipping, advertising and distribution of Anthem #1, as well the production costs for backer rewards.

Because the issue has yet to enter pre-order stages, and since the final number of backers will be determined at the end of the campaign, most of these costs are estimated projections based on previous campaigns helmed by Kinetic Press. They are set to cover the $4,500 minimum goal.

It takes a lot of pennies to cover all the steps involved in producing a single issue of any comic. Anthem #1 will be in color; books printed in color are roughly three times the cost of those in black-and-white. And international shipping charges-- even those on smaller packages-- typically range between $40 and $50 each.

As potential backers, you have every right to know what your money is going toward. With that in mind, the graphic below should help clarify the costs involved. 


For pledges of $150 and up, backers will have the opportunity to choose three pop-culture character prints from the Kinetic Press Etsy Shop. With dozens of characters from a wide range of genres available, each print comes sized at 11x17 and signed by the artist. 

Ken Krekeler majored in illustration in Detroit, Michigan at the College for Creative Studies. He graduated in 2009, the same year he released his first full-color graphic novel The Colodin Project. The book was sold in comic shops everywhere and distributed by Diamond Distribution. In January of 2011, he began his own publishing company, Kinetic Press. It was under this label that he released his second book, Dry Spell; a compact super powers story also in full-color. In June of 2012 he began his own ongoing black-and-white comic book series Westward, a steampunk mystery comic book series exploring the nature of achievement and human happiness.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge in the success of this campaign is the same challenge I face with every comic I've ever produced: marketing, exposure, and awareness. Every artist has their weaknesses; mine has always been publicity. Outside of animated trailers, preview pages and comic cons, I've always lacked the salesmanship necessary to communicate my ideas properly in a way that catches the public eye.

story:
A Word from Studio Hubris

We are Studio Hubriis,
 
We are releasing our debut quarterly anthology book, "Omniversal" at Derby City Comic Con, the premiere comic and pop culture convention in Louisville, KY and well..we need your help.
 
Times are hard and we need funding for our debut.
 
Check out the various ways you can donate as well as the awesome gifts we're offering to you for doing so.
 

We've got until June 14th, so keep your eyes peeled and see us shine.
 

***THE FIRST TWENTY CONTRIBUTORS WILL GET A 4X5 CHARACTER SKETCH OF YOUR CHOICE!!****

 
It’s official!
 
Starting August 15th Studio Hubris will debut “funkyTOWN” as a biweekly, subscription-based comic! We are offering pre-orders as part of our indiegogo campaign, on top of the gifts we’re already offering!
 
On top of THAT, if you contribute above the $10 dollar level we’ll GIVE YOU a copy of “Omniversal” which features the funkyTOWN preview…THAT’S LIKE TWO WEEKS FREE of FUNKY- GOODNESS!!!
 
How can you top that?
 
Thanks,

- The Management

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Pitch

Ever wonder if a snowman bleeds? Probably not, you're a sane, rational human being - but now that we're talking about it, the one place you're gonna find out is right here, with my comic series Ice Cold Killers: The Serious Cases of Detective Rick Frost. This series takes place in a reality where snowmen roam the streets devoid of human life, doing their best to make happy lives for themselves in a 1940's style environment. This happiness is threatened when a mysterious serial killer known only as the Heat Miser starts making lives a living hell for the police force, and the city that just wants to feel safe. To make matters worse the blabbering mouth of the chief of police has made the work even harder by letting the news get a hold on the serial killer's M.O.. Now, among a slew of copy-cat killers trying to slide by the system, it's up to Detective Rick Frost to bring justice back to the streets. 

  • My name is Steven Terrill, and I've been studying writing for almost a decade, with a Bachelors in Creative Writing from Waynesburg University, and working on a Masters in Creative Writing from Southern New Hampshire University. I also have a deep love of psychology and hold a Bachelors in the field from Waynesburg University as well. I currently reside in Waynesburg, working at a local pizza shop to pay the bills, and trying to squeeze in time for my creative endeavors. 
  • I've been a fan of comics for years, but I've never tried writing one before. With this project I hope to not only make a start in the field, but make a mark as well. I love studying the pathology of serial killers, but even more interesting to me are the people who attempt top circumvent the law by matching their crimes to the M.O. of other criminals. That takes a special kind of psychopath, if you ask me, and that's a major part of what I want to explore with this series. Sure, they are all going to be snowmen, but they will be human as well.  
  • Worried I might not be a good writer? Check out my publications in eFiction, a digital lit magazine. Kimberly Ann and Far From Home were two short stories I published through them, and Kimberly Ann in it's crappy rough draft form won me a Scholastic Gold Key Award for short story in 2008 when I was still in high school. Good luck finding that version of the story though, I may have burned all my copies when I rewrote it in college screaming "What was I thinking?!" What this means for you is that not only am I a published writer, I'm also willing to take a critical look at my work. 
  • You are super important to this project. Without you, this series probably won't get made. The amount of time and energy that will going into this project would leave me without the extra time or energy to gather the materials I need to be successful. More importantly you are a crucial part of this project because the more you back me, even just by sending a supporting message my way, the greater the odds are of this being amazing. Little signs of support are the real currency here, the actual funding amount is just a helpful bonus to get the tools to do the job right. 

That's about it for me and the general scope of the project, and I want to take the time to thank you for reading even this far. I hope you enjoyed the concept, at the very least, and even if you don't contribute, feel free to message me about questions about the project or suggestions to improve! My goal is for the first five issues to be done by August, but anyone receiving stickers will receive them by the end of June, God willing! 

What Are The Funds For?

800$ is a lot of cash, and it's your cash, so you deserve to know where it's all going to be going. 

  • Drawing Equipment: I'm not talking about pens and paper, I'm talking about nice digital drawing equipment. I'm no pro at art, but I know that with the proper tools in my hands I can make something we can all enjoy. Typically the got o brand is Wacom, which I have used in the past, but unless you're willing to spend a buttload of cash on them, you're stuck with a basic drawing pad. What I hope to get instead of their larger drawing monitor, is a Samsung Galaxy Note Tablet model 2014 or newer, which has a comparable drawing stylus to the Wacom models, at a much more affordable price. Most of the funding will go to this, since the cost ranges from 500 to 600 dollars.
  • Perks!: I'm going to try and offer as many cool perks as I can think of, but some perks are going to have to match the level of commitment to the project, and that can get a little pricey. What ever is left over from the funds after purchasing the drawing equipment, is going into help paying for the perks. 
  • Long Term Stretch Goals: I've tried to keep the cost down low on this project, I don't want anyone to chip in and feel jibbed on their contributions. As the project takes off, I'll be trying to keep up with everyone as the funds are raised, and for every 50 dollars raised, I am going to post a sketch from the Pilot issue of the comic, so that even people not getting a PDF of the Pilot will get a chance to see it. Also, any funds raised past the funding amount will go into a side fund for me to try and take time off work to sit down and focus on only the comic to get it done faster, so that you all all can reap the benefits sooner! Basically, over funding is going to fund me taking a sabbatical to work solely on this project, I'll even time it with my school break! 

Your Impact

I can't stress enough that each of you reading this an important part of the project to me. 

  • Without you, this project is going to suffer the wears and tears of time as the window of opportunity for me to work on it slowly passes.
  • With you, we're going to build a strong community for this project, and you're going to be on the forefront of all of it. 
  • Even when this project closes on indiegogo, our journey will continue, and I will keep you all in the loop, as long as you want to be. Plus, I don't know how to make spam messages, so you'll know that every message from me is legit! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight all around, believe me I know. If you can't contribute but you like this project, you can still help! 

  • Share this project! A lot! You may not get a perk from it, but you'll make my day a little brighter for it!
  • Tell your friends! 
  • email me to tell me what you think: 

    detectiverickfrost@gmail.com

  • If you do email me, even to tell me you think this project sucks butts, expect a response! 

Thank you all for your time!

Steven Terrill

Here are all the Pilot issues pages unlocked:

Pg1

Pg2 (Be sure to note the lite shadows!)

Page 3

Officer: Body of Ms. Becky Shraz, found approx. 8:30 this morning by a Robert Nase, morning cook over at Joe's. Body was melted using a heat source of at least 200 degrees Fahrenheit, given the relative frosting on the body. No items found on the body, besides the scarf, body was I.D.ed by Mr. Nase, says she frequents Joe's. Central says the name matches the address 503 E. Lehew, Apt 20, right across the street there.
Rick: Any witnesses?
Officer: None so far, detective.
Rick: Of course not. 

Page 4

Panel 1.
Rick: Start canvasing the area, I want a two block radius to start with.

Panel 2.
Rick: Sick bastard go her ont he way home.

Panel 3.
Rick: Found out where she worked, co-workers might know why she was out so late.

Panel 4.
And if you see Captain Daves, tell him this isn't a Heat Miser case, it's another copy cat thanks to his loud mouth.

Page 5.

Panel 1.
Officer: Detective Frost, with all due respect, how can you rule that out already?
Rick: Doesn't fit the M.O.

Panel 2.
Rick: look at her hand, part of the ring finger is missing, suggesting her jewelry was stolen. Heat Miser leaves his victims in tact.

Panel 3.
Rick: Secondly, the melting on the body is too symmetrical, suggesting a portable heat source.

Panel 4. 
Rick: The heat miser has only every killed using natural heat sources from the environment. 

Panel 5.
Rick: This has copy cat written all over it. If I was a betting man I'd say at this end of this we're going to be throwing some jackass into jail that read the tabloids and thought he could get away with knocking his wife off. 

Page 6

panel 1
Officer: Sir, where are you heading?
Rick:I'm heading over to her apartment, see if I can dig something up.

Panel 2
Rick (Thought): At least the captain hasn't run off about ALL of the evidence. Our one saving grace in identifying these copy carts is that no one apart from me and the captain know about the cryptic messages the Heat Miser has been leaving. Still, that does little to amend all he has leaked.

Panel 3
Rick (Thought): Every week it's another murder, all because of his incompetence, and the city is falling into chaos.  

Page 7

Rick (Thought): Apartment seems in order, but maybe the answering machine will shed some light on the situation. 

Page 8:

~beeeeeeep~
Julie: Hey Becky, it's Julie, trying to catch you before you head over. Don't forget to bring something formal for Sunday night's dinner- daddy's throwing a nice dinner for our last day at the resort! See you girl.
~beeeeeeep~
Robert: Hey Becky, it's Robert. Wanted to see if you would like to go out this weekend. Call me back!
~beeep~
Robert: Becky, didn't know if you got in late or something, but my offer still stands! Gimme a call pretty lady!
~beeep~
Robert: What the hell, Becky? I thought things were going well with us- or do you just take all the guys out till they buy you a bit a jewlery!? You're nothing but a two-bit bitch!
story_txt:
The PitchEver wonder if a snowman bleeds? Probably not, you're a sane, rational human being - but now that we're talking about it, the one place you're gonna find out is right here, with my comic series Ice Cold Killers: The Serious Cases of Detective Rick Frost. This series takes place in a reality where snowmen roam the streets devoid of human life, doing their best to make happy lives for themselves in a 1940's style environment. This happiness is threatened when a mysterious serial killer known only as the Heat Miser starts making lives a living hell for the police force, and the city that just wants to feel safe. To make matters worse the blabbering mouth of the chief of police has made the work even harder by letting the news get a hold on the serial killer's M.O.. Now, among a slew of copy-cat killers trying to slide by the system, it's up to Detective Rick Frost to bring justice back to the streets. 
My name is Steven Terrill, and I've been studying writing for almost a decade, with a Bachelors in Creative Writing from Waynesburg University, and working on a Masters in Creative Writing from Southern New Hampshire University. I also have a deep love of psychology and hold a Bachelors in the field from Waynesburg University as well. I currently reside in Waynesburg, working at a local pizza shop to pay the bills, and trying to squeeze in time for my creative endeavors. 
I've been a fan of comics for years, but I've never tried writing one before. With this project I hope to not only make a start in the field, but make a mark as well. I love studying the pathology of serial killers, but even more interesting to me are the people who attempt top circumvent the law by matching their crimes to the M.O. of other criminals. That takes a special kind of psychopath, if you ask me, and that's a major part of what I want to explore with this series. Sure, they are all going to be snowmen, but they will be human as well.  
Worried I might not be a good writer? Check out my publications in eFiction, a digital lit magazine. Kimberly Ann and Far From Home were two short stories I published through them, and Kimberly Ann in it's crappy rough draft form won me a Scholastic Gold Key Award for short story in 2008 when I was still in high school. Good luck finding that version of the story though, I may have burned all my copies when I rewrote it in college screaming "What was I thinking?!" What this means for you is that not only am I a published writer, I'm also willing to take a critical look at my work. 
You are super important to this project. Without you, this series probably won't get made. The amount of time and energy that will going into this project would leave me without the extra time or energy to gather the materials I need to be successful. More importantly you are a crucial part of this project because the more you back me, even just by sending a supporting message my way, the greater the odds are of this being amazing. Little signs of support are the real currency here, the actual funding amount is just a helpful bonus to get the tools to do the job right. 
That's about it for me and the general scope of the project, and I want to take the time to thank you for reading even this far. I hope you enjoyed the concept, at the very least, and even if you don't contribute, feel free to message me about questions about the project or suggestions to improve! My goal is for the first five issues to be done by August, but anyone receiving stickers will receive them by the end of June, God willing! What Are The Funds For?800$ is a lot of cash, and it's your cash, so you deserve to know where it's all going to be going. 

Drawing Equipment: I'm not talking about pens and paper, I'm talking about nice digital drawing equipment. I'm no pro at art, but I know that with the proper tools in my hands I can make something we can all enjoy. Typically the got o brand is Wacom, which I have used in the past, but unless you're willing to spend a buttload of cash on them, you're stuck with a basic drawing pad. What I hope to get instead of their larger drawing monitor, is a Samsung Galaxy Note Tablet model 2014 or newer, which has a comparable drawing stylus to the Wacom models, at a much more affordable price. Most of the funding will go to this, since the cost ranges from 500 to 600 dollars.

Perks!: I'm going to try and offer as many cool perks as I can think of, but some perks are going to have to match the level of commitment to the project, and that can get a little pricey. What ever is left over from the funds after purchasing the drawing equipment, is going into help paying for the perks. 

Long Term Stretch Goals: I've tried to keep the cost down low on this project, I don't want anyone to chip in and feel jibbed on their contributions. As the project takes off, I'll be trying to keep up with everyone as the funds are raised, and for every 50 dollars raised, I am going to post a sketch from the Pilot issue of the comic, so that even people not getting a PDF of the Pilot will get a chance to see it. Also, any funds raised past the funding amount will go into a side fund for me to try and take time off work to sit down and focus on only the comic to get it done faster, so that you all all can reap the benefits sooner! Basically, over funding is going to fund me taking a sabbatical to work solely on this project, I'll even time it with my school break! 
Your ImpactI can't stress enough that each of you reading this an important part of the project to me. 
Without you, this project is going to suffer the wears and tears of time as the window of opportunity for me to work on it slowly passes.
With you, we're going to build a strong community for this project, and you're going to be on the forefront of all of it. 
Even when this project closes on indiegogo, our journey will continue, and I will keep you all in the loop, as long as you want to be. Plus, I don't know how to make spam messages, so you'll know that every message from me is legit! 
Other Ways You Can HelpMoney is tight all around, believe me I know. If you can't contribute but you like this project, you can still help! 
Share this project! A lot! You may not get a perk from it, but you'll make my day a little brighter for it!
Tell your friends! 
email me to tell me what you think: detectiverickfrost@gmail.com

If you do email me, even to tell me you think this project sucks butts, expect a response! 
Thank you all for your time!Steven TerrillHere are all the Pilot issues pages unlocked:Pg1Pg2 (Be sure to note the lite shadows!)Page 3Officer: Body of Ms. Becky Shraz, found approx. 8:30 this morning by a Robert Nase, morning cook over at Joe's. Body was melted using a heat source of at least 200 degrees Fahrenheit, given the relative frosting on the body. No items found on the body, besides the scarf, body was I.D.ed by Mr. Nase, says she frequents Joe's. Central says the name matches the address 503 E. Lehew, Apt 20, right across the street there. Rick: Any witnesses?Officer: None so far, detective.Rick: Of course not. Page 4Panel 1.Rick: Start canvasing the area, I want a two block radius to start with.Panel 2.Rick: Sick bastard go her ont he way home.Panel 3.Rick: Found out where she worked, co-workers might know why she was out so late.Panel 4.And if you see Captain Daves, tell him this isn't a Heat Miser case, it's another copy cat thanks to his loud mouth.Page 5.Panel 1.Officer: Detective Frost, with all due respect, how can you rule that out already?Rick: Doesn't fit the M.O.Panel 2.Rick: look at her hand, part of the ring finger is missing, suggesting her jewelry was stolen. Heat Miser leaves his victims in tact.Panel 3.Rick: Secondly, the melting on the body is too symmetrical, suggesting a portable heat source.Panel 4. Rick: The heat miser has only every killed using natural heat sources from the environment. Panel 5.Rick: This has copy cat written all over it. If I was a betting man I'd say at this end of this we're going to be throwing some jackass into jail that read the tabloids and thought he could get away with knocking his wife off. Page 6panel 1Officer: Sir, where are you heading?Rick:I'm heading over to her apartment, see if I can dig something up.Panel 2Rick (Thought): At least the captain hasn't run off about ALL of the evidence. Our one saving grace in identifying these copy carts is that no one apart from me and the captain know about the cryptic messages the Heat Miser has been leaving. Still, that does little to amend all he has leaked.Panel 3Rick (Thought): Every week it's another murder, all because of his incompetence, and the city is falling into chaos.  Page 7Rick (Thought): Apartment seems in order, but maybe the answering machine will shed some light on the situation. Page 8:~beeeeeeep~Julie: Hey Becky, it's Julie, trying to catch you before you head over. Don't forget to bring something formal for Sunday night's dinner- daddy's throwing a nice dinner for our last day at the resort! See you girl.~beeeeeeep~Robert: Hey Becky, it's Robert. Wanted to see if you would like to go out this weekend. Call me back!~beeep~Robert: Becky, didn't know if you got in late or something, but my offer still stands! Gimme a call pretty lady!~beeep~Robert: What the hell, Becky? I thought things were going well with us- or do you just take all the guys out till they buy you a bit a jewlery!? You're nothing but a two-bit bitch!

story:
What is Mind Wack?


Mind Wack Productions was formed around one main idea; make quality comics, novels, animations, and merchandise with an entertaining and unique story and characters.

Scott Lindsey and Chris Wacker have been working on our first big franchise which we have named, "Tekka," for almost 3 years now. Our work includes a web comic (ongoing), a variety of merchandise designs available through our online store, a table top board game, several small scale web games (in development), and a set of novels (Volume 1 in editing, available late 2014.)

We are highly dedicated to our brand and our fans, and we would love to be able to share our passion with a wider audience in the near future!

      What We Need:

      We are trying to raise $2000 to attend Wizard World Comic Con in Chicago August 21-24, 2014. We have stretched our personal funds to their limit already this year, and the support of our fans will go a long way toward launching the next phase of our projects.


      Where is All the Money Going?

      Main Goals:

      First we need the table! The registration is $400, and travel will be around $300 (after what we have already invested.) After that, the funds will break down like this:

      100 Standard Prints of the comic( includes first two chapters): $250 after shipping.

      100 Collector's Edition Prints (includes standard PLUS 8 extra pages front and back [16 extra images total!])- $300 after shipping.

      1 Display Banner-$50 after shipping.

      30 copies of the first novel- $250 after shipping

      30 Collector's Boxes- approx. $100 after shipping

      1 prototype copy of the Board Game for Beta testing and display - approx. $100 after shipping.


      Anything left over will be used to enhance our display and buff up the perks our contributors receive!

      Stretch Goals:

      If we hit our goal early and rise above and beyond expectations, we will begin the climb toward our Stretch Goals!

      $2500-150 Extra Comic and Art Prints-  At this point, every contributor at the $25 level and up will get 2 exclusive, first-look pages from chapter 2 of the comic included in their print!

      $3000-Four more full copies of the game-  PERK: We will hold a drawing for 2 Beta copies of the board game for anyone above the $25 level!

      $4000- 200 copy, self-published release of the novel- Early release of the game AND novel! The board game will start full Beta test phase in September instead of January 2015! PERK: We will add 2 more copies to the raffle!

      $5000-10 extra Beta copies of the game-  PERKS: Every backer will be entered into a raffle for ONE(1) 3-4 wristband to Wizard World! (Travel and lodging excluded), PLUS, Every single backer will get access to each new page of Chapter 2 of the webcomic 2-3 days before it is live to the public!

      What's In It For You?

      Other than the satisfaction of helping an Indie comic grow, our supporters will also receive some great perks and rewards! We have special edition copies of the comic, t-shirts, original artwork, and much more! Check out the backer rewards area to the right for more details.


      What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

      Sometimes even the best laid plans can go awry. We are confident in our fans and supporters, but in the event we fall short of our funding goal we will still march onward! Our campaign is set to pay out whatever amount we can raise in 30 days, and we are dedicated to repaying that support. If we fall short, every backer will still receive their perks, even if it means we pay out of pocket!

      What Tekka and Mind Wack Productions Mean to Us, and What We Hope It Could Mean to You:

      Chris and I have put our blood, sweat, tears, and souls into bringing the Tekka Universe to life, and our passion for both the comic and Mind Wack Productions as a whole are unmatched. 

      We believe that the themes and subtext of our story create a brilliant caricature of life, relationships, politics, and religion; not to mention it has demons, gods, guns, beasts, and explosions!

      Though our comic has only been in the public eye for about 7 months, we have had a surprising and pleasing number of return readers. We feel strongly that, while each page isn't always as perfect as we would like (mostly due to time constraints,) we present our fans with compelling and engaging art and story elements. 

      We are currently ranked 471 on the TopWebComics list, which has been a HUGE boon to our motivation, as it shows we have begun to make an impression on our readers. Thanks to everyone who has taken the time to vote for us!

      As this campaign runs, we will be posting some exclusive images and sneak peeks of the future of Tekka and Mind Wack, and if things go well the first week, we will even be releasing some advance excerpts from the first Tekka novel, and even a few Alpha demos of upcoming games!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We all go through tough times, especially in the current economy! If you are unable to contribute as a backer, there are many other ways to show support for our project:

      • Spread the word! Let friends and acquaintances know about our comic and share the link to this campaign.
      • Share our campaign through social media! There are tons of handy buttons to make spreading the news easy and fast!
      • Send us some fan art! We are always looking for feedback from readers and fans, and fan art or fan fiction are fantastic ways to show your support! Just email us your art and stories and we may feature it here and on our website!


                  Thank you all for your amazing support and for taking the time to check us out! With your support, we can take the next step in bringing Tekka and other Mind Wack projects to the world!

We feel strongly that, while each page isn't always as perfect as we would like (mostly due to time constraints,) we present our fans with compelling and engaging art and story elements. We are currently ranked 471 on the TopWebComics list, which has been a HUGE boon to our motivation, as it shows we have begun to make an impression on our readers. Thanks to everyone who has taken the time to vote for us!As this campaign runs, we will be posting some exclusive images and sneak peeks of the future of Tekka and Mind Wack, and if things go well the first week, we will even be releasing some advance excerpts from the first Tekka novel, and even a few Alpha demos of upcoming games!Other Ways You Can HelpWe all go through tough times, especially in the current economy! If you are unable to contribute as a backer, there are many other ways to show support for our project:
Spread the word! Let friends and acquaintances know about our comic and share the link to this campaign.
Share our campaign through social media! There are tons of handy buttons to make spreading the news easy and fast!
Send us some fan art! We are always looking for feedback from readers and fans, and fan art or fan fiction are fantastic ways to show your support! Just email us your art and stories and we may feature it here and on our website!


Thank you all for your amazing support and for taking the time to check us out! With your support, we can take the next step in bringing Tekka and other Mind Wack projects to the world!

story:
THE GOAL

WIELDER is a down-to-earth superhero saga that mashes up biblical, queer, and classic comic book elements to explore contemporary issues of identity, spirituality, gender, media, and diaspora through the lens of far-out adventure stories.

In February, the LYRE COMICS launched the FIRST ISSUE of WIELDER, written and created by David Goldberg and illustrated by Arron Malone. You can read issue one here! Now, with new series artist Ryan Cutter, the Lyre team is looking to complete the first story arc with FOUR MORE ISSUES: online and in print, free to read. Based on response and demand, we will determine whether WIELDER can continue as a series, be profitable, and where it would belong in 2016 and beyond.

character sketches by new series artist Ryan Cutter

WHY THIS BOOK IS DIFFERENT

This series features women of varying ages, a lead who is exploring his faith, many queer and trans players, and an African American dream princess. This series lacks the damp and dreary ethos of many modern comics. It is not particularly violent or disturbed. It is meant to inspire a loyal fanbase and will be written to build suspense and encourage discussion between issues. The author intends to bring in new and curious readers who have felt alienated by the depressing male protagonists of other comic books, along with longtime readers who crave a return to consistent and momentous stories.

THE COMIC

WIELDER is a fantastical series that starts in the Old Testament, gets on its feet during the Second World War, and truly begins in present day, with a TEXAS INMATE named Jeff Barber. After learning that he is King David’s long lost scion, Jeff will break out of jail to become the arbiter of justice… and lose himself in the process. Aided by the last Wielder, his BACK-FROM-THE-DEAD grandmother GOSIA; a mysterious ASTRAL PRINCESS named Lirona; and a SENSUAL SHAMAN named Alejandro, he’ll have to brush up on magical, dimensional, and species-driven politics, work on his public branding, and get his mystical allies and very human family to agree on some kind of a game plan.

This book is inspired by the best-friends-as-world-savers feel of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, the spiritual essence of Battlestar Galactica, and the addicting mythological codex of Avatar: the Last Airbender. It builds its history and mysticism from the Old Testament and spins it into an immersive world of its own. 

character sketches by new series artist Ryan Cutter

WHY WE NEED YOU

Your contribution will pay to remaster the first issue; cover art fees for the next four issues; finance photoshop, printing, variant covers, website domain name; and, if you are feeling generous, send us to comic-con.

IN THE END

This fundraiser is about breathing life to characters who demand it and giving art a chance to shine on its own. If you cannot contribute, please share WIELDER and help it find its audience. 

LOVE and ETERNAL GLORY,

David Goldberg

LIKE THE LYRE on Facebook
GET UPDATES on Twitter
READ ISSUE ONE at the Lyre Site

story:
Issue 1 of Beastlands was successfully funded through Kickstarter. We doubled our funding goal with almost 500 backers. Thanks to our fans we were able to print a beautiful high quality collectable comic. Issue 1 is still available in this campaign. Now we're back to print issue 2 of Beastlands!

Beastlands is an action adventure story set in a beautiful medieval fantasy world, where some people have companion beasts known as "Keepers". 

 In Beastlands you'll go on an adventure with a group of 3 teenage friends, Mac, Ava and Ping. They're on a journey to find out what Mac's father, an explorer, was trying to discover before he disappeared. On this quest their friendships will be put to the test all while a tyrannical King looks to outlaw Keepers from the land.

Who will love Beastlands?

  • Fans of Pokemon, Digimon, Game of Thrones, Monster Hunter, The Witcher, How to Train your Dragon, The Last Airbender and other fantasy worlds filled with unique creatures.
  • Fans of comics like Saga, Isola, Seven to Eternity, Deadly Class, Coda, Extremity, Middlewest and Low.
  • People who like the beautiful films by Studio Ghibli and their wonderous stories and worlds.
  • If you like comics with a charming fantasy world, with BEAUTIFUL ART and a heartful, genuine, emotional and impactful story.

What do you get when backing this kickstarter?

All our books are printed at the highest quality, with thick glossy papers and a thicker matte cover. It's important to us that it feels good in your hands!

  • Beastlands #2 : 24 pages of story printed at standard american comic book size on high quality gloss paper with a thick matte cover.
  • Beastlands #1 : 21 pages of story printed at standard american comic book size on high quality gloss paper with a thick matte cover.
  • Beastlands #2 has 3 cover options, one being a Virgin Cover printed on Foil Holographic!
  • Collectors edition : signed and numbered with a numeric foil stamping out of 1,000 on the cover - very limited!
  • Acknowledgements : get your name printed in the acknowledgements section of the book and become immortalized FOREVER!
  • Get our other comic series 'The Wild Cosmos #1': 26 pages of story printed on high quality paper and oversized at 8x12 with a matte cover and with back matter (The Wild Cosmos is picked up by SCOUT COMICS now, so this version of the book is SUPER LIMITED  and rare!).

PRAISE FOR BEASTLANDS

Check out what some pros and critics said about Beastlands!

REVIEWS OF BEASTLANDS #1

"Curtis Clow unravels a story that is sure to keep our adventuring shoes on nonetheless. Paired with Jo Mi-Gyeong's art, this story is a must read!  ...one of the best indie comics I’ve read in a long time!  I absolutely love BEASTLANDS #1 and cannot wait to see what comes next!" - ComicsVerse.com

" ...with the delightful artwork results in this first issue of, "Beastlands," being a great read. I'd excitedly rate, "Beastlands," first issue with 5 out of 5 stars... " - TheNewestRant.com

"Beastlands is a comic that is made with both imagination and heart as it is built with the highest quality of production I’ve seen. The creators have clearly put their blood, sweat, and tears into a story that deserves every reader it can get." - TheModernGafa.com 

"Beastlands #1 scratches a fantasy itch and could offer a fascinating take on the strength of the bonds between humans and their pets." - OmniComic.com

We have 3 different cover options for Beastlands #2, including a Virgin/Foil cover that has a holographic effect!

VIRGIN FOIL VARIANT - VARIANT B - STANDARD/COLLECTORS COVER

VIRGIN FOIL VARIANT ABOVE

STANDARD/COLLECTORS COVER ABOVE

VARIANT B COVER

Beastlands #2 - Page 3

Beastlands #2 - Page 12-13

Beastlands #2 - Page 14

BEASTLANDS #1

Beastlands #1 - Page 1

Beastlands #1 - Page 2

CURTIS CLOW

Writer - Curtis is a professional comic book writer. Some comics that he's written and created include The Wild Cosmos with Scout Comics and The Dragon's Kin with In Hiatus Studios. He's a fan of all things sci-fi and fantasy. This'll be his fourth Kickstarter campaign, successfully fulfilling and running the previous three. Currently living in sunny Orange County, California. Besides writing at his desk, he enjoys practicing jiu jitsu and muay thai and going on backpacking camping trips.

JO MI-GYEONG 

Artist - Jo currently lives in Seoul, Korea. She is a big fan of DC comics and loves to read them when not making art. She also is a Comics Art Challenger!

TOBEN RACICOT

Letterer - Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they create Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne. He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Comic Books at the University of Waterloo. 

 

WHY THIS STORY?

 "As a writer they say "write what you know". Now, I love writing high concept sci-fi and fantasy stories that immerse you into a whole new world. But this is so much more than that. This is a story about being a teenager and going after your purpose in life. Sometimes to a fault. This is a story about friendship - but also about owning, caring for and loving a pet. In my mid 20's I finally got a dog of my own, a beagle named Ellie. Taking care of a dog was more work than I ever expected. One day I took her to the park, like I did many mornings, for a game of fetch. That day Ellie was struck by a car. I had to walk back home with her in my arms while I thought her life was drifting away from her little body. She was in rough shape. All I could do was hope that she'd hang in there. Once home, we rushed to the vet so they could care for her. Luckily Ellie survived and made a full recovery. She's 3 now, living her life sprinting through the Southern California beaches. She's already taught me more than I could've expected. This is a story about appreciating what you have, before it's too late. This is a story for Ellie."

-Curtis

 

Beastlands #2 is already 100% finished and we already have copies! We'll be using indie gogo indemand to continue our Kickstarter.

 

 SHIPPING 

It's important to us that your comics arrive safe and undamaged!

 

All comics will be individually bagged and boarded. Then shipped into the secure Gemini Comic Supply Flash Mailers, which provides impact resistant protection.  We'll be doing all the packaging ourselves to ensure it's done right and safe.

 

 As a group of independent creators Kickstarter is a chance for us to self publish and produce this comic.  Sure, we'd love to have a publisher with us on the series someday. But right now, this is as raw as it gets. This is a group of friends and creators making something for the love and passion of it. This is us trying to get our story out there no matter what it takes.

As a passion project we've already put hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars into this project. We're doing this for the love of comics. A successful Kickstarter campaign will allow us to cover any more art costs, print the book, distribute the book, take it to conventions and hopefully continue the series of Beastlands! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We hope you decide to join this campaign and go on an adventure with Mac, Ava and Ping!

Thanks
story_txt:
Issue 1 of Beastlands was successfully funded through Kickstarter. We doubled our funding goal with almost 500 backers. Thanks to our fans we were able to print a beautiful high quality collectable comic. Issue 1 is still available in this campaign. Now we're back to print issue 2 of Beastlands!


Beastlands is an action adventure story set in a beautiful medieval fantasy world, where some people have companion beasts known as "Keepers". 
 In Beastlands you'll go on an adventure with a group of 3 teenage friends, Mac, Ava and Ping. They're on a journey to find out what Mac's father, an explorer, was trying to discover before he disappeared. On this quest their friendships will be put to the test all while a tyrannical King looks to outlaw Keepers from the land.

Who will love Beastlands?

Fans of Pokemon, Digimon, Game of Thrones, Monster Hunter, The Witcher, How to Train your Dragon, The Last Airbender and other fantasy worlds filled with unique creatures.
Fans of comics like Saga, Isola, Seven to Eternity, Deadly Class, Coda, Extremity, Middlewest and Low.
People who like the beautiful films by Studio Ghibli and their wonderous stories and worlds.
If you like comics with a charming fantasy world, with BEAUTIFUL ART and a heartful, genuine, emotional and impactful story.



What do you get when backing this kickstarter?
All our books are printed at the highest quality, with thick glossy papers and a thicker matte cover. It's important to us that it feels good in your hands!

Beastlands #2 : 24 pages of story printed at standard american comic book size on high quality gloss paper with a thick matte cover.
Beastlands #1 : 21 pages of story printed at standard american comic book size on high quality gloss paper with a thick matte cover.
Beastlands #2 has 3 cover options, one being a Virgin Cover printed on Foil Holographic!
Collectors edition : signed and numbered with a numeric foil stamping out of 1,000 on the cover - very limited!
Acknowledgements : get your name printed in the acknowledgements section of the book and become immortalized FOREVER!
Get our other comic series 'The Wild Cosmos #1': 26 pages of story printed on high quality paper and oversized at 8x12 with a matte cover and with back matter (The Wild Cosmos is picked up by SCOUT COMICS now, so this version of the book is SUPER LIMITED  and rare!).


PRAISE FOR BEASTLANDS
Check out what some pros and critics said about Beastlands!




REVIEWS OF BEASTLANDS #1
"Curtis Clow unravels a story that is sure to keep our adventuring shoes on nonetheless. Paired with Jo Mi-Gyeong's art, this story is a must read!  ...one of the best indie comics I’ve read in a long time!  I absolutely love BEASTLANDS #1 and cannot wait to see what comes next!" - ComicsVerse.com
" ...with the delightful artwork results in this first issue of, "Beastlands," being a great read. I'd excitedly rate, "Beastlands," first issue with 5 out of 5 stars... " - TheNewestRant.com
"Beastlands is a comic that is made with both imagination and heart as it is built with the highest quality of production I’ve seen. The creators have clearly put their blood, sweat, and tears into a story that deserves every reader it can get." - TheModernGafa.com 
"Beastlands #1 scratches a fantasy itch and could offer a fascinating take on the strength of the bonds between humans and their pets." - OmniComic.com

We have 3 different cover options for Beastlands #2, including a Virgin/Foil cover that has a holographic effect!


VIRGIN FOIL VARIANT - VARIANT B - STANDARD/COLLECTORS COVER

VIRGIN FOIL VARIANT ABOVE

STANDARD/COLLECTORS COVER ABOVE

VARIANT B COVER

Beastlands #2 - Page 3

Beastlands #2 - Page 12-13

Beastlands #2 - Page 14

BEASTLANDS #1

Beastlands #1 - Page 1

Beastlands #1 - Page 2


CURTIS CLOW
Writer - Curtis is a professional comic book writer. Some comics that he's written and created include The Wild Cosmos with Scout Comics and The Dragon's Kin with In Hiatus Studios. He's a fan of all things sci-fi and fantasy. This'll be his fourth Kickstarter campaign, successfully fulfilling and running the previous three. Currently living in sunny Orange County, California. Besides writing at his desk, he enjoys practicing jiu jitsu and muay thai and going on backpacking camping trips.
JO MI-GYEONG

story:
Hello potential Indiegogo backers, here's some info about this sketchbook that we're attempting to fund!

Shelby Robertson Sketchbook is a compilation of designs and finished color artwork by Shelby Robertson. Shelby Robertson is a professional comic book artist of over 25 years experience. Credits range from Marvel, Valiant, and Image Comics titles. This 24 page Sketchbook is presented in a standard comic book format, so will fit seamlessly with your collection. More pages of content will be added if those specific stretch goals are met.


HELP US LAUNCH AN EXCITING NEW SKETCHBOOK!
We need your help and support to launch an exciting new retrospective collection of Shelby Robertson creative artworks. This was a fun project to put together and is fully complete and ready for print.


CONTENT:

  • This book contains sketches, finished line-art, and full color designs by Shelby Robertson. You get an inside look at several intellectual properties created by Shelby along with creature art, character design, and one-off illustrations. We are also offering several covers. You may notice that some are homages to books that impacted and inspired Shelby's interest in pursuing comic book art at a young age. Also note that all Virgin edition covers are printed as shiny Foil editions.

PLEASE READ PERKS AVAILABLE THOROUGHLY to explore all options on how you can make this book become a reality!!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET!

  • This is a fairly easy book to fulfill on our end, as it is already fully complete and ready to be sent for print. If stretch goals are met, the additional pages listed within those goals are ALSO paginated and ready to be added to the book, along with all other files for cards, variant covers, etc. We are excited for physical copies of this comic to be in hand and ideally want it in your possession as early as possible. We have set our funding goal to bare minimum for getting this project to the press for printing. Anything which exceeds that goes directly to stretch goal items and helps jumpstart future projects. We appreciate everyone who wants to be a part of this campaign!


We ship all books bagged and boarded securely in a Gemini II sturdy comic book mailer. Anyone who is getting original art will receive their full package safely packed in a 12"x18"x3" U-Line heavy corrugated box. We do not roll original artwork or art prints, all ship boxed, flat, and protected. We believe in shipping items to you in a way that we wished others shipped collectibles to us!


CAMPAIGN STRETCH GOALS:

  • 1. Goal 1,500 USD - FREE 4 Additional Pages added to all copies of the book (All books become 28 pages).
  • 2. Goal 2,500 USD - FREE Set of 3 collector trading cards added to every order (Standard collector card size to that of an official baseball, hockey, football, etc).
  • 3. Goal 3,300 USD - FREE 4 Additional Pages added to all copies of the book (All books become 32 pages).
  • 4. Goal  5,000 USD - FREE Set of 2 additional collector trading cards added to every order, PLUS a FREE sticker added to every order.
  • 5. Goal 6,500 USD - Thrill foil variant unlocked.
  • 6. Goal 8,000 USD - FREE Limited Edition RAGETALITY foil parody trading card and holiday themed postcard added to every order.
  • 7. Goal 10,000 USD - TBD

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
With the COVID-19 pandemic still not fully under control, this can introduce unpredictable printing and shipping delay issues. All work on this project is completed and we intend to ship all issues by the middle of December 2020, HOWEVER, are aiming for the earliest possible fulfillment and shipping. This depends entirely on how fast the printer can finish making the books and get all physical copies into our hands following this campaign.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book sketchbook by contributing money. Not a problem! We encourage you to share our campaign link through your social media pages. We appreciate all forms of support on our books and appreciate you for taking the time to do so!! Together we can help do our part to keep the comic book market healthy, innovative, and creative!

REGULAR COVER A

FOIL COVER A

REGULAR COVER B

FOIL COVER B

REGULAR COVER C

FOIL COVER C

INTERIOR PAGE SAMPLES

INTERIOR PAGE SAMPLE

INTERIOR PAGE SAMPLE

ORIGINAL 11"X17" COVER A ARTWORK

ORIGINAL 11"X17" COVER C ARTWORK

story:
The Bull #1

  • My name is Jake Campbell.  I am a father of 3 who has a passion for comic books.  I have been drawing for most of my life.  This product is my love letter to anyone who created their own characters or who wants to create their own characters.  My whole life I always wanted to publish my own book, but other priorities always eclipsed it.
  • I was recently introduced to a group called 100 Days of Comics.  In this group, you work on your book for 100 days straight for at least 30 minutes a day.  This is perfect for anyone who has a busy family life.  This book is the result of those 100 days.  It's not perfect, but it is finished.  
  • With your help, I will be able to make more ongoing adventures of The Bull.  The character's main purpose is to do good deeds.  In turn, I hope you all are inspired to do good, and to create your own comics. 

What You Get

  • I need at least $500 to help me print this book and get it out to you all.  Probably a third of the funds will compensate me.
  • The perks will include the fully colored original pages of the story, black and white sketches, and T Shirts sporting The Bull logo!
story_txt:
The Bull #1

My name is Jake Campbell.  I am a father of 3 who has a passion for comic books.  I have been drawing for most of my life.  This product is my love letter to anyone who created their own characters or who wants to create their own characters.  My whole life I always wanted to publish my own book, but other priorities always eclipsed it.
I was recently introduced to a group called 100 Days of Comics.  In this group, you work on your book for 100 days straight for at least 30 minutes a day.  This is perfect for anyone who has a busy family life.  This book is the result of those 100 days.  It's not perfect, but it is finished.  
With your help, I will be able to make more ongoing adventures of The Bull.  The character's main purpose is to do good deeds.  In turn, I hope you all are inspired to do good, and to create your own comics. 

What You Get

I need at least $500 to help me print this book and get it out to you all.  Probably a third of the funds will compensate me.
The perks will include the fully colored original pages of the story, black and white sketches, and T Shirts sporting The Bull logo!

story:
About me

Hello,

My name is Olayinka Agunbiade and I'm an artist
I'm starting a fund raising campaign in order to complete a comic book series called The Protectors (created in 2009). It's been a long dream of mine to create a comic book that depicts superheroes from the motherland, which bring a different flavor to the picture.

About the project
It's about a group of strangers who obtain powers from  mysterious rocks. This leads to an encounter with a secret group who have evil intentions. Do they choose the path of good or evil?


Why I need funding

The funds will be used for printing of the book and getting an editor. The story, art and lettering will be done by me so this hopefully cuts down the costs a bit.Your contributions will help introduce more diverse superheroes. In a nutshell, majority of the funds will go towards, marketing, purchasing bar codes, perks, shipping, and hiring an Editor

Please join me and support my project\dream and I pray someone will do the same for yours

What you'll get

$10 gets  you a digital download of all 3 issues of the comic book

$15 gets you a hard copy of issue#1 and credits in the comic

$25 gets you hard copies of all 3 issues with credits in the comic

$50 gets you a t-shirt of the Protectors + hard copies of all 3 issues with credits in the comic

$55 gets you a t-shirt of the Protectors + hard copies of all 3 issues with credits in the comic + 1 autographed hand drawn sketch

$70  gets you a t-shirt of the Protectors + hard copies of all 3 issues with credits in the comic + 1 autographed hand drawn sketch + a protectors cell phone case (iPhone 6/6S and 6/6S Plus, as well as the iPhone 4, 4s, 5, and 5s, Samsung Galaxy S5, as well as the Samsung Galaxy S4)

$200 gets you a t-shirt of the Protectors + hard copies of all 3 issues with credits in the comic + 1 autographed hand drawn sketch + a protectors cell phone case (iPhone 6/6S and 6/6S Plus, as well as the iPhone 4, 4s, 5, and 5s, Samsung Galaxy S5, as well as the Samsung Galaxy S4) + action figure (one of the protectors)


Risks & Challenges

Challenges regarding this project involve issues that might arise with the print quality, so communicating with the printer and getting test runs and proofing will be crucial. 

Shipping costs for  donors' perks and books will be costly: shipping the items from the manufacturer to me residence and then to the individual donors

Purchasing bar codes and ISBN for the comics.

Paid marketing via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and other forms of Social media.

Getting a good editor will also be a challenge

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want any perks but still want to support the project, please donate whatever you can

Please help spread the word via: Facebook, twitter, Instagram and other social media outlets

Change your profile picture to a picture of the Protectors if you can.

Thanks a bunch!!!!


OlaYinka Agunbiade

story:
Our Story

Hi, Iï¿½m Danny Boyd, longtime filmmaker and professor, now fully immersed in the graphic novel world. I ask your help in the production of my first epic graphic novel, CARBON. The finished product will be a four-book story published as a single volume.

At this point in my life and career, creating in the graphic narrative format is not only more efficient, but more personally fulfilling. It makes me love production again! I can tell bigger stories, quicker, and still with the possibility of the product eventually making its way to cinema.

Most importantly, CARBON is near to my heart. It is the biggest thing I've written, and I think the best. For sure a work of the ï¿½fantasticï¿½ (Gods, monsters, and evil coal barons), but with an environmental viewpoint that matches my own - Responsible Green.

CARBON covers an original civilization before ours, ours on the tipping point of extinction, and what, if anything, livable we will leave behind on our current course.

The center of CARBON's universe? Smack-dab where the original Garden of Eden was ï¿½ Mingo County, WV! And who can save us from this most cataclysmic disaster in our human history? A courageous group of West Virginia coal miners and their community. These unlikely heroes are mankindï¿½s only hope on this edge of the end of the world.

I have contracted two of the best graphic novel artists in the world to help me bring CARBON to life in illustrator, Edi Guedes, and colorist, Alzir Alves, of Rascunho Studio in Brazil. And right here in Charleston, world-class letterer, Jason Arthur.

Upon completion, CARBON will be shopped to major publishers. Our first graphic novel, CHILLERS, will be released by a national publisher next year (details TBA soon) so I am confident that CARBON will have significant publication as well.

The Impact

Primarily, I hope for an entertaining, commercially successful graphic novel. This is my first opportunity to go "Epic" in the entertainment world. I could never have afforded the grand scale of CARBON as cinema working outside of the Hollywood system.

Rod Serling (Twilight Zone) is my greatest creative influence. He understood that in order to enlighten, especially with controversial subjects, we must first entertain. The subject of coal extraction (both the human labor & environmental issues) is a sticky wicket. It is a polarizing topic where it is hard to find common ground in the present-day "emotion" of it all. Perhaps using it as background context in a highly fictionalized entertainment form will allow for a more objective reevaluation. As well, bring a new audience to the issue.

Over 20 years ago I took the lead in leveraging West Virginia as a national and international filmmaking entity.  Many of you were a part of that movement. You partnered with me to do the near-impossible. I ask my old and new friends alike for that partnership again in this exciting, new frontier.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is exactly $7,150. $110 a page to pay the artist and letterer to complete the final 65 pages of the book. This is at a super discount to me considering the amazing talent I have assembled. It would typically be 2-3 times more. I already have close to $6,000 of my personal savings into the production of Books 1, 2 and the start of 3. My problem is I ran out of savings. I put my money where my mouth is, but I've run dry.

What you get? Besides being an active partner in the creation of CARBON, I'm giving out lots of goodies! Mini-posters, movies, books, comics, a starring role... Check it out!

Be assured, this book will be completed and released. If not fully funded through this campaign, I will find other ways. It may take me longer to save, but it will be finished. I have a history of getting things done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Straight up, if you can't help, you can't help. I fully understand. Been there myself, when I could and when I couldn't help others financially. So if you can't help due to financial or philosophical reasons, hakuna matata. We remain friends.

You can also help by simply spreading the word through your networks, both about this fundraising campaign, and when the book eventually comes out. Please be my army of reviewers.

If you would like to contribute in other ways, perhaps through the University, please contact me directly (danny@danielboyd.com).

Many thanks!

Danny

Carbon web page: http://danielboyd.com/wordpress/carbon

www.danielboyd.com

Our Story
Hi, Iï¿½m Danny Boyd, longtime filmmaker and professor, now fully immersed in the graphic novel world. I ask your help in the production of my first epic graphic novel, CARBON. The finished product will be a four-book story published as a single volume.
At this point in my life and career, creating in the graphic narrative format is not only more efficient, but more personally fulfilling. It makes me love production again! I can tell bigger stories, quicker, and still with the possibility of the product eventually making its way to cinema. 
Most importantly, CARBON is near to my heart. It is the biggest thing I've written, and I think the best. For sure a work of the ï¿½fantasticï¿½ (Gods, monsters, and evil coal barons), but with an environmental viewpoint that matches my own - Responsible Green.
CARBON covers an original civilization before ours, ours on the tipping point of extinction, and what, if anything, livable we will leave behind on our current course. 
The center of CARBON's universe? Smack-dab where the original Garden of Eden was ï¿½ Mingo County, WV! And who can save us from this most cataclysmic disaster in our human history? A courageous group of West Virginia coal miners and their community. These unlikely heroes are mankindï¿½s only hope on this edge of the end of the world.
I have contracted two of the best graphic novel artists in the world to help me bring CARBON to life in illustrator, Edi Guedes, and colorist, Alzir Alves, of Rascunho Studio in Brazil. And right here in Charleston, world-class letterer, Jason Arthur.
Upon completion, CARBON will be shopped to major publishers. Our first graphic novel, CHILLERS, will be released by a national publisher next year (details TBA soon) so I am confident that CARBON will have significant publication as well. 
The Impact
Primarily, I hope for an entertaining, commercially successful graphic novel. This is my first opportunity to go "Epic" in the entertainment world. I could never have afforded the grand scale of CARBON as cinema working outside of the Hollywood system. 
Rod Serling (Twilight Zone) is my greatest creative influence. He understood that in order to enlighten, especially with controversial subjects, we must first entertain. The subject of coal extraction (both the human labor & environmental issues) is a sticky wicket. It is a polarizing topic where it is hard to find common ground in the present-day "emotion" of it all. Perhaps using it as background context in a highly fictionalized entertainment form will allow for a more objective reevaluation. As well, bring a new audience to the issue.
Over 20 years ago I took the lead in leveraging West Virginia as a national and international filmmaking entity.  Many of you were a part of that movement. You partnered with me to do the near-impossible. I ask my old and new friends alike for that partnership again in this exciting, new frontier. 
What We Need & What You Get
What I need is exactly $7,150. $110 a page to pay the artist and letterer to complete the final 65 pages of the book. This is at a super discount to me considering the amazing talent I have assembled. It would typically be 2-3 times more. I already have close to $6,000 of my personal savings into the production of Books 1, 2 and the start of 3. My problem is I ran out of savings. I put my money where my mouth is, but I've run dry.
What you get? Besides being an active partner in the creation of CARBON, I'm giving out lots of goodies! Mini-posters, movies, books, comics, a starring role... Check it out!
Be assured, this book will be completed and released. If not fully funded through this campaign, I will find other ways. It may take me longer to save, but it will be finished. I have a history of getting things done.
Other Ways You Can Help
Straight up, if you can't help, you can't help. I fully understand. Been there myself, when I could and when I couldn't help others financially. So if you can't help due to financial or philosophical reasons, hakuna matata. We remain friends.
You can also help by simply spreading the word through your networks, both about this fundraising campaign, and when the book eventually comes out. Please be my army of reviewers. 
If you would like to contribute in other ways, perhaps through the University, please contact me directly (danny@danielboyd.com).
Many thanks!
Danny 
Carbon web page: http://danielboyd.com/wordpress/carbon
www.danielboyd.com

story:
OH YEAH, IT'S VAMPIRELLA and CYBERFROG once again!

 

I'm back!  This is great!  The first time I teamed up CYBERFROG and VAMPIRELLA felt like the good old days at HARRIS COMICS, and you all responded in kind, making it one of the most successful variant cover campaigns in ages!  Now that VAMPIRELLA's 50th Anniversary is upon us, and the first issue is an absolutely stratospheric success, it's time to do it again!  

 

THESE ARE HIGHLY LIMITED COLLECTIBLES!

 

You will receive a copy of the 20 page DYNAMITE COMICS VAMPIRELLA #1 written by comics legend CHRISTOPHER PRIEST with art by Ergun Gunduz and an EXCLUSIVE NEW COVER BY ME!

I'm ETHAN VAN SCIVER.  I've worked for 26 years for Hall of Heroes, Harris Comics, Marvel Comics and most notably DC Comics, creating the Emotional Spectrum for GREEN LANTERN, as well as important books like FLASH REBIRTH and SINESTRO CORPS WAR!

Now I'm working independently, creating massively anticipated new titles like REIGNBOW THE BRUTE and yes, CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY.

This time I'm bringing you a red hot cover, but with a FOIL ENHANCED LOGO!  I love this stuff!  Back in the 90's, we used to make our comics more fun by adding fun gimmicks to the covers.  Hardly anyone does that anymore.

 

But I do!  This comic will be BEAUTIFUL!  The foil will come in RED, GOLD or SILVER options!  Or just get the book in black and white with no logo at all!

 

This is the first issue of VAMPIRELLA's ongoing new series!  Get your copy with two big bonuses: CYBERFROG and a foil enhanced logo!

 

These books are ready to print and ship, so LET'S GET THIS FROG JUMPING!
