story:
Jon Malin and Mark Poulton bring you GRAVEYARD SHIFT! This is fully drawn and colored, we're using the funds for printing and hiring NERD WONDER to produce a 16 page Ashcan! Sample pages below!!

I'm very excited to finally get this project off the ground, it's been 8 years in the making and a labor of love. We worked on these pages for no money and paid the colorist out of pocket, the campaign goal will pretty much pay for the printing, shipping costs and 16 page ashcan production so if we beat it GREAT! If Mark and I make a few bucks in the end we'd be ecstatic! Thank you all so much!

Having met our funding goal in a matter of hours thanks to the overwhelming support of all of you, we now would like to make improvements to the product and add more incentives to the package you already purchased at no extra cost to you! So lets start the stretch goals!

$20,000 STRETCH GOAL*UNLOCKED*-GN UPGRADES! We will upgrade the cover stock and interior pages to a higher quality stock. This will help the colors POP! We will also be adding a spine to the book. All these things will help to give the book a better "feel" and make it a all around better addition to your collection!

$40,000 STRETCH GOAL*UNLOCKED*- GRAVEYARD SHIFT TRADING CARD! Exclusive to this campaign we will offer a  trading card featuring one member of the Graveyard shift. This card will not be available anywhere else. One per order.

$50,000 STRETCH GOAL*UNLOCKED*- PERFORMANCE BONUS FOR NERD WONDER! We will give the ever mysterious and boisterous Nerd Wonder, artist for our ASHCAN a bonus for every $50,000 raised. This first bonus gives her a higher page rate than almost anyone in the independent comics market! She also pledges a face reveal if we hit $150,000!! Tell your friends and lets make her a top paid talent!

$80,000 STRETCH GOAL*UNLOCKED*- Graphic Novel BONUS MATERIALS extension and another COVER UPGRADE! We're adding an additional 12 pages to the GRAVEYARD SHIFT GN filled with fun things like creator commentary, secret history, fan art and pinups! Cover stock will once again be upgraded, now from 135 lb to 10pt cover stock making this book nearly a WEAPON!

$100,000 STRETCH GOAL*UNLOCKED*(Exclusive to all $50+ backers)- COLORED ASHCAN+ GRAVEYARD SHIFT TRADING CARD #2!! That's right! We're gonna send the ASHCAN out to be colored by original GS colorist ZEE! We're throwing in GS Trading Card #2 to feature another character from GS, available nowhere else, it, like the first trading card(Available to all backers), will be exclusive to this campaign! We will also include additional PERFORMANCE BONUS FOR NERD WONDER! We hope all $25 backers will consider an upgrade to the $50+ tiers sending us through this stretch goal quickly!

story:
Just what is going on here?

I'm Emily Partridge, a young illustrator and comic artist living in Vancouver, BC. I've been making art my whole life, making comics for the past few years, and just over a year ago started posting them online under the name Mount Pleasant.
My journal strip started out as an exercise in improving my style and learning new techniques, since I knew I wanted to make comics but didn't have any good ideas for stories or jokes. To my surprise, people liked them. I started trying to be more open about my life in the hopes of helping people going through the same things I was. Now I've finally come up with a non-fiction story that I want to start getting people excited about, and along with the journal strips, I want to start getting stuff in print.

I've been able to attend a few conventions (TCAF and ECCC) and it's been amazing. I've met wonderful people and become way more inspired but have never been able to bring my own material to share. I want to give the people what they've been asking for, both at cons and online, and so this indiegogo project was born.
 
The Minicomics

My plan is to print two 20-page minis. One will be the Mount Pleasant journal strips that people are familiar with, and the other will be the Barking Dog Primer.
Barking Dog is going to be my fiction project about coyotes living on the seawall in Vancouver, comprising of 5 or 6 short volumes. The Primer won't be the first "official" comic, but, well, a primer. It'll have sketches, character designs, short stories, and some scrapped content that didn't make the cut into the first volume of Barking Dog.
Both of these minis will be around 50 percent exclusive content. Bits and pieces will be posted online, but there'll be a lot of stuff you won't see anywhere else!


Why?

Since this is a small project and there's no big crazy publishing costs or anything, I'm shooting fairly low. I'm looking to cover the costs of getting both the minis printed (100-200 of each), as well as a run of the new and improved 'Patron Saint of Ugh' prints. These will be sold online, and depending on how this project goes, informally at TCAF and for-real at VanCAF.

But why this?

As people who are familiar with my comics know, I'm not the most mentally sound person. I went to school and I had to leave. I had a job and I had to leave. I've taken a big chunk of time out of my life to get help fixing my brain and now I finally feel capable of re-starting my life. Your contribution not only means you get awesome swag; it means that I can leap headlong into the things I've been putting on hold because of the not-having-any-money problem.

 

But what if I'm having the not-having-any-money problem?

Trust me, I've been there. Well, I'm there right now! Even if all you can do is share this page it means the world to me. Talk about it, tweet it, tumble it, post it on facebook, I don't care!

If you're not one of us broke people, look over to the right of your screen to see what you can get for your money. There's some pretty neat stuff.

 

Finally, please notify me if you'll be able to pick up your perks in person (at TCAF or VanCAF), so I save on shipping and YOU get high-fives!

story:
DIE PFEFFER-CHRONIKEN
 

Hier beim Zwerchfell Verlag haben wir uns ganz besonders gefreut, dass Anna-Maria Jung auch ihr zweites Comicprojekt bei uns verlegen wollte. Mit 212 Seiten ist das Buch nicht nur wirklich dick geworden, wir wollten ihm auch sonst eine besonders schöne Ausstattung zukommen lassen: mattkaschiertes Hardcover, und der Titelzug in eitel gold'ner Folienprägung glänzend.

Worum geht's im Buch?

Ein Dorf ohne Verbrechen ist kein Ort für die wackere Mara Payne, Heldintochter und Klassenbeste der Nachtwache von Zarg. Mit dem Schwert ihrer Mutter und zwei Satteltaschen voll Gerechtigkeit reitet sie gen Acco, einem Ort voller Gefahren, Korruption und Ungeziefer, um es in der großen Stadt zu schaff en. Doch als Mara auf eine okkulte Mordserie stößt, dämmert ihr, dass sie zu viel von der extrascharfen Chilischote abgebissen hat. Gemeinsam mit dem freischaff enden Magier und Tunichtgut Jacop geht sie der Sache auf den Grund.

»Die Pfeffer-Chroniken« ist ein Fantasy-Epos mit einer Prise Noir-Krimi, illustren Figuren, Einhörnern und explodierenden Vögeln, sowie grob geschrotetem, dreckigem Humor. Nachwürzen unnötig.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir können Dir »Die Pfeffer-Chroniken« hier zum Subskriptionspreis anbieten. Das heißt, wenn Du uns vor dem Erstverkaufstag schon ein Buch abkaufst, bekommst Du es günstiger. Und zwar 10 Euro günstiger. Und einen exklusiven, signierten Druck mit dabei. Der Erlös hilft uns, unsere Druckerei schneller zu bezahlen und dadurch ein aufwändiger produziertes Buch anbieten zu können – wir selber nehmen davon nichts ein.

Jetzt

 … befindet sich das Buch gerade im Druck. Und wenn die Druckmaschinen nicht von bösen Mathematik-Magiern verzaubert werden, sind wir sicher, dass wir die fertigen Bücher Anfang Juli auf der ComicCon Stuttgart präsentieren können. Bis dahin gilt der Subskriptionspreis. Aber wie gesagt, nur für insgesamt 100 Exemplar. Und nicht mehr.

 

Anfang Juli

 … liefern wir die Bücher aus. Wer eine Subskription erworben hat, bekommt sein Exemplar nach Hause geliefert. Porto und Verpackung übernehmen wir, ist ja klar.

story:
ARTAN

Hello everyone.

We are Stefano Orlando and Gianfranco Casano and we are two guys who strongly believe in their dreams. “Artan” project begins long ago, and it starts from that primordial instinct we are all born with, that drives us to go towards distant and exotic worlds to live thousand adventures and thousand emotions.

The idea of this project was born part humorously, part seriously, but, after months and months of sacrifice and commitment, Artan has become not only our job, but even our world, where some times we pour our fears and our desires.

How many of you dreamed to do a job you love? That’s it: we are chasing this dream.




What’s ARTAN?

Artan is a Scifi-Fantasy comic entirely realized by three-dimensional graphics.

Its story takes place between two worlds: Barsec and Artan. Barsec is an over populated planet where the population has taken advantage in an uncontrolled way of its planet, destroying both the vegetation and the animal world. For this reason, a large group of rich and privileged settlers left the mother planet to colonize another habitable planet in the same solar system of Nikron: ARTAN.

When the settlers come, Artan is a virgin planet, full of vegetation and living beings. A perfect planet to create a new civilization based on a more rigorous and controlled life style than the one left on Barsec. But when the settlers arrive, they find another species was already living on Artan: the Artakans.


The Artakans, proud and brave community, live in symbiosis with the nature that surrounds them, and without the aid of any technology. At the beginning, the visitors are welcomed with peaceful intent, and the two parties agree with a treaty which allows Barsecans to settle in the south islands of the planet. But during the meeting, an Artakan faction adverse to the agreement, the "Elyfan", by surprise attacks the Barsecans, compromising also the safety of the unaware Artakan delegation.


The Barsecans, in virtue of their technology and their numerical superiority, begin a bloody war. At the end of the conflict, the two sides enter a contractual agreement that allows Barsecans to settle in the southland of Artan, within ten districts.


A peace with Artakans has however three conditions:

1)  The lock by Barsecans of their sex hormone to prevent an overpopulation of the planet

2)  The lock of the boundaries to prevent other unauthorized Barsecans to reach Artan

3)  A total ban for Barsecans to overcome their borders and to reach the North of the planet (which seems to hide something very important).


The Artanians (new name for the Barsecans colonists settled now on Artan), because of their locked hormone, have a low labor force, finding themselves forced to ask for support to their planet of origin Barsec. Thanks to an extension granted by Artakians, the Artanians can ask every ten years for a number of Barsecans guys sufficient to perform the most unpretentious and necessary tasks to support the fully developed Artanians economy. After ten years, however, all those guys are forced to return to their planet, without any dispensation. In return, the Artanians provide Barsec the raw materials needed to allow survival to a dying planet.

Our comic’s history begins 500 years from the conflict. Centuries later, a special girl is coming to Artan on a cargo ship. But the planet hides a big secret that will change the fate of the Galaxy.




Making of

Why was Artan born?

Artan was born from the idea of being able to create something new, never tried before: a digital comic created with techniques used so far only for games and cinematography. The first approach is identical. After an initial study of the characters and the different environments, with classic sketches and drawings, we got to create our characters with the 3d modeling softwares available on the market. Right away, the amount of work and the difficulties were enormous, both for the hardware resources we got available to us (we have to work with millions of polygons for each scene), both for the high costs of the softwares we had to use.


One example: for the realization of some cities (Artancity, Arlea, Rometik, etc ...) we used CityEngine, while recreating the environments we used Vue 2013. The huge number of main characters (about fifty), and extra characters (more than 10,000) and environments (over 300) has led us to work tirelessly for two years on the project. All was made even more complex by a rich and well-articulate storyboard that led us to create a comic with a high number of pages.


Now we made part of the first season with our own means, and it is available on Amazon in digital format, both in English and Italian. But now we need your help.



What are we asking for?


Our first goal is to reach 20000€ to be able to conclude the first season, made by 12 digital episodes, by the end of 2015.

The next goal is to reach 30000€ to realize the second season, made by other 12 digital episodes, by the end of 2016.

The third goal is to reach 60000€ to realize all season.

Our final goal is to reach 120000€ to realize all the five seasons and the printed versions.

Artan’s storyboard was already written: we “only” have to convert it into images. This will only be possible thank to you.




What we offer:


5 € Thank you with your name on our website + high-resolution cover with digital dedication

8 € Thank you on our website + high-resolution cover with digital dedication + Episode 1 (digital Italian or English versions)

13 € Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 (digital Italian or English versions)

20 € Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 (digital Italian or English versions)+ 2 different A3 prints Cover signed (shipping included for Europe)

25 €  Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 (digital Italian or English versions)+ 3 different A3 prints Cover signed (shipping included for europe)

50 €  Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6 + 7 + 8 (digital Italian and English versions) + 10 different A3 prints  cover Signed (shipping included for Europe)

60 €The whole first season (12 episode digital Italian or English versions)

80 € The whole first season (digital Italian or English versions)+ 10 different A3 print cover signed + t-shirt(Shipping included for Europe)

110 € All the numbers (digital Italian or English versions) with dedication and digital sign on each episode + Artan sweatshirt + 10 different A3 prints cover signed (shipping included)

130 € All the first season (digital Italian or English versions) with digital dedication + thank you on each number of the second season of our work on a global page.

150 € All the first season with dedication (digital Italian or English versions) + 10 different A3 signed limited edition prints+ 2 different t-shirt (shipping included) (maximum 250 people)

200 € All the first season (digital Italian or English versions) with digital dedication + your name for a secondary character + 10 different A3 signed limited edition prints. + 3 different t-shirt (shipping included)– (maximum 10 people).

400 € the payer becomes a digital character in one episode of the second season of the comic and receives all the digital first season + 1 sweatshirt (shipping included) (maximum 5 people)

1000 € The payer becomes a main digital character in several episodes of the second season of the comic and receives all the digital first season + 1 sweatshirt + t-shirt. (shipping included) (maximum 3 people)

1000 € Printed version of Numbers 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6  (Italian or English Version) in a book of 500 pages in hard cover + 1 autographed fine art + 15 A3 signed limited edition prints+ all the first digital season + t-shirt (shipping included)

1400 € All the first season printed in two books  500 pages each hard covered, signed and dedicated books, limited edition + 15 autographed prints + 2 sweatshirt (shipping included) (maximum 35 people)

2200 € All the first season + Number 0 in 12 hard covered, autographed and limited edition books + ARTAN t-shirt + 3 fine arts. The hard covered INEDITED BOOK: Artan. The places, the people and the weapons. (shipping included) (maximum 10 people)


ALL VOLUMES HAVE SIZE 20X25 CM (7.75X9.75 IN) PROLINE UNCOATED PAPERS - HARD COVER, DUST JACKET.








The Authors:

Gianfranco Casano:

Graduated at the University of Pisa, he starts immediately teaching three-dimensional graphics in the high schools and at the University of Pisa. Simultaneously he realizes several projects:

He works at Pisa’s University in the “Project Antarctica”.

He writes music for the Project "Francis, the man, the saint, the places" published by Paoline Editions

He realizes a multimedia DVD on Astronomical Photography.

He directs and writes the theme song of the TV program: "Bambino sarai tu" broadcasted by Sky - Italy.

He realizes three-dimensional animations on the Italian DVDs of the award winning show "Farscape".

He has collaborated for several years with the Italian Rotary Club creating DVDs for the International Prize G. Galilei.

Often collaborates with National Geographic.

In 2014 he published the SciFi book "Late Time" on Amazon.

Stefano Orlando:

He is a computer technician who studied engineering at the University of Pisa. Soon, however, he understood that he could not stand out too much from his artistic nature.

This was the reason that led him to study the techniques of three-dimensional graphics and to enhance the creative talents at his disposal. During these years, he has written three books: "The thin life of a poet" "The excluded ones" and "The man who dreamed of the sea", and he is currently working at the fourth: "The apology of the six worlds ", a fantasy trilogy that aims to enter the innermost aspects of our social system and our psyche. But that's another story.

Among his many passions, including photography (http://www.sitohd.com/stefanoorlando/index.asp), astronomy and music, trekking is definitely the one that most of all has managed over the years to bring out its puerile part, that piece of himself that still gets excited and wonders at the little things that the world can offer. That same part that pushed him, along with his friend and colleague, to create Artan.
story_txt:
ARTAN
Hello everyone. 
We are Stefano Orlando and Gianfranco Casano
and we are two guys who strongly believe in their dreams. “Artan” project begins
long ago, and it starts from that primordial instinct we are all born with, that
drives us to go towards distant and exotic worlds to live thousand adventures
and thousand emotions.
The idea of this project was born part humorously,
part seriously, but, after months and months of sacrifice and commitment, Artan
has become not only our job, but even our world, where some times we pour our fears
and our desires.
How many of you dreamed to do a job you love?
That’s it: we are chasing this dream.






What’s ARTAN?
Artan is a Scifi-Fantasy comic entirely realized
by three-dimensional graphics.
Its story takes place between two worlds:
Barsec and Artan. Barsec is an over populated planet where the population has taken
advantage in an uncontrolled way of its planet, destroying both the vegetation
and the animal world. For this reason, a large group of rich and privileged settlers
left the mother planet to colonize another habitable planet in the same solar system
of Nikron: ARTAN.
When the settlers come, Artan is a virgin planet,
full of vegetation and living beings. A perfect planet to create a new
civilization based on a more rigorous and controlled life style than the one left
on Barsec. But when the settlers arrive, they find another species was already living
on Artan: the Artakans.





The Artakans, proud and brave community, live
in symbiosis with the nature that surrounds them, and without the aid of any technology.
At the beginning, the visitors are welcomed with peaceful intent, and the two
parties agree with a treaty which allows Barsecans to settle in the south islands
of the planet. But during the meeting, an Artakan faction adverse to the
agreement, the "Elyfan", by surprise attacks the Barsecans, compromising
also the safety of the unaware Artakan delegation.

The Barsecans, in virtue of their technology
and their numerical superiority, begin a bloody war. At the end of the
conflict, the two sides enter a contractual agreement that allows Barsecans to
settle in the southland of Artan, within ten districts.



A peace with Artakans has however three conditions:
1) 
The
lock by Barsecans of their sex hormone to prevent an overpopulation of the
planet
2) 
The
lock of the boundaries to prevent other unauthorized Barsecans to reach Artan
3) 
A
total ban for Barsecans to overcome their borders and to reach the North of the
planet (which seems to hide something very important).



The Artanians (new name for the Barsecans colonists
settled now on Artan), because of their locked hormone, have a low labor force,
finding themselves forced to ask for support to their planet of origin Barsec.
Thanks to an extension granted by Artakians, the Artanians can ask every ten years
for a number of Barsecans guys sufficient to perform the most unpretentious and
necessary tasks to support the fully developed Artanians economy. After ten years,
however, all those guys are forced to return to their planet, without any dispensation.
In return, the Artanians provide Barsec the raw materials needed to allow survival
to a dying planet.
Our comic’s history begins 500 years from the
conflict. Centuries later, a special girl is coming to Artan on a cargo ship. But
the planet hides a big secret that will change the fate of the Galaxy.










Making of
Why was Artan born? 
Artan was born from the idea of being able to
create something new, never tried before: a digital comic created with
techniques used so far only for games and cinematography. The first approach is
identical. After an initial study of the characters and the different
environments, with classic sketches and drawings, we got to create our characters
with the 3d modeling softwares available on the market. Right away, the amount
of work and the difficulties were enormous, both for the hardware resources we
got available to us (we have to work with millions of polygons for each scene),
both for the high costs of the softwares we had to use. 



One example: for the
realization of some cities (Artancity, Arlea, Rometik, etc ...) we used
CityEngine, while recreating the environments we used Vue 2013. The huge number
of main characters (about fifty), and extra characters (more than 10,000) and
environments (over 300) has led us to work tirelessly for two years on the
project. All was made even more complex by a rich and well-articulate
storyboard that led us to create a comic with a high number of pages.



Now we made part of the first season with our own
means, and it is available on Amazon in digital format, both in English and
Italian. But now we need your help.



What are we asking for?

Our first goal is to reach 20000€ to be able to
conclude the first season, made by 12 digital episodes, by the end of 2015.
The next goal is to reach 30000€ to realize the
second season, made by other 12 digital episodes, by the end of 2016.
The third goal is to reach 60000€ to realize all season.
Our final goal is to reach 120000€ to realize all
the five seasons and the printed versions. 
Artan’s storyboard was already
written: we “only” have to convert it into images. This will only be possible thank
to you.









What we offer:







5 € Thank you with your name on our website +
high-resolution cover with digital dedication
8 € Thank you on our website + high-resolution
cover with digital dedication + Episode 1 (digital Italian or English versions)
13 € Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 (digital Italian or
English versions)
20 € Episodes 0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 (digital
Italian or English versions)+ 2 different A3 prints Cover signed (shipping
included for Europe)
25 €  Episodes
0 + 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 (digital Italian or English versions)+ 3 different A3
prints Cover signed (shipping included for europe)

different A3 prints  cover Signed
(shipping included for Europe)

and he is currently working at the fourth: "The apology of the six worlds ", a fantasy trilogy that aims
to enter the innermost aspects of our social system and our psyche. But that's another

Among his many passions, including photography

is definitely the one that most of all has managed over the years to bring out

story:
MONSTERS OF FEAR AND WONDER

“Do you love going to see new and interesting art forms?  Do you love watching sketches come to life in beautiful color and dimension?  Do you enjoy fantasy, monsters or comics?” If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

Overview

"Our popular culture reinforces the idea that technology can create anything we want. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Monster” at a time! There is nothing like the thrill of seeing handmade sketch turn into a real life monster in stunning colors and sizes, then placed in their own habitat.  Lindsey Wakefield has drawn 40 pictures that will be brought to life in hyperrealistic paintings, sketches, and descriptions. As little as $1 gets us a jump-start on buying materials to create these beautiful pieces and we can change peoples ideas about monsters for the rest of their lives.  Seeing these outrageous characters come to life will be an experience that anyone can enjoy.  Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!"

More about the Project

Monsters serve a purpose in every age. They confront us with qualities in the world, and in ourselves, that we find difficult to face. And without artists to create them — from Gorgon to Godzilla — there would be no monsters at all. – This fact prompted me to dig deeper into how to apply this to my artwork.  This is where I started to envision “MONSTERS OF FEAR AND WONDER” and all the possible benefits:

  • Art: people can enjoy a different art form.
  • See different habitats and story lines that go along with each monster
  • Create never before seen monsters

I feel these benefits make me incredibly qualified to succeed and be the first to the market in this innovative idea.  This paired with attention to detail and quality drawings will make me effective.

About Us

My company is passionate with creating a great monster enthusiast book that’s thrilling, affordable and gives readers a look into my mind. More times than not when companies design new books they contain preliminary flaws but my goal is to stay dedicated to quality because I know your entertainment experience is at stake! I have designed a unique method of drawing and bring the monsters to life that is second to none. Help me make this product a reality!


How You Can Help

For us to bring the Monsters of Fear and Wonder to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our book. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production of the first prototype book where we have everything set up for drawing. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first to see Monsters of Fear and Wonder.

“Monsters of Fear and Wonder” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of your social media sites Facebook, Twitter and YouTube and share. Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about $10,000 in order to break “Monsters of Fear and Wonder” onto the market. That will include materials for materials, labor and distribution.

Final Thank You 

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Monsters of Fear and Wonder” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

If you wish to contact us:

Contact Information

Name: Levi Wright

Phone Number: (517)292-4823

E Mail: levi.wright02@gmail.com

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact.

story:
Wrath is a six chapter graphic novel that tells the story of a young man that discovers he has the ability to manifest his childhood trauma into a physical form. The first chapter will be 35 pages long and introduces the main characters, Doug and Nicole, and when Doug's power first makes an appearance. Doug has limited memory and control of his ability and through his dream-like memory and physical evidence must figure out what really happened.

One of the themes of Wrath is that while we may not have any control over some of the things that happen to us, or the emotional and psychological toll they take, we do have a choice on how we let those things guide us in our lives. Do we let them drag us down, drive us to seek revenge and hurt others, or do we use them to make a difference and help protect those in need?

The pages of Wrath will be drawn by Emilio Utrera with cover and concept work by Drew "Drewzelle" Smith. The comic itself will be in grayscale, a black and white style. The only exception will be the creature itself which will appear on the page in full color.

The first chapter of Wrath will have a standard and a variant cover. Both covers will be done by Drewzelle and reflect the past and present events that awaken Doug's power. The variant cover is meant to be a special thank you to our campaign backers and will only be available during the live campaign. If the project goes into Indemand only the standard issue will be available. 

If you really like the project and find yourself unable to back at this time there are other ways you can help us meet our goal. Simply sharing the project with others who might like it can be a huge help. So please share it with you friends, family, co-works or that person you ride the bus with everyday. Link it on your social media pages and help spread the word, it means a lot to us.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project Wrath. We look forward to finishing this first chapter and getting into the hands of our fans! Please enjoy a preview of the first 6 pages below.

story:
Robo Pram - Phase 1: The Artist Search

What do you get when you mix an alien, a baby, his cluelss father and confused mother, and a host of the cutest, cuddliest Earth invaders ever seen?  Robo Pram!

Robo Pram was an idea born while cruising the Santa Clarita Valley way back in 2007.  In the 5 years since, I have filled multiple notebooks with ideas and poor sketches of what my take on an all ages comic book could be, culminating in two 22 page scripts completed last summer.  I am immensely proud of the writing I've completed here, with two story arcs worthy of illustration.  This is part Transformers, a little Lone Wolf and Cub, and a dash of Looney Tunes!  I know that kids of all ages will thoroughly enjoy the adventures of the Robo Pram team and you can help make it happen!

Where's the Cash Going Buddy?

 The bulk of this (Phase 1) money will go to securing an artist to draw the books.  The scripts are polished and ready to go, I just need some talent to breath Robo Pram to life.  While I am offering an even 50/50 creator credit for this project to my artist, the ability to offer some financial incentive will make it easier for us to complete the project faster and to set a reasonable publishing timeline, including whether or not we will attempt a color printing!
 
$500 is my baseline goal.  For that, the ball gets rolling in my artist search, including being able to take some out of town meetings I have set for mid-July as well as fulfilling the button perks listed in this campaign.  This is a modest sum and a goal I feel is reasonable at this juncture.  However, above and beyond will really bring Robo Pram to life!  For example:
 
$1000 will allow me to pay my artist and set the publishing ball in motion.
 
$1500 and the book will be published.
 
$2000 and above, both scripts, two full story arcs of Robo Pram will be illustrated and published.
 
If we miss our $500 goal, any money contributed will still be used to secure artwork.
 
Contribute today and be in the know for all the updates on the development of Robo Pram including design and script page teasers!
 
ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL RECEIVE A DISCOUNT ON ORDERING THE BOOK WHEN PUBLISHED!!!  Preorders will commence once the book is 50% illustrated.
 
For me, seeing my writing transformed into a comic book will fulfill a long held dream, a dream that I need your help in creating!  Please let your friends know about this campaign as even $1 will mean the world to me!  Share us on Facebook and Twitter and Tumblr or just force your co-worker to look at your screen!  Seriously, without you, Robo Pram cannot happen, period.  I'm cashing in my karma points for this one everybody, please help out any way you can.  Thank you!!!!

story:
WHO IS ARTY NEED?

I am an 18 inch talk show host that has been doing a live talk show in the back of a bowling alley for the last 3 years.

WHAT IS THE ARTY NEED SHOW ALL ABOUT?

Arty is the place to catch underground comics, bands, and performers and watch them be interviewed by a marionette.

WHAT IS AT STAKE?

If Arty doesn’t get his show on TV, late night television will stay the same boring landscape of guys behind desks! Isn’t it time for a Marionette to have his own talk show?

WHY $5000?

After years of doing a live show, Arty is ready for the small screen. Yes, TV. To make this possible I need to record the show in a professional manner, which requires a lot of manpower, and if you have seen the show you know that I am busy telling jokes, so I need to pay these people.

But why FIVE THOUSAND dollars? Shooting with multiple cameras means multiple people, and multiple cameras means more to edit. I don’t have a clue how to do this but fortunately there are people who do, but they aren’t free.

Lastly…

With a TV ready version of the show, I will be able to convince producers that the show is ready for the small screen, and I, Arty Need, will be able to bring the show into your home on a weekly basis. Just think, if you can’t make it out to the Gutter, you will be able to watch it on your laptop in bed, and having Arty in your lap is more fun than you may realize.

I am grateful to everyone who has come out over the years to make the show what it is, and with your help we can take it one step further.

Thanks, 

Arty

story:
A comic for my niece

Tegan: Leon? 
Leon: Yes, Tegan?
Tegan: THIS IS AWESOME.

My name is Jesse, and I like to write things. Six years ago, I went to the baby shower for my then-unborn niece, Tegan. People were writing her messages pre-birth, and I promised her one thing: a story, starring her. I didn't know what form it would take or what would happen, but I knew she would be the star. Six years (and a lot of development and life changes) later, I have a strong final draft for a comic and a wonderful artist lined up.


The heart of it all

Tegan: What is this place?
Leon: The Agency.
Leon: “Save yourself from boredom by saving the world.”

I've written a comic for my niece. It's 22 pages long. After a long search, I've found an artist whose style I adore ( http://zoeyhuerta.deviantart.com/ ), and she is on board for the project (she illustrated the character images on this page). Now I just need help raising the funds to make it happen.

I've listed $1500 as the goal because that's what it's going to take to get the pages penciled and inked. I'm not looking to make any immediate money on this project, I just want a super sweet comic I can be proud of and that my niece will enjoy. I had thought to do color, but that would effectively double the overall cost of the book, and frankly, I'm happy with the black and white look. There are other steps, obviously, including lettering and printing, but this is the big, big step that I need help with.

I'm trying to keep this rather simple, so there aren't a lot of high-level perks. You can get a digital copy of the book, which will be made available to you as soon as it is ready. You can also get a physical copy of the book (or multiple copies!) so you can have that awesome new comic smell and feel the fine grain of the pages. If you're SUPER PSYCHED about this project and want me to figure out something even cooler, let me know, and I will do my best!


A little background noise

Leon: Tegan, this is our latest model, which we call Another Really Cool Humanoid Robot, or A-R-C-H-R.
Tegan: Archer?
Leon: Initiate wake-up.

My niece is awesome. The children in your life are probably awesome, too! What I'm trying to create for her is a guide for additional imaginative play, a world where children are asked to go on amazing adventures. Hopefully that would inspire the children in your life, as well. Tegan isn't the only upcoming super-spy in the world! Also, I'm a big fan of stories that teach lessons, and this issue will hopefully be no exception, as Tegan learns a big lesson about kindness and apologies over the course of the issue.

Now, I'll level with you: this project is mostly for my niece. 90 percent, at least. That last ten percent is for me. I've wanted to write a comic book since I was a rather young kid. I still have a "How to be a Marvel Comics Writer" pamphlet floating around somewhere that I picked up on a trip to New York sometime in the late nineties. This is a dream for me, and I appreciate any help at making it come true.

It is dangerous to go alone

Leon: Tegan, this is Sam, Halo, and Jax. They're the youngest Spades in the Agency. Gentlemen, what’s your next mission?
Sam: Ancient Greece, sir. Apparently a bonfire went a little wild.

I don't think we face a lot of risk in this project. The script is written and ready to go. The artist is on-board and now familiar with the characters. If nothing else, we might just not hit our total. We're not going with an all-or-nothing plan, though, so in that (hopefully unlikely) case, I will find the remaining funding elsewhere. YOU WILL STILL GET YOUR COMIC, I PROMISE. I am committed to seeing this thing created. It may just take a little bit longer. 

Just stopping by? No problem!

Leon: This is Tegan, our newest agent.
Tegan: Hi.
Archer: I'm not here to babysit, Leon.

I totally understand if you can't help. I'd totally appreciate a note of encouragement, as I'm almost out of my depth here (and rather nervous, to boot). If you know a comics fan and could let them know about us, that'd be great. If you have young kids in your life who might like this, maybe you could let their parents know! That'd be sweet!

If nothing else, thanks for reading. Each click gives me a little more hope.

story:
IL LIBRONE DI EBUBU!

Finalmente le migliori vignette di Ebubu il Re Verde salvate su carta al sicuro dai biechi segnalatori di Facebook, in un volume limitatissimo e numerato(A CASO)! Con questo libro potrai:

  • Impressionare il tuo professore di chimica organica.
  • Fare bella figura con tua nonna.
  • Rimorchiare belle ragazze disinibite svedesi.

Ma perchè un autore di così grande successo ha bisogno di chiedere le elemosina per stampare un libro?

Perchè ho bisogno di chiedere le elemosina:

Ho sperperato tutti i soldi in droga da poveri:

  • Per colpa della colla da sniffare non sento più gli odori e uno strano ronzio mi tiene sveglio la notte.
  • Ho bisogno di soldi per comprarmi i sonniferi!
  • Per favore fate smettere questo ronzio.

QUINDI SBORSATE VELOCE I SOLDI!

All'interno del libro (del quale potete ammirare la splendida copertina qui sopra) troverete una selezione CASUALE delle migliori(?) vignette pubblicate su Facebook più una lunga e avvincente storia inedita. 
Se mi date più soldi il volume potrà essere impreziosito da un originale disegno di Ebubu, O addirittura con un' autentica pittura su tela! 

***ATTENZIONE: L'AUTORE NON SI RITIENE RESPONSABILE DEL SOGGETTO DI TALE DISEGNINI***

story:
18 Soldiers, ambushed on patrol must survive the night. Based on actual events. 

Based on actual events, written by ADDY and TELLY award winner Travis Miller, Art by Scott McDaniel (Batman, Nightwing, Daredevil), Derek Fisher (Green Goblin) and Rick Parker (Beavis and Butthead, Spider-Man). 

We're halfway there, and we're just getting started!

The book is already under way, we just need your help to finish it!

  • Scott already has 20 pages penciled!
  • Derek has the first ten pages inked and more are on the way!
  • Rick has hand-lettered the first twenty pages!
  • We just added a color artist! 

We can't do this without you!

We still have some work to do, but your support makes this project a reality. Get the story, get the extras, get a full-color graphic novel! Get great perks!

  • You can help us tell this important story.
  • Your backing and support means the success or failure of this mission, and failure isn't an option. Help us. You are mission critical.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back this project financially, we ask that you share this page on whatever social media platforms you use. Every little bit helps and that forward momentum means the world to us. 

  • Make some noise for us on Facebook, Twitter and all the rest!
  • Use those "share" tools!!! 

Thank you from The Last Patrol Team!

story:
Overview

It's getting a bit difficult now to describe the course of UK and Scottish politics without reaching for the thesaurus and looking up 'insane'. The equivalent to this context-setter for Volumes I and II of my collected works spoke of crises and constitutional breaking points, living in 'interesting times', and watching horrified as the lunatics took charge of the asylum.
You know what? As you were.

The Offer

The Road to Nowhere features a selection of cartoons from my weekly spot on Wings Over Scotland plus a few previously unpublished. It (mostly) charts the UK's journey along the Yellow Brick Road towards the mythical city of Ooze, home to the Brexit swamp of national humiliation and economic self-harm. Our companions – May, Johnson, Farage and Corbyn – comprise a perfect storm of accidental promotion, deviousness, and incompetence. It would be hard to think of a cast more guaranteed to reduce 'Great' Britain to this sorry pass.

The frequent complaint of the Rev Stu Campbell, editor of Wings – a specifically Scottish political website – is that over these past couple of years there has been a dearth of actual Scottish political content to report, analyse and comment upon. That, unavoidably, is reflected over the course of 176 pages of cartoons which feature more than their fair share of Brexit metaphors. If you don't like pictures of cliffs perhaps this book isn't for you.

But that is not to say we have entirely forgotten about the goings-on at Holyrood and, indeed, Westminster among Scotland's elected representatives. Even if only for some light relief from the Brexit Greek tragedy, it was always worthwhile checking in from time to time on Willie Rennie, Ruth Davidson, David Mundell, and whatsisname. Rest assured their respective inanities and hypocrisies receive due attention within these pages.

Printed in full colour (except when I've managed to sneak a monochrome 'toon past Stu) on matt coated art paper with a gloss laminated cover, The Road to Nowhere is 24cm x 24cm (9.5" x 9.5") and comes in soft and hardback versions. I'm delighted to say it features both a foreword from Andrew Tickell of The National and Sunday National, and postscript by Stu Campbell.

I'm offering four levels of perks for contributors keen to get their hands on a signed and numbered first edition copy in either hard or softback. Special, limited edition mugs and t-shirts featuring Hamish, Scotland's favourite lion in a tammy, are available depending on the level of contribution made. (Click on the individual perk for details.)

What is Needed

The book – soft and hardcover – is being published by Greg Moodie and will be printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd. We are looking for £8,000 to cover production, the additional perks, and post and packaging.

Into the Unknown

At the time of writing, those four Wizard of Oz characters of the Apocalypse have taken the UK to the very precipice of Brexit. Whatever political and constitutional upheavals unfold before the end of the year, it is clear – as it has been for a long time – that Scotland's future must be as an independent nation if it is to survive, let alone thrive.

Opinions on how best to achieve this remain sharply divided but, if Brexit can be said to provide any kind of service to the nation (with all due apologies to the individual lives and livelihoods it will imperil) it must surely be as a means to concentrate all our minds on that one supremely important goal.

Wings Over Scotland is but a part of the continuing and undiminished 'alternative' media in Scotland that largely speaks with a pro-independence voice, that challenges the Mogadon-pedalling newspapers and national broadcasters still willingly shackled to the old imperialist certainties. Your financial support for these voices is as important and as gratefully received now as it was at the time of the independence referendum – the first one.
Thanks.

story:
RIM CITY is the first miniseries of the brand-new comic label ATOMICO. It’s a spectacular 80-page adventure written by Alessandro “DocManhattan” Apreda and drawn by Daniele Orlandini, with the amazing cover art of Francesco Mattina.

Rim City is a place unlike any other.
In a far future, as the human race stands on the brink of extinction, Rim City may be the final chance of survival for mankind. When everything seems lost, a fragile hope suddenly presents itself. Something can be done, but the only way to find out if it’s true, is to risk everything humanity has left. An impossible mission awaits Captain Kendra and a handful of soldiers of the Trident Corps. A journey into the unknown that will take them from the depths where they are confined to where no man has gone before.


Kendra is the bold leader of the Trident Corps. Resolute and strong, unstoppable and fragile, she is a young woman that will have to carry the fate of Rim City and of all mankind oh her hardened shoulders while confronting an unstoppable enemy.

You will fall in love with Kendra.
Or you will hate her.
Or both.


The Tridents are the last bastion of humanity’s desperate defenses against the cold nothingness that surrounds Rim City. Since birth, they are called upon to defend a city that, for the most part, despises them. The marks they bear on their faces and bodies are both a uniform and a sentence. Ray, Nathe and Blackie-4 are members of Kendra’s team, the Trident Elite, the only ones she can trust. The only ones who can join her on her dangerous mission.

CONTRIBUTE NOW

THE WORLD OF RIM CITY

What will be left, in a distant future, of the things we value so much in our present-day world? Very little. 


The sands of time are unstoppable and civilization as we know it, will be forced to face threats mankind never had to face before. Out there, there’s nothing but a darkness populated by a progeny of monsters, gigantic creatures that haunt the dreams of every Rim Citizen. But what really threatened the City is something that cannot be faced like a Giant Octopus. It’s not a monster who will be satisfied with tearing its prey apart and consume it to survive. This threat wants the extinction of all mankind.
And it may not be aware of what it’s doing…


PERKS NEWS!



CONTRIBUTE NOW

You can help us in many different ways.
We want the RIM CITY project to happen thanks to many, small contributions. Therefore, the best you could to lend a hand, is talk about us and this project on your Facebook page while the campaign is ongoing. Share our updates and point us to the friends you think may be interested in this ATOMICO Project. You can use Twitter or Deviantart as well, linking this page and using with the hashtag #RIMCITY.
On our Facebook page you'll find some artwork specially designed for social sharing.  
Or you can became an ATOMIC HERALD as explained here!
Your help will be precious in making RIM CITY a reality!

[IMPORTANT UPDATE FOR ITALIAN LANGUAGE READERS - READ BELOW]

Per i funders che hanno già acquistato i perk EASY, DIRECTOR'S CUT e POWER UP sarà possibile convertire i propri perk nei perk PRINT o PRINT DELUXE integrando la somma con una donazione libera e scrivendo via mail all'indirizzo info@progettoatomico.it l'avvenuta integrazione, il perk di 'partenza' e il nuovo perk acquistato.

Per chi ha già finanziato con ONE OF US, FAN, IN THE FACE, COMMISSION sarà possibile ottenere il PAPERBACK DA 96 PAGINE con un'integrazione di 5 € e l'HARD COVER con un contributo di 10 €. Per queste integrazioni vale quanto sopra: basta inserire una donazione libera e comunicarci il tutto via mail.
Per chi ha finanziato con il perk EARLY BIRD, MONSTER e COLLECTOR il paperback sarà aggiunto in omaggio a quanto acquistato mentre sarà possibile ottenere la versione HARD COVER (al posto del paperback normale) con l'integrazione di 5 €.
Per chi ha acquistato PREMIUM COLLECTOR, RAPTOR e GUEST l'hard cover di RIM CITY sarà in omaggio.
Per i coraggiosi che hanno acquistato MEGATON DINNER e HOT sarà incluso in omaggio un PAPERBACK DELUXE CON VARIANT COVER IN EDIZIONE NUMERATA E FIRMATA.

Per chi fosse intenzionato ad acquistare sia il Paperback che l’Hard Cover consigliamo di contattare direttamente il team Atomico alla mail info@progettoatomico.it Si segnala che l’acquisto diretto dei volumi sarà consentito solo a chi avrà già contribuito alla campagna con un perk di finanziamento e che non sarà comunque consentito l’acquisto di numero superiore di 2 copie per ogni edizione.
Tutte le versioni a stampa realizzate per i finanziatori di Indiegogo saranno uniche e fuori commercio: saranno personalizzate ad hoc per i nostri coraggiosi funders e saranno quindi diverse da qualsiasi futura edizione cartacea!



THE AUTHORS

Born on December 1975 (according to new post-disaster calendar), in Neo-Cosenza, Southern Europe, Alessandro Apreda wrote the sci-fi comic "Ethan?", a short story winner of the Spacewave prize and the essay on Eighties "Per il Potere di Grayskull". When he's not writing his biographies in third person, he manages at weird hours L'Antro Atomico del Dr. Manhattan, questionably the coolest blog in the world.
Daniele Orlandini was born in 1992. He's been reading and drawing comics, since he was a little kid. It's been little more than a hobby until 2011, when he enrolled at the Scuola Internazionale di Comics in Reggio Emilia. Shortly after his recent graduation, in June 2014, he started a collaboration with team Acchiappasogni to illustrate their role-playing games manuals and became the assistant of comic creator Roberto Baldazzini. His work on Atomico's science fiction project RIM CITY will mark his debut as a professional comic artist.

Francesco MATTINA aka MATT with a background in architecture and set design, he worked as a concept artist for cinema before being hired by Marvel Comics as a cover artist on Fantastic Four, Nova, Thunderbolts, WarMachine, Punisher, MoonKnight, Wolverine and more recently for Spider-Man 2099 and Avengers Undercover. He also worked for DC Comics’ Batman Confidential , Redhood , Azrael and The Joker's Asylum.

CONTRIBUTE NOW

Why we need these funds

We need 40.000€ to cover the following expenses:

  • 20.000 € will cover designers, author and editor payments for graphic staff.
  • 6.500 € will cover the prizes production costs.
  • 4.000 € will cover project promotion's costs.
  • 4.000 € will cover billing registration related costs.
  • 5.500 € will cover Indiegogo, Paypal fees and italian taxes.

[For Italian funders]


Shipping and taxes costs

All EU-resident backers outside of Italy, please add 5,00€ to cover the extra invoicing costs for every Perk, INCLUDING those containing only digital contents.

All EU-resident backers outside of Italy, please add:

  • 5,00€ to cover the extra invoicing costs for the In the Face!, Commission, Monster, Early Bird, Collector and Premium Collector Perks.
  • 10,00€ to cover the extra invoicing costs for the Raptor Perk.

For non EU customers, please contact us to define shipping and taxes costs. 

1) To make Atomico able to complete a correct invoicing process, all backers need to fully fill out the “address” field and include tax/fiscal code and/or VAT registration number (if viable) upon registration.
2) Digital contents will be provided in PDF, CBR and in EPUB format.

3) All contents shown in the perk as issues are digital or paperback even where not specified.

4) All the digital versions RIM CITY will be available in Italian and English.

5) All the PRINT versions RIM CITY will be available only in Italian.

6) The hi-res Francesco Mattina covers  (digital version, printable in A2) will be added to all perks from "Power Up" above!


SUPPORTERS

CONTRIBUTE NOW
story_txt:
RIM CITY is the first miniseries of the
brand-new comic label ATOMICO. It’s a spectacular 80-page adventure written by
Alessandro “DocManhattan” Apreda and drawn by Daniele Orlandini, with the
amazing cover art of Francesco Mattina.Rim City is a place unlike any other.In a far future, as the human race stands on the brink of extinction, Rim City may be the final chance of survival for mankind. When everything seems lost, a fragile hope suddenly presents itself. Something can be done, but the only way to find out if it’s true, is to risk everything humanity has left. An impossible mission awaits Captain Kendra and a handful of soldiers of the Trident Corps. A journey into the unknown that will take them from the depths where they are confined to where no man has gone before.Kendra is the bold leader of the Trident Corps. Resolute and strong,
unstoppable and fragile, she is a young woman that will have to carry the fate
of Rim City and of all mankind oh her hardened shoulders while confronting an unstoppable
enemy.
You will fall in love with Kendra.Or you will hate her.Or both.The Tridents are the last bastion of
humanity’s desperate defenses against the cold nothingness that surrounds Rim
City. Since birth, they are called upon to defend a city that, for the most
part, despises them. The marks they bear on their faces and bodies are both a
uniform and a sentence. Ray, Nathe and Blackie-4 are members of Kendra’s team, the Trident Elite, the
only ones she can trust. The only ones who can join her on her dangerous
mission.CONTRIBUTE NOWTHE WORLD OF RIM CITY
What will be left, in a distant future, of
the things we value so much in our present-day world? Very little.  
The sands of time are unstoppable and
civilization as we know it, will be forced to face threats mankind never had to
face before. Out there, there’s nothing but a darkness populated by a progeny
of monsters, gigantic creatures that haunt the dreams of every Rim Citizen. But
what really threatened the City is something that cannot be faced like a Giant
Octopus. It’s not a monster who will be satisfied with tearing its prey apart
and consume it to survive. This threat wants the extinction of all mankind.And it may not be aware of what it’s doing…PERKS NEWS!CONTRIBUTE NOWYou can help us in many different ways.We want the RIM CITY project to happen
thanks to many, small contributions. Therefore, the best you could to lend a
hand, is talk about us and this project on your Facebook page while the campaign
is ongoing. Share our updates and point us to the friends you think may be
interested in this ATOMICO Project. You can use Twitter or Deviantart as well, linking this
page and using with the hashtag #RIMCITY. On our Facebook page you'll find some artwork specially designed for social sharing.  Or you can became an ATOMIC HERALD as explained here!Your help will be precious in making RIM
CITY a reality!
[IMPORTANT UPDATE FOR ITALIAN LANGUAGE READERS - READ BELOW]
Per i funders che hanno già acquistato i perk EASY, DIRECTOR'S CUT e POWER UP sarà possibile convertire i propri perk nei perk PRINT o PRINT DELUXE integrando la somma con una donazione libera e scrivendo via mail all'indirizzo info@progettoatomico.it l'avvenuta integrazione, il perk di 'partenza' e il nuovo perk acquistato.
Per chi ha già finanziato con ONE OF US, FAN, IN THE FACE, COMMISSION sarà possibile ottenere il PAPERBACK DA 96 PAGINE con un'integrazione di 5 € e l'HARD COVER con un contributo di 10 €. Per queste integrazioni vale quanto sopra: basta inserire una donazione libera e comunicarci il tutto via mail.Per chi ha finanziato con il perk EARLY BIRD, MONSTER e COLLECTOR il paperback sarà aggiunto in omaggio a quanto acquistato mentre sarà possibile ottenere la versione HARD COVER (al posto del paperback normale) con l'integrazione di 5 €.Per chi ha acquistato PREMIUM COLLECTOR, RAPTOR e GUEST l'hard cover di RIM CITY sarà in omaggio.Per i coraggiosi che hanno acquistato MEGATON DINNER e HOT sarà incluso in omaggio un PAPERBACK DELUXE CON VARIANT COVER IN EDIZIONE NUMERATA E FIRMATA.
Per
chi fosse intenzionato ad acquistare sia il Paperback che l’Hard Cover
consigliamo di contattare direttamente il team Atomico alla mail info@progettoatomico.it Si segnala
che l’acquisto diretto dei volumi sarà consentito solo a chi avrà già
contribuito alla campagna con un perk di finanziamento e che non sarà comunque
consentito l’acquisto di numero superiore di 2 copie per ogni edizione.Tutte le versioni a stampa realizzate per i finanziatori di Indiegogo saranno uniche e fuori commercio: saranno personalizzate ad hoc per i nostri coraggiosi funders e saranno quindi diverse da qualsiasi futura edizione cartacea!

THE AUTHORS

Born on December 1975 (according to new post-disaster calendar), in Neo-Cosenza, Southern Europe, Alessandro Apreda wrote
 the sci-fi comic "Ethan?", a short story winner of the Spacewave prize 
and the essay on Eighties "Per il Potere di Grayskull". When he's not 
writing his biographies in third person, he manages at weird hours L'Antro Atomico del Dr. Manhattan, questionably the coolest blog in the world.Daniele Orlandini was born in 1992. He's been reading and drawing comics, since he was a little kid. It's been little more than a hobby until 2011, when he enrolled at the Scuola Internazionale di Comics in Reggio Emilia. Shortly after his recent graduation, in June 2014, he started a collaboration with team Acchiappasogni to illustrate their role-playing games manuals and became the assistant of comic creator Roberto Baldazzini. His work on Atomico's science fiction project RIM CITY will mark his debut as a professional comic artist.Francesco MATTINA aka MATT with a background in
architecture and set design, he worked as a concept artist for cinema before
being hired by Marvel Comics as a cover artist on Fantastic Four, Nova, Thunderbolts,
WarMachine, Punisher, MoonKnight, Wolverine and more recently for Spider-Man 2099 and Avengers Undercover. He also worked for DC Comics’ Batman Confidential , Redhood , Azrael and The Joker's Asylum.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED - FOR MORE INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT RUSTY GILLIGAN AT RUSTYWEB@AOL.COM OR ON FACEBOOK - THANK YOU !

THANK YOU FOR 100% FUNDING! 

EVERYONE IS NOW GETTING THIS PARODY CARD !

LET'S GO OVER THE TOP AND EARN NEW SECRET PRIZES AND HELP THE ARTISTS AND WRITERS !
_______________________________________________
Mac and Trouble welcome you to their campaign !

Let us introduce you to the "Mac and Trouble RUIN the Golden Age" trading card set... this is a 10-card promo set with many extras such as signed pro cards, random sketch cards, and special RELIC cards in every set !

To start, the promo fronts feature popular golden age comic book covers, and somehow... Mac and Trouble have found their way to sneak aboard and ruin them. (Even though they'll deny it !)

--> Take a peek at a few of the regular base cards:

Come on guys - these are some great comics that you've invaded ! Sheesh !!

The 10-card promo set contains popular covers from Daredevil, Giggle Comics, Treasure Comics, Black Cat, High School Romance, and a few others !

--> The backs are equally as fun:

The backs feature the original cover with book info - and in the 'TEXT' spot, you'll find fun jokes and interactions with Mac and Trouble, interesting comic trivia, and some cool surprises !

**UPDATE 7/9/2016
HOW PLOTTING IS DONE BEFORE INKS/COLORS ARE APPLIED...


(art above by Dan Gorman)


--> Now for the signed cards...

Mac and Trouble are known for their 'live appearance' promo cards... below are just a few from previous shows and conventions:

Cards from these live appearances are now going to be randomly inserted so that every set includes at least 1 card - signed by the celeb or professional associated with each card. (A few of the actual cards are shown above)

This list includes:

-Mac and Trouble staff
creator: Rusty Gilligan - chief artist: Dan Gorman - head writer: Arthur Gibson

-comic artists: David Fox, Jess Hughes, John Orlando, Terry Pavlet, Bob Petrecca, Don Simpson, Jim Taylor

-comic writers: Eric Cooper (aka Knightseeker), Troy Vevsasis

-professional cosplayers: (NJ Bat-Dave) David DeVenter, (Khor Mariik - Mandalorian Merc) Richard Gambler, (Klingon) Kethas Epetai-Rustadzh, 

-special guests: Jeremy Ambler (Walking Dead), Jim Krut (Dawn of the Dead), Gene Snisky (former WWE wrestler). Connie Woods (Twin Peaks)

and a few surprises !!



--> The RELIC CARDS may be Best Part...

One of the most exciting facets of this card set are the 'Relic' cards which incorporate actual comic covers and pages from the golden and silver age.
Utilizing coverless, poor condition, and nearly-destroyed comics we've salvaged some of the greatest cover portions and panels and affixed them to these stylish cards.

Here are the actual first 5 cards salvaged as Relics with a sample back:

And here's just a few of the comics that were salvaged for this great set:


Please note: We have nothing but respect for comic books of any kind. The bulk of these comics were in poor or lesser condition, missing pages or covers, torn and/or stained. These comics have literally been given a 'second life' !

You'll see great comics like Tales of Suspense, Superman, Action Comics, True Crime, Archie Comics, Mad Magazine, Fantastic Four, Charlie Chan, Buster Crabbe, Warlock, Adventure Comics, Daredevil - assorted westerns, romance, and funny animal comics - and many others from the 1970s and earlier !



--> To Recap...

-Each base set is made up of 10 cards
-Each set contains 1 signed pro card
-Each set contains 1 Relic card

Aside from these great features you'll also see randomly inserted sketch art cards, instant win cards, additional signed pro cards, and more !

EVERY REWARD OF $15 OR OVER COMES WITH: sets of 'MAC AND TROUBLE RUIN THE GOLDEN AGE' and signed promo cards !

**Please check each reward to see amounts !



More pillows can be seen at:
https://www.facebook.com/PillowNerd-481007382056668

EVERY REWARD OF $15 OR OVER COMES WITH: sets of 'MAC AND TROUBLE RUIN THE GOLDEN AGE' and signed promo cards !

**Please check each reward to see amounts !


Also...EVERYONE will also be listed as a 'contributor' in the next "Mac and Trouble" free digital book for the fans coming late Summer, 2016 - and get a special link for 3 FREE "Mac and Trouble", "Amazing Tails", and "Recollection" digital comic books that can be shared with others !






**Now EVERY mailed reward comes with a random signed photo of a "Mac and Trouble" art cover by artist/creator Rusty Gilligan...




Visit www.macandtrouble.com... once there, you will find convention photos, coloring pages and art, and free comic books to download !

Page Credits...
-Artist Dan Gorman can be found at: www.facebook.com/DanGormanArt
www.dangormanart.com      ---     Twitter: @gdanartist

-Writer Arthur Gibson can be found at: www.amazon.com/author/arthurgibson
Twitter: @Arthur_Gibson

-Creator Rusty Gilligan can be found at: www.comicbookpro.com
www.macandtrouble.com     ---     Twitter: @macandtrouble

Special thanks to...
-Brad Linder (campaign adviser)
www.comickickstarter.com

-James Schumacher (for creating the campaign video)
www.twitter.com/inheritnovel

-Ralph Ciociano aka RCStorm (performed the video music)
www.youtube.com/user/MeAndTheV
www.reverbnation.com/rcstorm

-Mary & Dan Campbell (show promoters)
http://www.jerseyshorecomicbookshow.com/

-Mugs provided by IndyMugs !!
https://www.facebook.com/Indymugs/

-Tara, Shawn, and the Gilligan family


-That sneaky MAC cosplayer



-And the real Mac (left) and Trouble !

CLICK HERE FOR A LIST OF LIVE APPEARANCES AND CONVENTIONS MAC AND TROUBLE AND RUSTY GILLIGAN ARE APPEARING AT !!

As always, Mac and Trouble projects benefit animal shelters & charities !

story:
Summary/Introduction

Hi everyone- My name is Becky  AKA SquishyBooo!

You're probably wondering why I am asking you guys for such a large sum of money... Well, I'm here to help you understand why I am here.. So first of all- Allow me to introduce myself, my name is Rebecca- Although I am known as Becky or SquishyBooo on the internet. I am 18 years old and from the UK, and I have drawn ever since I was a young child.

After receiving the funds, I will be starting a new web comic idea that I have had for a while now! Let me explain to you in the simplest of terms- just to make it easy for you..! :

The web comic would be called: 'More', the comic itself would be a biweekly released comic about random stories or experiences that I have heard about or experienced myself! The meaning behind the name of the comic is super simple- it means that I can show you 'more' of my drawings.


If people do decide to help me out.. I would be so thankful... I'm in one of those tough situations in life, like most people, where I'm not as privileged as other families/people because I don't get masses amounts of money to spend.. So I have to work hard for the money I earn. So, if you guys do make this possible I will be offering some perks for you! Not many though, as the perks would be similar due to the topic/idea for the funding being so small (which is poopy).


The Funding Idea

I need £740 in total, which is around $1255.. Which is a lot- I know. The full amount of money will be spent on a single item!- A Wacom Cintiq 13HD graphics tablet. I know this may sound a little expensive- it is -but since my current tablet is slowly dying, I would need to spend more of my savings on another graphics tablet. If I do receive the funds, I would then use the new tablet to start work on the comic idea that I have, which I explained above.

OKAYYYY. My "unique" perks are listed at the side, I don't have many perks since there aren't many things I can think of. To be honest with you guys, I lack creative ideas for things like this.. However, if I do not reach the goal for the tablet, I will be saving the money so that I can try and save up enough money for the tablet I have mentioned above.


The Impact

The difference that your contributions would make are huge! I would be so overwhelmed by the help that you have offered to me, to help make my aspirations come true. The idea of becoming a Digital Artist means that you need expensive equipment, and that's poop, but if you did help me with the funding for this tablet- I would be very thankful and even if you can't donate much, it would still help out in some way, shape or form.

When producing pieces of art work, I have been very punctual when handing in my work. I have worked for quite a few YouTubers/Twitch Streamers since starting my internet existence under the name of 'SquishyBooo', and the experience that they have offered me- by letting me work as their artist- have been the best times of my life.. This may sound very cheesy, but I see all these brilliant artists around on the internet, and I have always aspired to be as good as them, and when a person (who I look up to) tells me that my art is great, I feel amazing.. And when people offer to pay me for art commissions, that makes me feel great too. The experience in which I have gained in this sector may be smaller than other people's, but I promise you- I will not waste or slack off with this opportunity that you people would be able to make available to me!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't doante any money to my cause, I don't mind! You can help in other ways.. For example, you could share the link to this page around on your Twitter or Facebook, or any other social media website! That would be super helpful, and I would be totally greatful!


Examples of My Work


I hope that this information and the drawings above help persuade you into helping me with my campaign.


Thank you for reading this-  Becky.

story:
The Story

Thanks for checking out my campaign. My name is John and I am a comic book writer. Growing up with comics like the x-men, I found that comics were my favorite form of literature at an early age. For the last seven years I have been writing and creating stories, but not until last year did I actually begin to get the comics drawn. I am hoping to get my first comic published in October (and that's why I am here).

This comic book is the first issue in a series that follows four unlikely heroes across the world in an attempt to save humanity from the rising robot threat. 

The story takes place in the year is 2085. Humanity is waging a war for survival against the growing robot threat. When the comic starts, the war has been raging for seven years and the humans are really starting to lose ground. In a last desperate attempt to turn the tide of the war, the government creates a secret "questionably legal" program designed to create machine fighting super soldiers. Due to the nature of the project, the test subjects are federal prisoners offered their freedom in return for the use of their bodies. Trying to make a safe choice, the government chooses five medium security inmates, but get a lot more than they asked for. Though the project was a success, it is shut down soon after the first tests due to some "sensitive" information being "anonymously"leaked. This story follows the misadventures Jet, Wrench, Boombox, and Axel, four of the five delinquents.

The Team

I am working with some very talented people on this project. You can see samples of some of their work below.

(Pencils) Bogdan Chelaru:                                                                   http://kiandru.deviantart.com/gallery/

(Letterer) George Warner:                                                                        http://comicbookinterviews.com/2011/04/interview-george-warner/

(Grey Tones) Federico Marinhttp://fm-ilustraciones.tumblr.com/

(Inker) John Kellyhttp://johnkelly-2011.deviantart.com/

The Campaign

This project is a fun one because while it is a little rough around the edges, and the heroes are older, it is suitable for readers of all ages. To complete this project, I am asking for $870. The comic is all drawn up and inked, and is just needing to be grey toned and lettered.

$270 goes for grey tones and $600 goes for publishing costs.

Funding is flexible and so the money will used to accomplish as much as it can even if we dont reach our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially thats fine, just help share the campaign with your friends and if the can donate, you can read their comic. You can share through facebook and the indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
The Story
Thanks for checking out my campaign. My name is John and I am a comic book writer. Growing up with comics like the x-men, I found that comics were my favorite form of literature at an early age. For the last seven years I have been writing and creating stories, but not until last year did I actually begin to get the comics drawn. I am hoping to get my first comic published in October (and that's why I am here).
This comic book is the first issue in a series that follows four unlikely heroes across the world in an attempt to save humanity from the rising robot threat. 
The story takes place in the year is 2085. Humanity is waging a war for survival against the growing robot threat. When the comic starts, the war has been raging for seven years and the humans are really starting to lose ground. In a last desperate attempt to turn the tide of the war, the government creates a secret "questionably legal" program designed to create machine fighting super soldiers. Due to the nature of the project, the test subjects are federal prisoners offered their freedom in return for the use of their bodies. Trying to make a safe choice, the government chooses five medium security inmates, but get a lot more than they asked for. Though the project was a success, it is shut down soon after the first tests due to some "sensitive" information being "anonymously"leaked. This story follows the misadventures Jet, Wrench, Boombox, and Axel, four of the five delinquents.
The Team

I am working with some very talented people on this project. You can see samples of some of their work below.
(Pencils) Bogdan Chelaru:                                                                   http://kiandru.deviantart.com/gallery/
(Letterer) George Warner:                                                                        http://comicbookinterviews.com/2011/04/interview-george-warner/
(Grey Tones) Federico Marinhttp://fm-ilustraciones.tumblr.com/
(Inker) John Kellyhttp://johnkelly-2011.deviantart.com/
The Campaign
This project is a fun one because while it is a little rough around the edges, and the heroes are older, it is suitable for readers of all ages. To complete this project, I am asking for $870. The comic is all drawn up and inked, and is just needing to be grey toned and lettered.
$270 goes for grey tones and $600 goes for publishing costs.
Funding is flexible and so the money will used to accomplish as much as it can even if we dont reach our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pre-order online or in store, we will convenience you.

story:
RED ROOSTER: GOLDEN AGE

The Red Rooster and his allies are celebrated vigilante folk heroes, but at the height of their success a cabal of his most notorious villains conspire to ruin him and the Red Rooster Legacy forever.

"LIGHT BRAVES THE DARKNESS, DARKNESS FEARS THE DAWN." For centuries, the mantle of THE RED ROOSTER has passed from generation to generation to fight mankind's most ancient & terrible evils. Now Frank Cooper must rise to the challenge. Rockwell meets Lovecraft in this dust bowl-era, southern gothic cape & cowls mystery.

For those interested in a deep dive into the world, characters, and plot of the Red Rooster, Mark and myself hosted Edwin Boyette for an extended chat to discuss his reactions to the script: https://youtu.be/_DhN8GwTeo8

Support a NEW DAWN in comics!

  • $60,000 Stretch Goal: Extending the length of the book to 60 pages! *UNLOCKED*
  • $90,000 Stretch Goal: Announcement of our mystery artist for THE FUTURISTS  & including a KAPOW COLA GIRL PIN-UP poster (folded) for all tiers $50 and above! *UNLOCKED*
  • $100,000 Stretch Goal: Original Sketch Raffle. One lucky backer will win an original RED ROOSTER Sketch by Ethan Van Sciver and an original CYBERFROG sketch by Mitch Breitweiser! *UNLOCKED*
  • $115,000 Stretch Goal: RED ROOSTER Trading Cards for all backers! *UNLOCKED*
  • $125,000 Stretch Goal: Preview pages of The FUTURISTS by Butch Guice added to RED ROOSTER: Golden Age!
  • $150,000 Stretch Goal: GOLD FOIL on the cover and square-bound printing!

story:
Jake dh - Author with a vision

Hi, my name is Jake dh, well that's my pen name.  During my early years in junior high and high school I was constantly bullied.  As a defense mechanism, I created a series of novels that chronicled a boy named Kyle Richard who was in a similar situation.  Kyle gained vast power and speed through becoming a cyborg.  He had to decide to use this power for what is was designed for: killing... or become something better.

This story stuck with me for years until I created comic book scripts based on the concept in my college years.  I tried to obtain funding for art on a couple of occasions, but the comic book series was always just out of reach.  

I decided to convert the story back into a novel series, but with a better story structure, character development, etc.  I wrote The BulletProof Ghost: Prototypes from scratch.  The first book led into a second, The BulletProof Ghost: In Spades.  

It always bugged me that I couldn't reach my goal of creating a BulletProof Ghost comic book.  So here I am, trying for one final time to crowdfund the BPG comic book, Issue #1, which is tentatively titled, Trials.

The BulletProof Ghost: From Words to Illustration

What I need to complete my dream:

  • The goal is for $3,000.  The money will go to the illustrations for the interior of the book.  I just used the last of my novel profits for the external cover.  Some of the funds will go to printing costs, taxes, rewards, and Indiegogo fees.  I'm trying to be 100% transparent.  I'm not using any of this money for personal... anything.  Just art and printing!
  • You can look at the perks section to get more specifics, but the perks range from free digital versions of the novels and the comic to signed copies of the final comic book.  There are also shirts you can only get via pledging to this campaign and customized BulletProof Ghost decorated Funko POP.  The larger rewards include large posters, having your likeness drawn into the book itself, and having an original piece of art drawn starring you with chracters from the BPG universe.
  • If I don't reach my goal, whatever funds I have, will go into as much art as I can commission with the available amount.  I will adjust the rewards to reflect this lesser amount.  Then over time, I will complete the entire issue, but the timeline will be extremely long in comparison to a fully funded project.

  

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that the campaign doesn't reach its goal, which is possible, but everyone who pledges will get a reward, even it takes more time to get it to them.  I have confidence that my new readership wants to see The BulletProof Ghost.... Kyle Richard, Irene Hedwin,  William Kintaxin & Four come to life in full color.  They want something tangible and together we can make that a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Considering the lowest perk level is literally $1, I'm sure most people can swing that, but... if your affordable perk level leaves you feeling like you haven't done enough to help create the BPG comic, then there are a lot ways to help other than moneys.

Share, share, share.  Post the link to this campaign as well as BulletProofGhost.com as much as possible to anyone who you think might be interested.  Tell your friends, family and coworkers.  If you have a copy of the novels, loan them out.  Spread the word to every corner of the world, virtual and real life.

Thanks so much for the support thus far.  His death is only the beginning, but your pledge can truly bring him to life.

-Jake dh
