story:
I have spent many years developing my dream project and I do want to stress (this mixup happened a lot on social media) that this project might have sexy covers, but the stories are PG and no XXX anywhere!

PITCH: For several centuries the ancient Order of Justice has lain dormant, but the magical power of the Justice Gems has been released during an Egyptian archeological dig – now, all over the world, the mummified Priestesses of Justice are coming back to life. As supernatural evils threaten human society through the following decades, the Sisterhood will be there to guard and protect.

PLOT: In 1917, a mysterious adventurer (Rand) enters a pyramid In British Colonial Egypt. There he opens the Cauldron of Khepri. The spirits of ancient priestesses are released, resurrecting mummies all over the world who were devoted to an embodiment of the Goddess of Justice and Truth. Five years later, the mummies form the Sisterhood of the Mummy, a spiritual order to help the truth and justice against the unordinary. They are cop, judge, juror and executioner defending the world. The order live in an underground base with technology beyond human knowledge. They are led by the adventurer, the Mother-Supreme and the remains of an Egyptian god whose soul is being used as software for a supercomputer.

INTENTION: SISTERHOOD is a series of oneshots 32/pagers. It will all revolve around the idea of my ´sketchbook theme´ as well as the fact that I want a comic on shelves done by talented folks and not just a ´nice job´ with artwork that you will use to wipe your ass with :)

ISSUE ONE: the origin issue in which we see the rising of the Sisterhood, the installation of the Khepri-computer and during a new adventure the Sisterhood's leader Rand is discovering he is not the only one residing in his own head! 

Currently FOUR issues have been completed, with 4 more already written!

Each comicbook will feature different artists, to ensure not only a high quality but also creating a platform for outstanding artists. This idea is highly influenced by my own Sketchbook Theme where over 200 artists each have shown me their own personal magic!

 

REGULAR cover: by Yonami Teles, colors by Vincenzo Salvo
WRAPAROUND cover: by Eric Basaldua, colors by Lahsado.
COSPLAY cover: photography by Brian Van Rensen, models Lucid Belle & Mucklow. Since the shoot only happened Dec 9, the definite cover has yet to be picked out. You see the location group-shot here. We had FUN :)

 

You can choose for a PDF, a printed copy, variant covers or ALL the covers (GALORE) but also do check out the High End HARD PRINTS and ART COMBO options, which have all the 3 covers attached!

Unlocked: Trading Card #1 by Juan José Ryp.
Unlocked: Trading Card #2 by Eric Basaldua.
Unlocked: Trading Card #3 by Budd Root (colors by Apriyadi Kusbiantoro).
Unlocked: PLASTIC Trading Card #4 by Yonami.
Unlocked: Trading Card #5 by Greg Capullo.

Trading Cards to be added to all physical pledges for free!

Unlocked: Postcards Halloween, Xmas and Mummy Day with art by Adam Brown
Unlocked: Sisterhood Logo Stickers, to be added to all physical pledges for free!
Unlocked: Cardstock Cover Upgrade with UV-spot on Cosplay Cover
Unlocked: a memorial coin, mummy style! To be added to all physical pledges for free!
Unlocked: a special bookmark, mummy style! To be added to all physical pledges for free!

LOCKED: 9.000 Commemorative METAL Trading Card #6 "COSPLAY", to be added to all physical pledges for free!
LOCKED: 10.000 Commemorative METAL Trading Card #7 by Adam Brown, to be added to all physical pledges for free!
LOCKED: 11.111 Euro > extra story adding page count at nó extra costs.
LOCKED: 15.000 > Variant Cover ánd print by inspiration artist Eliseu Gouvea, profits will go to Heroes Initiative. Prints will be added to all physical pledges for free!

 

 

RICHARD BOOM: Project Leader/Creator

Richard Boom started out in the comic industry as your regular fanboy, just reading comics and enjoying it even more due to the internet and making contact with creators. As his contact list grew, so did his interest in the complete field of comic. Starting up a Bad Grrl Comics Fan club in 2001 was the first step to go further then his own living room. Soon thereafter he began setting up websites for Arthur Suydam, Eric Basaldua, Broadsword Comics and focussing on titles like Vampirella, Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... During a visit to a Belgium convention (F.A.C.T.S.) he even started working with the organization and since 2006 he has been officially affiliated with this convention, helping them when and where he can; from seeking sponsorships, contacting artists to be their guests to actually helping to manage the Artist Alley. At this convention he met the founder of Broken Frontier and shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard dabbles in editing comics, doing comic book PR, translating comics, stopped working at FACTS in 2016 and has collected a lot of Hot Mummy sketches hoping to turn that into a comic book series in 2018.

Markus von Renthe-Fink: Story Editor / backup-story penciller

Markus' comic book career hit a major road-bump early on when, in his mid-twenties, he had to face the fact that he was living in a comic-book 3rd world country: Germany. "Image Comics" had just been formed, and his dream of ascending into the ranks of superstars such as Silvestri, Campbell, Charest or Lee were shattered by the fact that he would have to move to USA, and his drawing skills, impressive as they were by then, were not quite honed enough to make this a realistic possibility. So - he pretty much stopped drawing altogether, focusing on getting a "real job" as a graphics designer. - - - Fast forward 20 years: at a book signing in Frankfurt he met Greg Capullo, who was kind enough to look through Markus' portfolio. To the German's surprise, he was told by the popular artist that a) his stuff was fairly good and b) nowadays, the "studio system" had virtually ceased to exist: all you needed as a penciller was skills, a scanner and an internet connection. The flame of rekindled hope rose in Markus' eyes like a bonfire. Looking for a project to finally spread his artistic wings, he met jack-of-all-trades Richard Boom through Facebook. The rest is history (in the making): Markus von Renthe-Fink now acts as story editor and continuity assistant on the "Sisterhood" book, as well as drawing a 20-something page origin story about one of the main characters, trying very hard to make up for lost time.

Victor Kruithof: writer

At school, Kruithof wanted to become an archeologist, but ended up studying journalism and then information-management in hoping to become a librarian. Eventually he became a mix of both at a financial newspaper. But there was a constant focus his career choices, stories. I always wanted to become a writer. In 2011 he joined a talent-contest for the Dutch smallpress publisher Windmill Comics. It let him to his own comic serial, the UC Masters. Because of his critisism about translations and with the experience at the newspaper he was asked to act as the editor for LoneJim Comics, learning again a different side of storytelling through comics. When the crisis of 2008 and digital innovations finally hit his newspaperjob in 2013, he started to look around for more writingjobs. And thus, the crisis brought him to Boom Art Department and Richard Boom's strange fondness for mummies. Boom had the action figures and building blocks to play with. Kruithof had enough fantasy to give them their own world and give others the opportunity to play in this new world.

Diego Magno Loiola: Penciler

Diego loved comics and drew since childhood. He grew up, became a collector, continued drawing, graduated in fine arts, did fanzines, illustrations, fanarts and countless stories; some that never came to light and others that became RPG among friends. Then came Sisterhood, not only the first real job opportunity, but how to give life to someone else's ideas, a bulky, imaginative and rewarding job. Diego continues to draw and collect comics!

Kevin Enhart: colorist

Kevin Enhart is a writer for short films and comics, as well as a comic book artist and colorist. Kevin is also working as a cinema production designer and storyboarder. He’s best known for his alternating coloring styles, best suited for each individual project. Kevin’s prior comic book projects include “Puss in Boots”, “Vikings” and he is currently coloring “Warhammer 40.000” and “Anno Dracula”. Audiovisually, he worked on the French film “419” by Eric Bartonio, and commercials for Awkeye Production and Parrot. Enhart is also currently developing his own project named “The Outlaws” published via Markosia in 2019, and preparing his first feature movie.

Paulo Teles Yonami: cover artist

Yonami or Paulo Teles is a designer and Professional illustrator since he was 19 years old, working at the graphic and digital area, illustrating for graphic publications and TV commercials. Pupil of the best illustrators from Hyper Comics (Jucilande Jr. and João Vicente), drawing comics at your hometown (Manaus, Amazon, Brazil) making those for internet and fanzines. A videogame lover (specially 2D games) he always spend some freetimes playing games. Designer by graduation and illustrator by profession, actually Yonami works for GlassHouse Graphics. Today, he lives in São Paulo, working as manager and comic artist. He even launched his ZOMBIESIDE anthology and is now working on his TIME WITCH comic book series.

Eric Basaldua: variant cover artist

Eric Basaldua - more commonly through his signature EBAS - was a mainstay of the Top Cow universe. He started working at Top Cow in 2000 under the direct tutelage of Top Cow founder Marc Silvestri. He became one of the Top Guns at Top Cow. A self-professed thong lover, Eric is known for his depictions of beautiful women and sexy artwork. Eric has worked on many fan-favorite comic series, including Hunter-Killer, Witchblade, Tomb Raider, Freshman, The Magdalena, Blood Legacy: The Young Ones, The Darkness, Battle of the Planets, the Darkness/Vampirella crossover written by Terry Moore, and the Witchblade/Wolverine crossover. He provided various covers for Marvel, DC, Rothic, Top Cow and Zenescope.

Risks and challenges

The comicbook is all written and penciled. This Crowd-sourcing is set up mostly for making sure the colorist (Kevin Enhart) will get paid.

Actually I have FOUR books all done like this, most of them even colored as well. So I want to come back here and make this a complete series of oneshots, showcasing new talents during this whole adventure!

About this particular project: I have decided to only do a regular cover and one variant cover, and a third cosplayer cover. This makes me certain the printing will not be a too big of a deal.

Shipping will be done worldwide via the ultra-reliable German postal services as they reside just mere minutes away from my town. The extra perk of this, is the fact that Shipping via Germany is just as reliable as via my own country of the Netherlands, but cheaper for your wallet.

I am even going to try and work out a deal with a distribution partner to make everything move more professional and swift, but that depends on the success of this very first Crowd-sourcing.

I am new at this Crowd-sourcing-game obviously, with Sisterhood #1 being my "official" debut.
The complete art team is really excited about it and have already finished all the artwork for the game (well, with the exception of all the awesome coloring and lettering and graphic design)!

Although are well versed in the industry, we do understand that there are possible unforeseen issues such as:

Manufacture Delays
Shipping Delays
Story Editing Corrections
Over-Robust Stretch Goal Fulfillment

Given this, I am very dedicated and committed to bring you an excellent comic book with quality products to ensure that the first impression to you, beloved backers, will be a great one.

At this convention he met the founder of Broken Frontier and shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard dabbles in editing comics, doing comic book PR, translating comics, stopped working at FACTS in 2016 and has collected a lot of Hot Mummy sketches hoping to turn that into a comic book series in 2018.Markus von Renthe-Fink: Story Editor / backup-story pencillerMarkus' comic book career hit a major road-bump early on when, in his mid-twenties, he had to face the fact that he was living in a comic-book 3rd world country: Germany. "Image Comics" had just been formed, and his dream of ascending into the ranks of superstars such as Silvestri, Campbell, Charest or Lee were shattered by the fact that he would have to move to USA, and his drawing skills, impressive as they were by then, were not quite honed enough to make this a realistic possibility. So - he pretty much stopped drawing altogether, focusing on getting a "real job" as a graphics designer. - - - Fast forward 20 years: at a book signing in Frankfurt he met Greg Capullo, who was kind enough to look through Markus' portfolio. To the German's surprise, he was told by the popular artist that a) his stuff was fairly good and b) nowadays, the "studio system" had virtually ceased to exist: all you needed as a penciller was skills, a scanner and an internet connection. The flame of rekindled hope rose in Markus' eyes like a bonfire. Looking for a project to finally spread his artistic wings, he met jack-of-all-trades Richard Boom through Facebook. The rest is history (in the making): Markus von Renthe-Fink now acts as story editor and continuity assistant on the "Sisterhood" book, as well as drawing a 20-something page origin story about one of the main characters, trying very hard to make up for lost time.Victor Kruithof: writerAt school, Kruithof wanted to become an archeologist, but ended up studying journalism and then information-management in hoping to become a librarian. Eventually he became a mix of both at a financial newspaper. But there was a constant focus his career choices, stories. I always wanted to become a writer. In 2011 he joined a talent-contest for the Dutch smallpress publisher Windmill Comics. It let him to his own comic serial, the UC Masters. Because of his critisism about translations and with the experience at the newspaper he was asked to act as the editor for LoneJim Comics, learning again a different side of storytelling through comics. When the crisis of 2008 and digital innovations finally hit his newspaperjob in 2013, he started to look around for more writingjobs. And thus, the crisis brought him to Boom Art Department and Richard Boom's strange fondness for mummies. Boom had the action figures and building blocks to play with. Kruithof had enough fantasy to give them their own world and give others the opportunity to play in this new world.Diego Magno Loiola: PencilerDiego loved comics and drew since childhood. He grew up, became a collector, continued drawing, graduated in fine arts, did fanzines, illustrations, fanarts and countless stories; some that never came to light and others that became RPG among friends. Then came Sisterhood, not only the first real job opportunity, but how to give life to someone else's ideas, a bulky, imaginative and rewarding job. Diego continues to draw and collect comics!Kevin Enhart: coloristKevin Enhart is a writer for short films and comics, as well as a comic book artist and colorist. Kevin is also working as a cinema production designer and storyboarder. He’s best known for his alternating coloring styles, best suited for each individual project. Kevin’s prior comic book projects include “Puss in Boots”, “Vikings” and he is currently coloring “Warhammer 40.000” and “Anno Dracula”. Audiovisually, he worked on the French film “419” by Eric Bartonio, and commercials for Awkeye Production and Parrot. Enhart is also currently developing his own project named “The Outlaws” published via Markosia in 2019, and preparing his first feature movie.Paulo Teles Yonami: cover artistYonami or Paulo Teles is a designer and Professional illustrator since he was 19 years old, working at the graphic and digital area, illustrating for graphic publications and TV commercials. Pupil of the best illustrators from Hyper Comics (Jucilande Jr. and João Vicente), drawing comics at your hometown (Manaus, Amazon, Brazil) making those for internet and fanzines. A videogame lover (specially 2D games) he always spend some freetimes playing games. Designer by graduation and illustrator by profession, actually Yonami works for GlassHouse Graphics. Today, he lives in São Paulo, working as manager and comic artist. He even launched his ZOMBIESIDE anthology and is now working on his TIME WITCH comic book series.Eric Basaldua: variant cover artistEric Basaldua - more commonly through his signature EBAS - was a mainstay of the Top Cow universe. He started working at Top Cow in 2000 under the direct tutelage of Top Cow founder Marc Silvestri. He became one of the Top Guns at Top Cow. A self-professed thong lover, Eric is known for his depictions of beautiful women and sexy artwork. Eric has worked on many fan-favorite comic series, including Hunter-Killer, Witchblade, Tomb Raider, Freshman, The Magdalena, Blood Legacy: The Young Ones, The Darkness, Battle of the Planets, the Darkness/Vampirella crossover written by Terry Moore, and the Witchblade/Wolverine crossover. He provided various covers for Marvel, DC, Rothic, Top Cow and Zenescope.Risks and challengesThe comicbook is all written and penciled. This Crowd-sourcing is set up mostly for making sure the colorist (Kevin Enhart) will get paid.Actually I have FOUR books all done like this, most of them even colored as well. So I want to come back here and make this a complete series of oneshots, showcasing new talents during this whole adventure!About this particular project: I have decided to only do a regular cover and one variant cover, and a third cosplayer cover. This makes me certain the printing will not be a too big of a deal.Shipping will be done worldwide via the ultra-reliable German postal services as they reside just mere minutes away from my town. The extra perk of this, is the fact that Shipping via Germany is just as reliable as via my own country of the Netherlands, but cheaper for your wallet.I am even going to try and work out a deal with a distribution partner to make everything move more professional and swift, but that depends on the success of this very first Crowd-sourcing.I am new at this Crowd-sourcing-game obviously, with Sisterhood #1 being my "official" debut.The complete art team is really excited about it and have already finished all the artwork for the game (well, with the exception of all the awesome coloring and lettering and graphic design)!Although are well versed in the industry, we do understand that there are possible unforeseen issues such as:Manufacture DelaysShipping DelaysStory Editing CorrectionsOver-Robust Stretch Goal FulfillmentGiven this, I am very dedicated and committed to bring you an excellent comic book with quality products to ensure that the first impression to you, beloved backers, will be a great one.

story:
SONOFBLACKSLAW

A Six Part Mini Series created and written by

Ross Thibodeaux

The Story

For Mason Vaughn, life is busy. If it isn't taking on inner city gangs as a vigilante, it's handling the ups and downs of his new interracial relationship with his girlfriend Samantha. However, things take a decidedly different turn when he finally meets Sam's disapproving uncle/surrogate father and former '70's vigilante Deacon "Black's Law" Black and becomes inspired, much like a certain millionaire playboy was inspired by a certain creature of the night, to adopt Deacon's feared and forgotten persona for his own crimefighting needs introducing the world to the new face of justice...SONOFBLACKSLAW(Son of Black's Law)!

Meanwhile a new evil rises with a plan so heinous, so despicable that only an unlikely alliance between the two men(of course) stands a chance against it. But before ebony and ivory can live together in harmony one question still remains: Does Deacon REALLY have a problem with the color of Mason's skin or is he just being overprotective of his niece?  Find out in this light-hearted satire with a serious "after taste" which takes aim at social, economical, political and pop culture events and icons. Set all that against a Batman-meets-blaxploitation(Sweetback's Badass Song, Shaft, Black Dynamite and Django Unchained) backdrop and you have yourself a masked vigilante story unlike any other.

The Team

The creative team consists of comic book vet Jason Johnson(Wetworks, Godstorm) providing the artwork, colorist James Rochelle giving us a tapestry of color from page to page as well as a few others working in comics namely Kody Chamberlain(Sweets, Punks) Rob Guillory(Chew) and Burt Durand(Horseecomics) supplying us with some cool perks in exchange for your help. Finally of course, yours truly as creator, writer and grandmaster of the project.

The Perks

In exchange for your contributions we have great perks set up. The way they work is you choose which one you want at it's designated price and once the campaign is over you'll have whichever one you chose sent out to you! There are also combined tiers. For example, say you pick up the Ultimate Team-up perk for $75, you'll get whatever new item that tier added plus all the tiers before it all for $75! Get it? On tap will be full color posters, sketch books, original artwork, digital comic book downloads, trading cards, original scripts and much more! And hey, if you can't spare the cash then simply share this campaign with your buds. The more people we get talking about this thing the better.

Where Does My Contribution Go?

I know that goal looks intimidating and you might be thinking,"All that for a comic book?!" To get the artwork done for the entire mini series plus the cost of producing, packaging and shipping the perks out to contributers and the fees involved with the campaign being hosted by this site that amount should near us to completion. However, if we don't reach our goal then whatever funds generated will definitely be a jump start we didn't have before and for that we thank you.

Final Thoughts

Sonofblackslaw isn't just an opportunity for me to mash a few genres together but it's also a chance for me to speak out on the grudge I have against what I see going on in our society, in the world. Call me a hopeless optimist but I really do believe we can do a lot better and it all starts with the central theme of my story, us getting along and working together. If my humble project can convey that subtle message buried beneath a fun and exciting story then mission accomplished.

story:
Update:
 Fastmore Logistics has volunteered to donate the entire cost of shipping our new Hulk statue from L.A. Boxing in California to The Northlake Library!

They will be picking up the Hulk this Tuesday and will be bringing him to their warehouse where will freshen him up and get him ready for the unveiling party at the library.
Check back soon for an exact date for the unveiling!

 

 

Thanks to all of you we did it!

 

If you are just hearing about our project now and would still like to help you can always contact us at the library (708) 562-2301

 or email us at tom.mukite@yahoo.com. We are still accepting donations for the perks you see listed that aren't sold for the next couple weeks since it takes a while for us to clear the indiegogo money.

 

WE HAVE A HULK!!!

STEVE WILLIAMS OF L.A. BOXING IN ORANGE, CALIFORNIA HAS OFFERED TO DONATE THEIR 9 FOOT HULK STATUE! If you're in the LA area go thank them for us! 

THIS MEANS THAT ALL THE FUNDS RAISED HERE CAN GO TOWARDS THE TECH ITEMS AND BOOKS! WE ARE ONLY A GRAND OR SO AWAY FROM BEING ABLE TO GET ALL THE TECHNOLOGY ITEMS! 

Please keep pushing us to all of your friends in these final few days! Thank you all for all of your support! 

A preview of the newest resident of Northlake before he hangs up his gloves! 

 

His gloves will be coming off. 

Help the Northlake Public Library get a 9-foot-tall Incredible Hulk statue, graphic novels and a creation station featuring:

  • iMac with a drawing pad
  • Editing software
  • Cintiq interactive pen display
  • 3D printer
  • Artograph Light Tracer Elite 
Libraries are constantly changing and evolving beyond just a place to do school work and use the internet. Today’s libraries are celebrating creativity, entertainment and life long learning, and they are doing it with technology and popular materials including graphic novels. The problem is that many people still think of libraries in the old way. We want to smash that stuffy reputation with a 9 foot tall Incredible Hulk Statue. 

Why The Hulk? Just as Dr. Bruce Banner transforms into the Hulk, we want our library community members to make their own personal transformations through books, programs, and awesome new equipment. This larger-than-life literary character will become a giant green beacon of light to highlight our graphic novel collection, our creation station…not to mention the library’s sense of humor and whimsy. The project will show off the fun side of the library and get the community talking. The HULK will force patrons to look at the library in a whole new way.

Art Spiegelman, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of Maus, once said that “comics are a gateway drug to literacy.” We want people of all ages to start reading these addictive and powerful books. Help us grow our collection to epic proportions.

We also want to promote digital literacy and provide patrons with a spot where they can create their own comics, art, movies and experiment with digital design and photo editing. We want to provide patrons with a glimpse into the future with cutting edge technology like 3D printers.

For the average household these resources are cost prohibitive, but with your help, we can provide them to an entire community!

We want everyone who helps this project to be able to take advantage of everything we get so be assured that if you come to the library even if you don't have a Northlake library card you will be able to use our new technology that this project provides. 

Here is everything and a few ideas of what can be done with them: 

 

The statue will attract new readers to the library as well as highlight the graphic novel collection.

 

With an iMac, patrons will be able to edit videos, images and even podcasts. With the drawing tablet, they will also be able to draw their own comics.

 

 

With the Cintiq, patrons will be able to use the same machine that many modern comic artists use to create comics!

 

With the 3D printer, patrons will be able to bring their designs to life. If they create a new character they can design and print a action figure of it. Of course it has many more uses such as making prototypes of new products.

With the Light Tracer Elite, our younger patrons will be able to practice drawing and tracing. Our older patrons who would like to create comics by hand will find this a useful tool to make final edits of their work.

Plus many more graphic novels for both kids and adults. You will be able to request them to be sent to your library if you aren't a patron of the Northlake Public Library District! Here is our tumblr list of some of the newest adult graphic novels you can browse through now. 

If we do not raise the full amount, we will first use the funds to purchase the statue, then a mix of technology and graphic novels.

If we don't raise enough to purchase the statue, we will use the funds to purchase new graphic novels. This is just the back-up plan as we fully intend to reach our goal to get everything. 

 

About The Perks: 

 

 

NEW PERKS! 

                        V IS FOR VILLAINS pack! 

 

Like metal/industrial music? Check out this local comicbook inspired band! 

In the V is for Villains pack you'll get the following: 

One Mr. Agitator T-Shirt, One Fallon Flynn T-Shirt, Once Evolve or Die CD, One 8x11 V is for Villains Photo, and a set of V is for Villains trading cards (4 total). All signed! Please tell us your size after you claim this perk! WE ONLY HAVE ONE PACK SO ACT NOW BEFORE IT IS GONE! 

If you haven't heard them yet click on their picture to be taken to their website! 

 ----------------------------------------------------------

Rock and Metal fans check this out! 

Rebel radio is donating a package with a pair of tickets for any show they are giving away tickets for.  you can pick from some upcoming shows they have tickets for are: Marilyn Manson, Rush, Gigantour etc. Plus, you'll get a Rebel Radio swag pack including a T-shirt, postcard and some cds depending on your taste in music. ALL SHOWS ARE IN THE CHICAGOLAND AREA.  

 

Click on Rebel Radio's banner to listen to them! 

 

Author Myke Cole has donated 5 autographed copies of each of his military fantasy novels Shadow Ops: Fortress Frontier and Shadow Ops: Control Point!  

 

 

 

 

 

Artist/Writer Jeffrey Brown has donated 8 Double sided sketches from his upcoming book KIDS ARE WEIRD. Own a piece of rare original art from the creator of Vader and Son, Vader and Princess, Cats Are Weird, The Incredible Change-Bots etc! 

Each one is different buy one or buy all eight! 

 

 

 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 

We've made the news! 

A.V. Club  

"Anyone who's ever been transformed by a library book or stolen those little library pencils for personal use and wants to pay the experience forward and/or backward...and donate." 

The Huffington Post  Called us "Awesome"

The Guardian (UK) Said "The Project is a real winner."

 

Geek Girl Chicago  Says we have a surplus of heart and this is a valuable investment! 

 

Franklin Park Herald-Journal  Has a bit of the backstory to our project. 

Geekosystem   "..think about how much better the world would be if all libraries had giant superhero statues in them." 

Tech Crunch Says  "Northlake’s creation-friendly angle is an intriguing one."

 Chicago's Red Eye

visited us at the library! 

 Maxim Magazine gives you a couple great ideas for which perk to pick out!

-----

 

FAQ:

 

Are you using tax money on this project?

 

NO, this is a self funded project.  The only money used for it is coming from donations. This is why your donations are important.

 

Why not use tax money to get new technologies and books?

 

Due to budget cuts this is the only way we can afford new technology and graphic novels.

 

I don't live in the USA can I still donate? 

YES! However if you're recieving something in the mail please include extra for shipping. Contact us and we can tell you how much extra. If it is the postcard we will take care of the extra shipping. 

 

 

Can I donate graphic novels or comics to the library to be used as a prize or for your shelfs? 

Absolutely! Give us a call at the library or message us on here!

 

 

A message from the director of the Northlake Public Library District concerning the Hulk project.

 

 

DONATE NOW THEN COME PARTY WITH US! 

WE WILL ALSO ACCEPT CASH DONATIONS AT THE BAR. 

CLICK ON THE FLYER FOR MORE INFO AND THE FACEBOOK EVENT INVITE TO RSVP. 

POSSUM'S PUB IS LOCATED AT 2324 N. Mannheim Road, Melrose Park, Illinois 60164

-----------------------------------------------------------

 THE FOLLOWING ARE ALL SOLD OUT! SORRY! 

 

If you haven't read Hoax Hunters yet it is in our catalog click the picture to see more.

One of our favorite writers Micheal Moreci has two graphic novels out this year. Hoax Hunters: Volume 1 and ReincarNATE -you get them both signed with a "terrible sketch" in them (he is a writer).  

 

Those of you who love Anne Rice books will love this graphic novel adaption of Interview with The Vampire signed by the artist Ashley Marie Witter.

 

 

 

Does your son or daughter love fire trucks or has dreams of being a fireman? You can get them a pizza party at the Northlake Fire Department including a ride from the Northlake Public Library to the fire house in a fire truck! 

 

THE FANTASTIC MARK WAID HAS DONATED FIVE PERSONALIZED COPIES OF THE NEWEST HULK GRAPHIC NOVEL.

 

 

 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 Those are some of the limited perks. We have many more perks to put up as soon as these are claimed! 

 

Please help us Hulk-smash our goal and bring the exciting world of comics to all ages! Even if you can't donate right now you can help by telling all your friends about this project and sharing it on your Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and other social media platforms! 

If you have any questions about this project or just want to talk to us come visit us at the library or call us at (708) 562-2301.

Absolutely! Give us a call at the library or message us on here! 
 
 
A message from the director of the Northlake Public Library District concerning the Hulk project.
 
 
DONATE NOW THEN COME PARTY WITH US! 
WE WILL ALSO ACCEPT CASH DONATIONS AT THE BAR. 

CLICK ON THE FLYER FOR MORE INFO AND THE FACEBOOK EVENT INVITE TO RSVP. 
POSSUM'S PUB IS LOCATED AT 2324 N. Mannheim Road, Melrose Park, Illinois 60164
-----------------------------------------------------------
 THE FOLLOWING ARE ALL SOLD OUT! SORRY! 
 

If you haven't read Hoax Hunters yet it is in our catalog click the picture to see more.
One of our favorite writers Micheal Moreci has two graphic novels out this year. Hoax Hunters: Volume 1 and ReincarNATE -you get them both signed with a "terrible sketch" in them (he is a writer).  
 

Those of you who love Anne Rice books will love this graphic novel adaption of Interview with The Vampire signed by the artist Ashley Marie Witter.
 
 
 
Does your son or daughter love fire trucks or has dreams of being a fireman? You can get them a pizza party at the Northlake Fire Department including a ride from the Northlake Public Library to the fire house in a fire truck! 
 
THE FANTASTIC MARK WAID HAS DONATED FIVE PERSONALIZED COPIES OF THE NEWEST HULK GRAPHIC NOVEL.

 
 
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 

 Those are some of the limited perks. We have many more perks to put up as soon as these are claimed! 

 
Please help us Hulk-smash our goal and bring the exciting world of comics to all ages! Even if you can't donate right now you can help by telling all your friends about this project and sharing it on your Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter and other social media platforms! 
If you have any questions about this project or just want to talk to us come visit us at the library or call us at (708) 562-2301.

story:
Brendon Burns is quite dismayed with the live comedy scene in the UK and deep down, he knows you are too. A scene he used to love, but now seems more preoccupied with selling beer and immediate identifiability than finding a voice or even a point of view not normally heard. 

So he and a few friends have decided to follow in the footsteps of the likes of Doug Stanhope and Patton Oswalt in the US and leave the comedy clubs behind and tour absolutely anything but. From zoos to pug cafes, from old indy music venues to comic book stores. The important thing is we distance ourselves enough from the circuit feeder system that only those with their ears to the ground will even know it's happening. Fans that are truly passionate about stand up and are sick to death of having their opportunity to see one of their favourite comedians in their local club ruined because a stag do didn't know when to shut the fuck up. Fans that are OK with sensitive subject matter and digging a little deeper to read the subtext within a bit without some idiot booing because frankly, they're drunk, have completely missed the point and are operating on their own unwitting prejudices. 

This crowdsourcing campaign is to help with a tour bus, travel, accom and just a little bit of PR. If we raise over the stakes, hopefully we'll be able to film it for release. We want to keep the ticket prices down so we are offering some very very cool shit. In fact the perks are very much part of the tour. Ultimately we want to do a gig in your house for you and your friends. Or if you think you have a venue that suits our needs please contact michael@perfectstrangerscomedy.com

This industry sucks and it's not getting better anytime soon. So let's run and hide. Who doesn't find us is just as important as who does.

story:
Original Mario Gully's very 1st Sketchbook :

Introducing Original Mario Gully's very first Sketchbook ever made !

O

Original Mario Gully (OMG) has created the ultra-popular ANT (Image Comics) and has worked for every major Publisher in the USA (From Marvel Comics to Dynamite Entertainement).

For the very 1st time, OMG has decided to show his work on a Sketchbook where you will find he latest work, latest commissions and  actual printed pages from his Heavy Metal book, and more !

The sketchbook will be 32 pages (B&W) + Color Cover !

You hear us right, 32 pages of Awesome OMG ART !!!


We need your support !

OMG needs you to support the project. 

The money we will raise will pay for printing and production as well as paying the artist for his awesome work.

This is the opportunity who've been waiting for to buy Original Mario Gully Material, signed books, collector's items and original art !

If we succeed, the extra-money will be used in order to bring you more pages ! 

Rare & limited edition !

The sketchbook will exist only if you support the project and share it with friends on social medias.

This is a rare opportunity to own the 1st edition to the 1st OMG  Sketchbook ever (Very Rare).

This sketchbook is a limited self-published edition by OMG COMICS

Write history !

Mario Gully's work over the years has reach very high standards level. He's now ready to work on a major mainstream book. In order to fullfill his dream, please support this very special project, which is the 1st step to stardom. 

Want to see OMG on a monthly Batman book ? 

It's your chance to make him famous. 

Buy his sketchbook before he's too busy drawing 22 pages of Batman a month !

    Unlock the extra-steps !

    The intial goal is to reach $3,000. 

    If we suceed, we have big plans for you. 

    We need to go over 100% to unlock the next steps. 

    Who said more pages on the sketchbook ? 

    Share it !

    You can also bring your support by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and every other social Media. The key to success is sharing. Please help us to spread the word worldwide !

    Thanks for reading this !

    Support :

    We'd like to thank our partner in the amazing adventure : Comics Place

story:
BACKGROUND

“Voluntaryist” is the story of a superhero pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all. He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the U.S. armed forces. 

This is a special issue with other characters in the Voluntaryist team.

When the U.S. government decides to test a new mind control chemical on the public, they get more brain-for-the-buck than they hoped for! Zombification leads to Keynesian-style economic “stimulus” and a relentless inquiry of, “Who will build the roads?” Fortunately, the liberty-loving ladies of Voluntaryist might be able to to curtail the chaos…but can they do it without violating the N.A.P.? Find out and join us on this next issue of Voluntaryist – The Comic Series!

In this issue we bring you the leading ladies: Voluntaria, AnCat, and Agora! 

Learn more about them in their character profile at the end of this page.

What We Need & What You Get

    GOAL: To create this special issue Voluntaryist comic to include:
      • 17 Comic Pages
      • 1 Ad Page
      • The Cover

If we do not reach our goal (but we will thanks to you!), we will do a rewrite of the original script to the funding raised and present the Voluntaryists vs. Statist Zombies tale in a shorter scripting.

    You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

    You can redeem AWESOME perks for your support such as:

    --->$1 – A personal “thank-you” will be made by having your name read among others in a Youtube video. (Aliases are permitted but must be specifically stated and PG rated.)

    --->$5– A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this.

    --->$10 – The comic in .pdf format. - Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

    --->$15 Sticker + Comic in .pdf format - A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you + the Comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$25– A Voluntaryist character page print on 8 1/2 x 11 paper signed by Jaime Sherman + comic in .pdf format- Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$35– Signed PRINT COPY of the comic. - Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$60 – Back Issue + Zombie Issue – Receive a signed #1 Special Edition and a signed print copy of the zombie comic. 

    --->$80 Voluntaryist Tee – Get a Voluntaryist T-Shirt! Choose a color (Red, Black, White) and a character (Voluntaryist or Voluntaria) + .pdf comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$100 – Voluntaryists vs. Statist Zombies Poster – Receive an incredible 13” x 19” poster of Voluntaryists vs. Statist Zombies + .pdf comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.


    --->$150 – PinUp – Get a Vountaria 13” x 19”  Pinup poster in ink outline reprint + .pdf comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$250 –Voluntaria or AnCat ACTION FIGURE by The Official Sinister Customs. Get your unique Voluntaria or AnCat action figure made by the talented Nathan Essex of Sinister Customs. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

    --->$300 – 1/4 page Ad Sponsor -Get an advertisement (PG rated) for half a comic page. (Limited to 4 Sponsors).

    --->$400 -Website Ad Right Bar, Top Position – Receive an ad on the Voluntaryist Website to last for 6 months. Approximately 200 pixels x 300 pixels 72 dpi - template to be sent to purchaser. (Must send your ad to be placed. PG rated.)

    --->$500 BE DRAWN INTO A ZOMBIE. Have you ever wanted to experience zombifiction? Get turned into a zombie comic character and appear in the issue! Also receive a print copy of the comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. (NOTE: Final design and implementation final design is subject to our approval. We will do our best to make it great!)

    Production

    This issue will be produced primarily after the campaign is over, so the comic will be sent to you a few months after the 60 days are up.

    However, we will give you teasers, sketches, and tidbits on our Website, http://volcomic.com so you can learn more about the backstory in anticipation of the comic's release.

The Impact

Your support brings new characters in the Voluntaryist series to life! Not only that, it provides a new medium to reach others about the message of liberty. For example,

  • Imagine you are reading the comic while waiting for coffee and someone asks what it is about.
  • Imagine you are reading the comic while relaxing at a park and someone upon seeing your copy searches the cover title online, discovering Voluntaryism!
  • Imagine you tell your friends about it and they get engaged with the concept of Voluntaryism because it is presented from an action comic with zombies!

Other Ways You Can Help  -- IMPORTANT --

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

FACEBOOK:
http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary

YOUTUBE: http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

WEBSITE: http://volcomic.com

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Jaime at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

READ THE FIRST ISSUE FOR FREE: http://voluntaryists.wordpress.com/free-comic-download/

If we raise more than $1,500 ABOVE the goal ($6,000), we will do a run of Voluntarist action figures. Those who contribute $50 or more will receive one and this perk will be unlocked for purchase. (Size and quantity depending on sourcing.)

PROTOTYPE (NOT NECESSARILY THE FINAL FORM) BELOW BY NATHAN E.: THE OFFICIAL SINISTER CUSTOMS: https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Official-Sinister-Customs/275732929111744


If we raise more than $3,000 above the goal ($7,500), we will create an animated reading of the comic to be placed onto YouTube. 


Voluntaria – (Christine Black) She was a street cop whose attitudes toward the state changed when she had to do a no-knock raid on a residence. During the raid, she watched officers point guns at little children living in the home and was forever changed. On her way home that night, tearful at the wheel, she was struck by the cosmic radiation. She gained healing abilities, super-strength, flight power, the ability to blow ice cold breath, and an keen sense of other's intentions - so strong it could be considered a 6th sense for those lying.

Agora – (Etephania Fernandez) A Brazilian woman who had been forced into sex slavery. She gets hit by the cosmic event radiation and breaks free, killing her captors. She has enhanced healing and enhanced strength. Agora can turn on an "angelic" state which permits flight and eye beams. When in the angelic state, she can forge an energy staff which acts as a powerful wave-weapon. She also has telepathy with animals. Agora’s passion for liberty came from what she witnessed while in captivity. The local government officials received kick-backs from the sex slavers and, often, were customers themselves. 

AnCat – (Felicity Childs) She was holding her dear cat when she was hit by the black-hole energy. Her cat died but part of the cat’s DNA was mixed with her, giving her “feline sense” for danger and pain of others, enhanced scent power, and springy flexibility. Main power is zero-point energy, which allows her to freeze objects within the energy, subject to a strain on her brain much like exhausting a muscle. Above-human healing and strength. AnCat’s love for liberty stems from her deep desire for privacy and the government taking away her cats. At one time, she had 20, all well taken care of indoors, but the city limited cat ownership to 3.

story:
My Story

Hi everyone! My name is Leyre, and i am spanish.  I'm an illustrator and I am currently in Bangkok working on a new project: "Bangkok underwater".
My project is a graphic novel about Bangkok and the hard time the city is going through as a consequence of the floods. It is also a personal vision of the city, its bustling streets and its people, a portrait of its everyday life in which I provide an account of what is happening through drawings and text.
Upon getting here and going out for a walk I was surprised by the amount of people in the street that were smiling. A lot of them were leaving there homes, carrying their belongings on their heads and backs, or loading them into makeshift boats, the water the height of their chest. Various areas of the city are immersed in chaos, whole avenues completely flooded, shops shut down, houses underwater, and people dying electrocuted or bitten by venomous snakes.
IÂ´m going to finish the graphic novel in the next five months, which is the time to spend in Bangkok. The drawings are made in watercolor and pen, size smaller at a din A4.


The Impact


The donation from you will go directly to support the publishing of " Disaster Survival Handbook" - a series  of collective guidelines visualizing how an individual can save his/her life and the life of others in the time of disasters.

With your support, these handbooks will be distributed to the underprivileged children in the slums of Bangkok particularly those who live in the flood-affected areas. The handbook is meant to be creatively informative and entertaining to brighten up the children's days. We hope that with this great little step together, we can help the children to be equipped with knowledge and skills to tackle with the uncertainty of disasters in the future.

To help make Life of the underprivileged children more resilient to disasters, we cordially invite you to take this journey with us. It is a long way to go but we never hesitate to begin every single step optimistically.

The projects and activities they are developing can be seen on their website: 

http://www.designfordisasters.org/

Design for Disasters - D4D


Formed in January 2010, design for Disaster or D4D is made up of young designers, artist and academics. Gerenal public is also welcome to share ideas and find long-term solutions for everyone to be prepared for natural disasters, particularly those resulting from extreme weather, which may attack the city any moment.

Without an obligation, members are committed to help whit any projects, based on their expertise and schedule. Each project, therefore, will see regulars tapping hands and new faces.

D4D- anon profit network formed out of our "intentionalism" rather than "capitalism"- is a research network and aims to became a platform to exchange the information and knowledge, as well as to encourage people to become " open -minded to understand", through designs and creativities- we also encourage cooperation betwen government agencies, private sectors and non-government organizations, in order to encourage peace, safety, resilience and sustainability in Thailand and the world.




What We Need & What You Get

The money I need is 3000 dollars. 70% of this, I am going to donate to the NGO Design for Disaster.
The remaining 30% I need to print my graphic novel. It will be printed in color will be 50 to 60 pages long, so it will be quite expensive to print. The money I'm spending here in Bangkok to be here and work on the project is my own savings, nobody is helping me, so all money I can get would be appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help
Tweet or blog about us!

Tell a friend using the share tools.
Watch our campaign and get our weekly updates.
Post  this campaign in the press.


THANKS A LOT

With your support, these handbooks will be distributed to the underprivileged children in the slums of Bangkok particularly those who live in the flood-affected areas. The handbook is meant to be creatively informative and entertaining to brighten up the children's days. We hope that with this great little step together, we can help the children to be equipped with knowledge and skills to tackle with the uncertainty of disasters in the future.


To help make Life of the underprivileged children more resilient to disasters, we cordially invite you to take this journey with us. It is a long way to go but we never hesitate to begin every single step optimistically.

The projects and activities they are developing can be seen on their website: 
http://www.designfordisasters.org/



Design for Disasters - D4D


Formed in January 2010, design for Disaster or D4D is made up of young designers, artist and academics. Gerenal public is also welcome to share ideas and find long-term solutions for everyone to be prepared for natural disasters, particularly those resulting from extreme weather, which may attack the city any moment.
Without an obligation, members are committed to help whit any projects, based on their expertise and schedule. Each project, therefore, will see regulars tapping hands and new faces.
D4D- anon profit network formed out of our "intentionalism" rather than "capitalism"- is a research network and aims to became a platform to exchange the information and knowledge, as well as to encourage people to become " open -minded to understand", through designs and creativities- we also encourage cooperation betwen government agencies, private sectors and non-government organizations, in order to encourage peace, safety, resilience and sustainability in Thailand and the world.





What We Need & What You Get
The money I need is 3000 dollars. 70% of this, I am going to donate to the NGO Design for Disaster.The remaining 30% I need to print my graphic novel. It will be printed in color will be 50 to 60 pages long, so it will be quite expensive to print. The money I'm spending here in Bangkok to be here and work on the project is my own savings, nobody is helping me, so all money I can get would be appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet or blog about us!Tell a friend using the share tools.Watch our campaign and get our weekly updates.Post  this campaign in the press.

THANKS A LOT

story:
What's the project about?

    Train of Thoughts is a project by Crimzon studio. It will be an anthology of Graphic Novel stories based on the famous Mumbai Local Trains, each story pen down by different writers with their traveler’s experience from Mumbai in collaboration with artists around the globe expressing their visual take on Mumbai Local Trains. We start off with the first story “The Bridge” 

What's the first story about?

“The Bridge” is a 25 page story which talks about the journey of four people in an ordinary day-to-day ride, which millions take. In that simple mundane though, something bizarre happens. That uncanny thing... is it the traveler’s thought or something else?!?

One of the Characters, Hautechand, does not want to step into the trains, the reason is not on the concious level but lies in his sub-conscious. he is one who stands out in this crowd but he makes the crowd too just like a drop of water makes the ocean.

Kolmibai is a drop in the ocean like Hautechand, but her story and one journey of hers breaks the monotony of life and leads to a self-revelation.

Talking of self-revelations there is Vibhuti a timid and scared girl who meets her strong inner being all because of a man who drives her to the edge. He pushes her to such an extent and threshold, where the only place left, is for courage and self-confidence.

The stories of these people on the surface of it would seem commonplace and as a traveler you too would feel the same but there is a BRIDGE that takes us into the depths of our consciousness.

So what is that Bridge, is it a state of limbo, or the ways of the Heavens? Some Divine intervention? Or a way to Wisdom? Come travel with us in this Train of Thought which takes you to the other side of the bridge and know what really transpires...

Why have we chosen indigogo?

    We have chosen Indigogo because it allows us as artists to connect with the world and at the same time allows the world to connect with our work. Train of Thoughts is about masses and we wish to present it to masses…


Preview Pages

Deadline

    We have completed the script and we are looking at finishing the book within 3 to 4 months after the funding period. Which includes production of pages, editing, printing, also printing of the perks and everything needed making it a ready to ship final product.

Perks




Extended Goals

Future Plans

    We have next three stories ready along with a few preview pages, waiting to be produced one after another. Our Future Plan is to continue sharing our experience on the global platform, to continue this story-telling process and create an anthology. We hope you like the first insight into Mumbai’s lifeline. Once you connect with our little universe and feel one with it, there will be more stories on the Mumbai Local Trains. It is a box filled with some eccentric, some dramatic, some scary but engaging stories.

Other Ways to Help

    If you cannot Contribute we can understand, but we would appreciate a little push from you to reach the goal by:
1. Help us get the word out by sharing this campaign with others who might be able to help in any which ways.
2. Like & Share our facebook page to stay up-to-date with the project.
3. Like & Share our Crimzon Studio page.
4. Bring a smile to our face! Leave us a comment on our FB page and we know we have reached out to you :)

Team

Writer:-    Khushnaz Bode.
Pencils:-  Leonardo Vergari.
Inks:-       Leonardo Vergari / Amit Ghadge.
Colors:-   Amit Ghadge.
Letters:-  Khushnaz Bode.

links

You can keep a track of updates and follow as here:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Train-of-Thoughts/1435341163366119
https://www.facebook.com/crimzonstudio
http://crimzonstudio.com/

Contact Us

You can directly contact us for any FAQ at:
crimzonstudio@gmail.com

Thnxx.
Amit Ghadge.

story:
Short Summary

ABOUT

Eisner Award Nominee and multi Glyph Award winning artist N. Steven Harris and writer/creator Robert Garrett are attempting to catapult their 2014 Glyph Award winning property for Best Female Character, AJALA: A SERIES OF ADVENTURES, into the realm of multi-media by initiating an Indiegogo campaign to complete the first compelling arc of the young Harlem heroine. Awareness has been growing over the past few months and with some promotional and financial support, we will be able to complete issue #4 as well as create a hard cover version of the collected 1-4 issues. These issues can also be solicited to libraries and bookstores across the country. AJALA is a property that addresses the comics’ diversity issue by having a well rounded, three dimensional female character of color that operates in the context of family and community as well as showcases a diverse supporting group of characters. We are confident this will be worth your time. 


ABOUT AJALA

The series was Co-created and written by Robert Garrett, founder of XMOOR STUDIOS, with beautiful graphic support from Co-creator and illustrator N. Steven Harris.

The sci-fi coming of age story revolves around 13-year-old AJALA STORM, a junior in high school who lives in a mythical neighborhood in Harlem, NY.  Focused upon the Storms and their heroic family history that goes back generations when their great Grandfather helped found a covert group known as the C.S.C. or Community Spirit Center. The C.S.C. were made up of businessmen, teachers, and community activists dedicated  to cleaning  up the streets of Harlem in the 1920’s.  AJALA: A SERIES OF ADVENTURES is a comedy/drama/action comic, similar to female version of James Bond who hasn’t quite grasped the role. 

AJALA is a larger than life character with teenage ambition and angst. She’s a covert operative in training to protect her community under the tutorage of a by-the-books operative who has never broken a rule in his life. In the first issues, we look to establish what this ultra secret group her family helped to start, The C.S.C. may have become an uncontrollable entity. In these series of books we 

with AJALA’s coming of age story with vast dynamics of a socially conscious society and its history and of a legendary community fighting to keep its relevance.


PREVIEW PENCILS FROM AJALA BOOK #4


THE CREATORS

Robert Garrett

President and founder of XMOOR STUDIOS and creator of several self published titles, such as GALTOW, HERO BORN, TOOL-BOI and INHERITORS: which was adapted into a movie short which Mr. Garrett scripted and co-produced. Currently, in addition to writing AJALA, he will be featuring two more properties in 2015 including his Second Novella in the HOUSE OF GALES fantasy series.

N. Steven Harris

Eisner nominated and Glyph Award winning artist, Mr. Harris is an industry veteran that has worked for every major comic book company. From co-creating DC Comic’s Aztek, along with Grant Morrison and Mark Millar, to co-creating and creating his own properties in AJALA and Brotherhood of the Fringe, respectively.

WALT BARNA MSZONA


A great Artist from Africa, Walt will be sharing the Illustrating workflow with Steven Harris. As well as doing the coloring and lettering of the books


REWARDS

JOHN JENNINGS CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE COVER


AJALA 11X17 PRINTS

POSTER BY WALT BARNA MSONZA


POSTER BY JOHN JENNINGS

POSTER BY CHRISCROSS X

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out the AJALA A SERIES OF ADVENTURES Vol. 1. Especially if you backed it! None of this would be possible if it wasn't for the support from you. 

Please also help to spread the word and share this INDIE GOGO CAMPAIGN all over the place. Either it be on your social media channels or a random passerby, anything helps and goes a long way. We'll be forever grateful!  

Risks and challenges

The team and I are currently working on Issue #4 the last issue in Vol. 1. As well as all graphic design elements that need to be finalized before sending everything off to the printers.

We feel even more confident about getting this one out to everyone within (if not before) the estimated delivery time.

As life itself is full of many surprises, there are always possibilities for delays. If any do arise, I will notify and keep everyone up-to-date.
